loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto, tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de herramientas para realizar trabajos, fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra para la asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar una buena aplicación de productos y hacer un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de suelo y topografía que cuenta la propiedad para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto o mediano plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 43, is married and lives with his children and wife, who are his greatest priority.

With his loan he hopes to buy work tools, fertilizer, and fungicide, and pay for labor for assistance with the coffee.  In this way he will guarantee the products are well applied and do a good job.  What he hopes for is to take advantage of the good soil and topographic conditions he has for this crop on his property.  He also wants to put into practice his experience managing coffee, buying the best products of the best quality so his crop will be healthy and grow well, and to have a suitable production in the short or medium term.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to maintain the coffee.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, tiene la edad  de 33 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y foliares para asistir su terreno de café. El con esta asistencia pretende mejorar su plantación de café úes actualmente quedo en condiciones regulares para producir este año. El tiene planeado abonarlo y darle a su plantación más fuerza para aumentar la cosecha este próximo año y aumentar ganancias. El quiere con esta mejora obtener de su cafetal una mejor producción para salir adelante con la estabilidad económica de su hogar y tener un futuro económico cada día mejor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rafael, aged 33, is married and lives with his wife and their two children. They are the top priority in his life. He intends to use the loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer and foliar feed to improve his coffee plantation. This expected improvement will keep his field in good condition for this year's crop. He plans to fertilize his plantation to enhance its vigor and increase his harvest this coming year, and earn a higher income. With this improvement he wants to get a better coffee harvest in order to secure the financial stability of his home and have a brighter economic future day after day.

This is Rafael's first loan from the microfinance institution Fudecosur. He has not yet had a loan from one of the state-run banks, but Fudecosur offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to improve his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Evelyn Susana

texts.es: Evelyn Susana, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está en unión libre, vive con su esposa y su hijo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar los insumos necesarios para asistir sus siembras como son los fertilizantes y herbicidas. Ella y su esposo cuentan con un terreno donde lo trabajan entre ellos dos que actualmente está sembrado de maíz y frijol para su consumo y posterior venta. Ella tiene planeado asistirlo para así aumentar el nivel de la producción del cultivo y mejorar su estabilidad económica para el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes o tros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Evelyn Susana is 24, and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her husband and her child, who are her greatest priority. With the loan she is going to buy the supplies she needs to maintain her crops, such as fertilizers and herbicides. 

She and her husband have a piece of land which they work between the two of them. Currently it is planted in corn and beans, both for their own use and for later sale.

She plans to maintain it, in order to increase the production level of the crop and improve her future financial stability. This is the first loan she has received from Fudecosur. She had not previously had other loans from regular banks, but Fudecosur has offered her the loan with easier terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To maintain her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA;la socia continua trabajando en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes vendiendo arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas,cerveza entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,siendo de esta manera que la  socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como leche y aceite.

La socia se siente agradecida con el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en la plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Las Hijas de María" communal bank. She continues to work in her grocery store business, selling rice, sugar, milk, candy, soft drinks, beer and other products. 

The borrower has been in this business for some time, which is going well, thanks to the effort she devotes to it every day. This is how she is raising her family. The borrower is a cheerful and responsible person, with a strong desire to continue working.

She is applying for the loan to buy merchandise such as milk and cooking oil for her store.

The borrower feels grateful for the loan she has been granted, and promises to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as milk and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa María es un comité del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, está integrado por once mujeres trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy luchadoras.
Nancy es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que su grupo con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena clientela pues siempre tiene muy buena variedad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, como ser cerveza, gaseosas, vinos y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostrumbrados.
texts.en:
The "Santa María" group is a communal bank under the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women) communal bank program of Fundación Paraguaya. It is made up of 11 hard-working women, who are above all, very determined.

Nancy is chair of the group, and tells us that her group has been able to succeed and grow through a great deal of sacrifice and effort. She sells drinks and it is going very well. This is because she has a very good clientele, as she always has a very good selection.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy drinks, such as beer, soft drinks, wines and others, enabling her to continue offering her customers the variety to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: To buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a 40-year-old widow. She has five children and a dependent. She has to meet all of their needs and therefore does agriculture to sustain her family, as she lives in the countryside. Jovia grows beans, millet, and bananas, which she uses for her household and also sells in case she has any pressing demands like paying school fees. She supplements her income from agriculture with a small retail shop, where she sells day-to-day home use items.

Jovia now wants 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) to buy a piece of land so that she can expand her farm and also graze animals. She is limited by the small piece of land at the moment. She hopes to buy a bigger piece of land when she gets money.  

Jovia is hard working, which is why she has been able to sustain her family after the death of her husband.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with a four-year-old child who is enrolled in school. She is married to a businessman, and they live in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.

Regina has sold spare parts for cars for the last two years. She sells her spare parts from her shop to the general public.

Regina joined Yehu because she felt it was the best microfinance institution for her. She will use her 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 42 years old. He lives in a small village with his family, which includes his wife, Nana; his parents (both of them are pensioners); and his two children, 13 and 14 years old. Both of his children go to the local school.

The family has a farm. They use milk from their cow to produce yogurt that they sell in nearby villages. The family makes an average income of 600 GEL.

Otar has requested a 1,200 GEL loan to buy piglets. During the summer he will grow his piglets, then in winter sell them when prices are up. Going into piglets will allow him to diversify his farm’s production and hopefully make more of a profit.

With increased profits Otar will be able to finance his children’s education. He will also be able to increase spending on his family’s daily needs and improve living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz Group

texts.es:
El comité “Reina de la Paz” se formó con la unión de amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que han decidido ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Toribia es miembro del grupo, y nos comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, su trabajo de peluquera le ha ayudado a dar a su familia lo que necesitan y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos y estilos de vida. Ella comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre atiende bien a sus clientes y les da un buen servicio.
Toribia solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, spray, ruleros, tijeras, peines y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Reina de la Paz” comunal bank was formed by the joining together of friends and neighbors in the city of Santaní. They are heads of households who have decided to help their families through their work.

Toribia is a member of the group and tells us that she has managed to succeed through a great deal of sacrifice and effort. Her hair salon business has helped her give her family what they need, and that way improve their income and standard of living. She says that she has a very good clientele, as she always attends to her customers well, and provides them with a good service.

Toribia is applying for the loan to buy hair coloring, hairspray, rollers, scissors, combs and other supplies, in order to supply her business and continue offering a good service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy hair coloring, hairspray, rollers, scissors, combs and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is 35 years old. He lives in a small village with his wife, Ana, and grandfather, a pensioner.

Ana and Eldar are farmers who grow potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. They have several calves and a horse as well. Eldar also sells firewood. He goes to the woods in his car, gathers and prepares wood and sells it on the local open market. His family’s total average monthly income is 500 GEL.

Eldar has requested a 2,000 GEL loan to buy calves. He will raise them and then sell them in autumn when prices are up. He wants to keep one or two of the cows so that his wife and he can make cheese and curds to be sold in nearby villages.

With an increase in profits Eldar plans to repair the house, which is very old and uncomfortable. The family’s living conditions will improve as well, and they will be able to spend their evenings after hard and busy days in a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: El Angel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  El Angel esta  conformado por diez personas indígenas trabajadoras y humildes originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado Mancuernas, Oaxaca una de las músicas mas escuchadas en la comunidad son corridos, una de sus  danzas son las mascaritas, los tejo rones, la tortuga y el fandango de palitos.
Una  de las integrantes de  este grupo es la señora Ariheyi mejor conocida como Ary quien se caracteriza por ser una persona amable y un poco callada, pero muy trabajadora.
Nos dice que se dedica a la  compra venta de borregos desde hace tres años y lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es crear sus borregos, los compran pequeñas para criarlos  y venderlos, cuenta que ese negocio le deja buenas ganancias y con el tiempo desea engrandecerlo.
En su casa tiene  un pequeño corral donde tiene sus borregos, también se dedica a la venta y elaboración de chorizo  desde hace cinco años, lo que más le gusta de ese negocio es preparar la carne y el chile para la elaboración del chorizo.
Uno de sus sueños es engrandecer su negocio para darle una mejor vida  y una mejor educación a su pequeña hija de tres años de edad.
Ella pidió el crédito para la compra de mas borregos para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Lucila – se dedica a la venta de carnes.
Salustia- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Artemio- se dedica a la venta de ganado.
Eliodora Margarita- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Regina- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Sandra Norberta- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Evodia- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Amada Mauricia - se dedica a la venta de comida.
Elizabeth- se dedica a la venta de dulces.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todas las personas humildes que desean mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group called El Angel is made up of 10 hardworking and modest indigenous people from a small town named Mancuernas, Oaxaca.  The "corrido" [traditional ballad] is one of the most common forms of music heard in the community.  Some of the dances are "Las Mascaritas," "Los Tejorones," "La Tortuga," and "El Fandango de Palitos."

Ariheyi, better known as Ary, is one of the members of this group.  She is known for being a kind and somewhat quiet, but very hardworking, person.  She tells us she has worked selling sheep for three years.  What she likes most about her business is raising her lambs.  She buys them young to raise and sell.  She says this business gives her good profits, and she wants to expand it in the future.  She has a small corral at her house where she keeps her lambs.

She also has made and sold chorizo for five years.  What she likes most about that business is preparing the meat and the chili pepper to make the chorizo. 

One of her dreams is to expand her business to give her three-year-old little daughter a better life and a better education.

She requested the loan to buy more lambs to sell wholesale and retail.

The other members of the group are the following: Lucila sells meat, Salustia sells clothing, Artemio sells livestock, Eliodora Margarita sells food, Regina sells beverages, Sandra Norberta sells food, Evodia sells food, Amada Mauricia sells food, and Elizabeth sells sweets.  They thank the foundation for helping all the humble people who want to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lambs to sell.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru:
Гулнар  - лидер группы «Алтын Булак», ей 45 лет, вдова. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулнар на протяжении 25 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Гулнар имеется 7 коров, 5 овец, 7 коз и 1 лошадь, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Гулнар планирует вложить в ближайшем будущем – в женитьбу сына, а в дальнейшем – в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulnar is the leader of the "Altyn Bulak" group.  She is 45 years old and a widow.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, Gulnar has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 25 years, having started this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business contains seven cows, five sheep and one horse, and sales of milk and milk products yield about 8,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Gulnar requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a her son's wedding in the near future and then, into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.en:
Tinatin is 50 years old. She is from a small village of Akhmeta District, Eastern part of the country. Tinatin is married and lives with her family: husband Vazha and two daughters (13 and 9 years old). Both of her daughters go to school. 

The only source of the income for the family is a milk cow. The family consumes about half of the dairy products and the rest is sold in the village. Tinatin mainly produces cheese and yogurt. The family's total average monthly income is 100 laris. They live below the poverty line and according to Credo estimations belong to the "vulnerable poor" category. 

Tinatin requested credit for start-up of a pig farm. Her loan request was approved in the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. With the received credit Tinatin will purchase 10 piglets. She will feed them for 8-9 months and sell most of the grown pigs for a higher price. She won’t sell all of the pigs, but will keep two pigs, which will provide on average 20 piglets per year. Tinatin and Vazha will sell piglets, mainly in their and nearby villages. As a result of the new business initiative, the income of the family will significantly increase and they will be able to combat their poverty. In addition, the Kiva start-up loan will allow the family to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market in the future, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Элмира  - участник группы «Алтын Булак», ей 41 год, мать 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Элмира на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Элмиры имеется 2 коровы, 5 овец, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Elmira is a participant of the "Altyn Bulak" group.  She is 41 years old and a mother of four children.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, Elmira has been involved in animal husbandry for 20 years, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business contains two cows and five sheep, and sales of milk and milk products yield about 8,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Elmira requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru:
Гулмира -  участник группы «Алтын Булак», ей 39 лет, замужем. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулмира занимается  животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 9,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Гулмиры имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulmira is a participant of the "Altyn Bulak" group.  She is 39 years old and married.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, Gulmira is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business with a sum of 9,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business contains two cows with offsprings, and sales of milk and milk products yield about 7,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru:
Айзада -  участник группы «Алтын Булак», ей 32 года, замужем. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Айзада занимается  животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Айзады имеется 3 коровы с телятами, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков.  Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Aizada is a participant of the "Altyn Bulak" group.  She is 32 years old and married.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, Aizada is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business contains three cows with calves, and sales of milk and milk products yield about 8,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Aizada requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ndeo

texts.fr: Après 35 ans de mariage, NDEO est aujourd'hui mère de huit enfants.Toutefois, elle continue encore à travailler chez elle.Avec l'aide des enfants, elle achète de boeufs qu'elle engraisse puis revend.Elle parvient ainsi à épargner assez d'argent pour prendre en charge ses besoins mais surtout aider ses petits fils dans le paiement de leurs frais de scolarité et dans la satisfaction d'autres besoins divers.Elle sollicite aujourd'hui un pret de 300000f pour acheter 2 boeufs.Elle envisage d'apprendre aux enfants toutes les facettes de cette activité.
texts.en:
After 35 years of marriage, NDEO is now a mother of eight children. However, she still continues to work at home. With her children's help, she buys cattle which she fattens and then sells. She thus manages to save enough money to meet her needs and also to help her grandsons in paying their school costs, as well as to meet a variety of other needs. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy two head of cattle. She envisions teaching her children all facets of this business.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Hukmiddin

texts.ru: Хукмиддин честный и заботливый семьянин. Он всегда хотел иметь свой бизнес и открыл магазин, чтобы заниматься торговлей. Он продает промышленные товары и продукты питания. Хукмиддин хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия. С этой целью он усердно работает до позднего  вечера. Хукмиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки промышленных товаров с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Hukmiddin is an honest and caring family man.  He always wanted to have his own business and opened a store in order to get involved in sales.  He sells household goods and food products.  Hukmiddin wants to expand his business and improve his housing conditions.  This is why he works diligently until late evenings.  Hukmiddin wants to obtain this loan to purchase household goods in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase household goods

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacine est une femme mariée qui évolue depuis deux  ans dans le secteur du commerce. Elle achète des produits cosmétiques dans l’un des pays voisins du Sénégal qu’elle remet  en  vente. C’est avec le financement de l’U-IMCEC qu’elle a démarré son activité et a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle capitalise une expérience de  2 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour acquérir des tissus  teintés qu’elle va revendre. Ainsi elle souhaite diversifier les marchandises qu’elle commercialise. Son intention est d’accroitre ses bénéfices afin de  pouvoir  augmenter son épargne et contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille.  Son objectif dans le futur c’est d’atteindre une indépendance financière pour exercer librement ses activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Yacine is a married woman who has been working in the commercial sector for two years. She buys cosmetic products from a country neighboring Senegal and resells them. She started her business with U-IMCEC financing and has already repaid a previous loan. She capitalizes on two years of experience. 

Ms. Yacine is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to acquire some dyed fabrics, which she is going to resell. In this way, she wishes to diversify the merchandise she markets. 

Her intention is to increase her profits in order to increase her savings and to help improve her family's food situation. Her goal in the future is to achieve financial independence to operate her business freely.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabrics to sell

loans.name: Urinbek

texts.ru: Уринбек проживает в районе Яван. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Уринбек более восьми лет занимается скотоводством. Он берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Urinbek lives in the Yavan region. He is 38 years old, married, and has six children. Urinbek has been raising cattle for over eight years. He is taking this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Jyldyz

texts.ru:
Жылдыз 33 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Жылдыз работает в местной школе преподавателем музыки и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2006 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Жылдыз на сегодняшний  день имеется  12 овец, 2 коровы с телятами, что приносит ей около 6,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдыз обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Jyldyz is 33 years old, married, and is raising 3 children. She works as a music teacher at a local school. As a source of additional income for her family, Jyldyz raises livestock, having started her business with an initial investment of 15,000 som (KGS) in 2006. Presently, her herd includes 12 sheep and 2 cows with calves, and brings her 6,000 som per month from sales of milk and dairy products.

In order to continue developing her livestock business, Jyldyz has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy additional animals for her herd. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Basseneere 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mr GEORGES est le représentant du groupe BASSNEERE II. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Le plus âgé a six (06) ans et le moins âgé a deux (02) ans. Un de ses enfants va à l’école. Il a quatre (04) personnes en charge.

Il est commerçant (vente d’habits pour homme) depuis douze (12) ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 et au grand marché. Ses clients sont essentiellement les hommes.

 Il veut s’acheter six (06) douzaines de complets d’habits pour homme.

Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et construire. Il ambitionne agrandir son activité te mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. GEORGES is the representative of the group BASSNEERE II. He is married with two children aged 2 and 6. One of the children goes to school. He supports a total of four people.

Georges has been selling men’s clothing for 12 years. He buys his merchandise at the market of sector 10, and at the Grand market. His customer base consists mainly of men.

Georges wants to buy 6 dozen men’s suits. He will use his profits to strengthen his activity and build some property. He wants to expand his business and better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy six dozen men's suits for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a prospective student applying for a loan to start her undergraduate work on a Bachelor of Commerce degree at Strathmore University. This is her story: 

My name is Olivia. I am 18 years old. My parents are unemployed while four of my brothers who are working are casual laborers with unstable financial status. In secondary school, I was the Head girl in both schools and while in High School, I was the Chair lady of the Wildlife Club, a member of the science congress club where I proceeded to the nationals twice and also a member of the Young Farmers Club.

I chose Strathmore University because it is one of the best universities in the country and therefore Strathmore graduates stand among the finest. It has outstanding performance in both curriculum and co-curriculum activities. 

I am requesting the loan to pay my tuition fees. This is because my parents are unable to pay my tuition fees. My high school education was sponsored by ACTS, an organization that assists children to attend school. At that time, my brothers were struggling to pay fees for my two sisters, my twin sister in high school and the other in Mombasa Polytechnic University College. Until today, my brothers are struggling to finish the fees arrears at the college. I wish to have smooth learning with no interruptions hence, I have applied for the loan. I am looking forward to studying for my Bachelor of Commerce at Strathmore University.

On graduating, I wish to work with reputable and prestigious organizations, firms or institutions like the World Bank, UN, Price Waterhouse Cooper, East African Breweries Limited (EABL) and International Finance Cooperation. I will repay the loan while I am working, not long after my graduation. My hopes and dreams of the future are: to have a reputable company of my own, to give back to society by helping out in areas such as health and sanitation, environmental conservation and to assist in children's welfare in areas such as education, health and  care. My hobbies are singing, traveling and playing basketball.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Donie

texts.en:
Donie is a prospective student applying for a loan to start his undergraduate work on a Bachelor of Business Science degree in Actuarial Science at Strathmore University and this is his story: 

I live in a humble estate in the city of Nairobi, Kenya. I am a partial-orphan. My father died when I was 7 years old. My family consists of my mother, my elder sister and I. I am an ambitious young man who does not allow setbacks to stop me from dreaming big. I have consistently maintained excellent academic grades since my primary school where I scored top marks which gained me a scholarship at a top National school. I have completed my secondary education at the school and attained excellent KCSE results.

My next plan is to earn the best degree from a prestigious university; Strathmore is my university of choice because it is the top ranked university in my country and a leader in the field of Business degrees. I have been admitted to start my first year of study in BBS - Actuarial Science at the school of Finance and Applied Economics.  The university emphasizes high standards of quality, excellence, respect, ethical conduct and service, besides liaising with industries and experts for the advancement of students. These excellent programs will equip me with experience and prepare me adequately for my research work.

I need this loan because I would like to graduate with a well-recognized degree from the best university which will get me a fulfilling and a high paying career. I do not have any other source of funds to finance my education at Strathmore University. My mother who is the only surviving parent is unemployed.

After graduation, I plan to become one the best qualified actuaries, work for the best institutions in the Industry, clear my loans as early as possible, improve the living condition of my family and become one of the best CEOs of our time. As part of giving back to my society, I plan to found an organization through which bright needy youth will be sponsored to access education. Through this KIVA loan, I will be able to realize my dreams.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science at Strathmore University.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his family: his wife – Natia, his 8-year-old daughter and 7-year-old son; the children go to school. The only source of the income for the family is a milk cow. The family consumes about half of the dairy products and the rest is sold in the village. Natia mainly produces cheese for sale. The total average monthly income of the family is 100 laris. They live below the poverty line and according to Credo estimations belong to the subsistence poor category.

David requested credit for start-up of a small business. A Kiva start-up loan was the only chance for him to get funds for financing the business venture. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of extremely low income. 

With the received credit David will purchase a truck. He will collect firewood in the forest and sell it in his and nearby villages. The villagers use it for heating their house during winter, as well as spring and fall months. According to David’s estimations the profit gained from this activity will equal on average 200 laris per month. The business will have a seasonal character and the income will reach its maximum in winter months. 

As a result of the new business, initiated with the Kiva loan, the income of the family will significantly increase. David and Natia will use increased income for providing better living conditions for their children. In addition to the above-mentioned, the Kiva start-up loan will allow the family to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market in the future, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for selling firewood

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a prospective student applying for a loan to start her undergraduate work on a Bachelor of Science in Informatics degree at Strathmore University. This is her story:

My name is Lilian and I am 17 years old. I come from a single-parented family of three kids. I have two siblings: a brother and a sister.

I chose Strathmore University for several reasons. First it is the best university that offers the course I want to pursue, secondly Strathmore has the best facilities and a conducive environment for studying. Such facilities include: the well-equipped library, the student centre and to top it all off, it has the best lecturers in the country. I also chose Strathmore because of its sporting activities. Most of its teams are not only recognised in the country but also in the whole of the African continent, therefore I can join one of the teams which will improve my CV and at the same time help me discover and explore my talent in the sporting sector. 

Strathmore Students are also very disciplined and hence their studies are not always disrupted by strikes or riots as is the case in many public universities in Kenya. Lastly I decided to choose Stathmore because of their mentorship program which helps guide the students in the right path and to make the right decisions in life since the mentors are people who have experience and they know how to deal with certain situations in life.

I want to pursue a Bachelor of Science in Informatics as my undergraduate programme. I need the loan to finance my education at the university  since my mother cannot afford the fees required for the course. After graduating I would like to be employed for a few years until I have saved enough money to start my own IT company or become an entrepreneur.

I hope I will be able to do the course and afterwards establish my own business or company and create jobs. I also hope that I will be able to achieve all the goals I have set  in life. I would also like to thank Strathmore for giving needy but bright kids an option of still pursuing their studies, with no worries, by partnering with KIVA, and I am grateful for being accorded this chance.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Informatics at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Olvin Alfredo

texts.es:
Olvin, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus dos hermanos en una aldea de las Vegas Santa Bárbara.
El tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios, pero también a trabajado en agricultura y hace 3 años ha estado cultivando maíz, banano y café. La producción la vende en la comunidad. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 20,000.00 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos, va comprar abonos y fertilizantes para cultivar una manzana más de café. Su idea es incrementar el área de producción y con una buena asistencia lograr buenas cosechas que le generen más ingresos para su familia. De las ganancias él piensa comprar bienes y seguir mejorando sus cultivos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olvin is 25 years old, single, and lives with his two siblings in a neighborhood in Las Vegas Santa Bárbara.

He has a small grocery store where he sells food products, but he is also engaged in agriculture. Olvin has been growing corn, bananas, and coffee for the past three years. He sells what he produces in his community.

Olvin is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL in order to maintain his crops. He will buy compost and fertilizers for cultivating one more plot of coffee. His intention is to increase his production and provide good care so that he can achieve good harvests that will generate more income for his family. With his earnings, he plans to buy assets and continue improving his crops so that he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Mechoacan Group

texts.es:
Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son las señoras  Hilmelda, Leticia, Maria, Emilia, Maria y Herminia  quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades economicas: a la venta de pollos, tamales y elaboración de servilletas.
La señora Leticia se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora y humilde se dedica a la elaboración de bordados  como son: servilletas y manteles desde hace trece años.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es atender a las personas y tener sus pedidos a tiempo ya que le hacen pedidos de servilletas.
También se dedica a la venta de tamales de pollo, costilla de marrano y dulces de elote hace sus tamales cada tercer día.
Dice que para tejer su  mantel   tarde aproximadamente un mes y para elaborar su servilleta tarda quince días.
Borda tres  veces al día por que se cansa mucho de la espalda, lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que su mama y sus hermanas se dedican a lo mismo su mamá le enseño desde muy pequeña y a ella siempre le ha gustado bordar  es una de las herencias mas grandes que les dejo su mamá.
Esta muy orgullosa de su negocio por que le deja buenas ganancias y hace lo que le gusta, trabaja con amor y dedicación.
Uno de sus sueños es que reconozcan su trabajo  y vean como se elaboran las servilletas y manteles en el telar  de cintura que es lo que ella más utiliza para elaborar sus servilletas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más hilos, listones, hilo cristal y hilos de colores.
Las integrantes de este grupo le dan las gracias a fundacion Realidad por ayudara a la gente indígena y de pueblos maquinados.
texts.en: The new members of the group are Hilmelda, Leticia, Maria, Emilia, Maria and Herminia. They all have various activities: selling chicken tamales and making napkins. Leticia is a humble and hardworking person; she has been making embroideries such as napkins and tablecloths for three years. What she likes most about her business is to welcome customers and have their orders ready on time, since her customers order napkins. She also sells various flavours of tamales: chicken, pork rib, sweetcorn jam. She makes them every three days. She says that it takes her one month to weave a tablecloth and fifteen days for a napkin. She embroiders three times a day because she has a bad back. What she likes best about this part of the business is that her mother and sisters practice the same craft. Her mother taught her when she was little and Leticia has always liked embroidery. It is the most important thing she inherited from her mother. She is very proud of her business because it is quite profitable and allows her to work doing what she loves; she works with love and dedication. One of Leticia's dreams is to see her work acknowledged and to be able to show how she makes napkins and tablecloths on her backstrap loom, which is the implement she uses the most to make her napkins. She asks for the loan in order to buy more thread, ribbons, yarn and colour thread. The members of the group thank Foundation Realidad for the help it extends to indigenous people and to people of marginalised villages.

loans.use: to buy supplies for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de taller de carpinteria junto con su esposo,ella realiza trabajos de madera como mesas,sillas y puertas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de taller de carpinteria.La socia solicita le credito para comprar herramientas y madera.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her carpentry workshop along with her husband. She makes items from wood, such as tables, chairs, and doors. The member works from 8:00AM until 7:00PM. This work is how she provides for her children. Her dream is to expand her carpentry workshop business. She is requesting a loan to buy tools and wood.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to follow through with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy tools and wood

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Bineta est une femme mariée qui reste tout le temps dans la maison pour s'occuper des enfants et préparer les repas. Elle profite alors de ce temps pour s'adonner à l'embouche ovine.Elle achète des moutons qu'elle engraisse et revend au bout de 6 à 7 mois. Cela lui permet de subvenir à certains de ses besoins et de ceux des enfants. Ainsi, pour faire une nouvelle opération, elle sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter 4 moutons. son ambition est de se lancer dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
Bineta is a married woman who is always at home taking care of children and making meals. She then takes advantage of this time to devote to the raising of sheep. She purchases sheep, which she fattens and resell after six to seven months. This enables her to meet certain needs of hers and those of her children. 

Thus, for a new transaction, Bineta is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy four head of sheep. Her ambition is to get started in the raising of cows.

loans.use: to buy four head of sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy four sacks of rice and four 20-liter jerrycans of oil.

loans.name: Mody

texts.fr: Mody est un homme marié.Il est père de quatre enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école primaire.Il exerce depuis plus de vingt ans l'élevage de moutons, de chèvres et de vaches. Face aux difficultés que rencontre la pratique traditionnelle de cette activité, il a commencé à faire de l'embouche bovine. Ainsi, il achète des boeufs qu'il engraisse pendant quelques mois avant de les revendre sur le marché. Il parvient à générer assez de bénéfices qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et à ses propres besoins. Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 400000f auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 3 boeufs. Son ambition est de construire un enclos pour plus de sécurité.
texts.en:
Mody is a married man. He is the father of four children, of whom two attend primary school. For more than 20 years, he has been raising sheep, goats and cattle. 

Faced with the difficulties that a traditional practitioner of this business encounters, he began to fatten cattle. Thus, he buys cattle that he fattens for several month before selling them at the market. He manages to generate enough profit to support his family and for his own needs. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy three cows. His ambition is to build a corral for added security.

loans.use: to buy  three cows.

loans.name: Seyni

texts.fr: Seyni est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce en même temps les activités d'agriculture et d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine.Ces deux activités lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire les besoins alimentaires, de santé et vestimentaires de sa famille. Afin d'acheter deux boeufs, il sollicite un pret de 300000f.Il ambitionne d'agrandir ses activités.
texts.en: Seyni is a married man and the father of three children. At the same time, he works in farming and raises cattle in particular. These two activities bring in the revenues enabling him to meet his needs in terms of food, health care, and clothing for his family. To buy two head of cattle, Seyni is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs. His ambition is to expand his businesses.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es:
La socia Ninoska pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA;la socia continua trabajando en su negocio de  venta de licores, la socia trabaja en su negocio todos los dias siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia;la socia desea que su negocio poco a poco prospere.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de gaseosas y cerveza para su negocio.

La socia agradece el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas mensales.
texts.en:
Ninoska belongs to the communal bank “Las Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary).   She has a shop that sells liquor.  She works in her business every day in order to build a better life for her family. She enjoys this business, which is going well thanks to the effort she makes every day.  She wants to build her business little by little.

She is seeking this loan to buy soda and beer for her business.  She is thankful for her previously granted loan and promises to complete her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer for resale.

loans.name: Jose Emegidio

texts.es:
Jose tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja en una aldea del municipio de nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. 
Anteriormente Jose se dedicaba a la agricultura ahora dedica medio tiempo para realizar el negocio de compra y venta de todo tipo de animal, como ser vacas, terneros, cerdos, aves y otros. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y ya es muy conocido en la aldea donde tiene sus clientes. El préstamo que solicita es de 6,000.00 Lempiras y lo necesita para comprar más animales como terneros para vender. Este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar las ganancias. Su idea es hacer crecer el negocio para darle oportunidad de trabajo y mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 26 years old and lives with his partner in a neighborhood in the town of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He was a farmer previously, but now he works part-time at his business of buying and selling all types of animals, such as cows, calves, pigs, poultry, and other livestock. Jose has been in this business for four years and is well-known in the neighborhood where he has customers.

He is requesting a loan of 6,000 HNL because he needs to buy more animals, such as calves, that he can sell. This loan will help to increase his earnings. His intention is to grow his business so that he can provide job opportunities and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Todos Juntos“ perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de verduras, desde hace 3 años. Trabaja en un local que instalo en su casa, trabaja todos los días, a veces le ayuda su hijo.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra en la feria, y otras veces los compra en distribuidoras de abastecimiento en verduras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conviene económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería.
Una de sus metas es poder terminar su local para atender a su clientela en forma ordenada.
Patricia vive junto a su marido, un hijo y un nieto, sus sueños a nivel familiar son terminar su local para una mejor calidad de vida y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en: Patricia belongs to the communal bank "Todos Juntos" ("All Together") of the city of Viña del Mar. She has been selling vegetables for 3 years. She works out of a shop that she set up in her house. She works every day, sometimes with the help of her son. She says that she buys merchandise at the market or to distributors specialised in vegetables, since both offer low prices and are thus convenient from an economic standpoint. With this loan she will buy merchandise to sell. One of her goals is to be able to finish her shop in order to welcome customers in a tidy fashion. Patricia lives with her husband and has a son and a grandson. Her goals for her family are to finish her shop in order to have a better quality of life and thus be able to increase her income. She is very glad and thankful for the opportunity afforded her by field partner Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will allow her to invest in her business. She also feels at ease in the communal bank group she belongs to, which motivates her to continue to participate. She also says that the training imparted during group meetings has helped her to better invest in her business. Viña del Mar is a city and commune situated in the middle of the Chilean coastline; it is known as 'the Garden City' because of the gardens and courtyards displayed by some of the antique buildings in the city. It is also deemed the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Veenem Yangue Group

texts.fr:
Mme ELISE  est la responsable du groupe VEENEMYANGUE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des pagnes depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les hommes, femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 douzaines de pagnes. 

Mme réinvestie ses économies  dans son activité. Elle ambitionne  avoir un lieu fixe pour faire son activité et pouvoir plus aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme ELISE  is the leader of the group called VEENEM YANGUE. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest two years old. Two of them attend school and she is responsible for four persons. 

Elise has been selling lengths of African print cloth for seven years. She buys her wares at the big market in Ouagadougou. Her customers are men and women. 

She wants to buy three dozen lengths of African print cloth.  

Elise reinvests her savings in her business. Her ambition is to have a shop where she can sell her goods and to do more to help her family.

loans.use: to buy three dozen lengths of African print cloth

loans.name: Yanett Del Pilar

texts.es:
La socia Yanett Del Pilar pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA ; la socia continua trabajando en su negocio de venta de artesanía ella vende lo que son chompas,polos,guantes,entre otros;la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia;la socia vende de forma ambulatoria distribuyendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a  su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como chompas de alpaca.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Yanett Del Pilar belongs to the Las Hijas de Maria (Daughters of Mary) Communal Bank.  The member continues working in her business, selling artesanal crafts.  She sells sweaters, polo shirts, gloves, and other crafts.  She has been in this business for a good while and it’s going well thanks to the effort she makes each day.  She makes her sales on foot distributing her merchandise to customers who request it.  In this way, she helps her family get ahead.  She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise, such as alpaca sweaters, for her business.  Yanett is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments according the established terms.  .

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as alpaca sweaters, for her business.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a young man of 28 years. He is married and has two children who are five years old and five months old. The five-year-old boy is in kindergarten. Kenneth also stays with his younger brother and sister for whom he pays tution for university and high school, respectively.

Kenneth has a small furniture workshop where he makes tables, cupboards and beds on a small scale. He also makes local wood varnish and sells it. He employs two boys who help him in making the above. He makes an average profit of UGX 400,000 per month, depending on the season.

Kenneth wants UGX 3,000,000 to complete payment for a piece of land in the outskirts of the city, on which he has already made partial payment. He wishes to start constructing a house for his family if he gets funds so that he can stop renting, which eats into his income and yet he has many family demands.

His main challenge is that at times he buys poor quality wood that cracks before he uses it when there is a lot of sunshine or during transportation of the furniture.

Kenneth is a very hard working young man, which is the reason he has been able to send his siblings to school. In the picture is Kenneth on the land he is buying.

loans.use: To complete payment for a piece of land.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 27-year-old married man with one child aged two. He looks after two dependents whom he pays school fees for and buys their scholastic materials.

Henry is a primary school teacher at a mission school in his village where he earns a meagre salary. He does agriculture to supplement his income.  He started teaching in 2007 because it was his dream job and works six days a week. He wants 700,000 Ugandan shillings to complete payment on a piece of land where he has already made partial payment.     

He hopes to buy more land and build himself a presentable house. Henry loves success, and whenever he fails to achieve his goals, usually because of a lack of funds, he feels frustrated.  He is a hard working man.

loans.use: to complete payment on a piece of land.

loans.name: Flor Nacional Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Flor Nacional” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran;  venta de ropa usada, venta de ropa nueva, venta de pan amasado, venta de flores,almacen, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo  ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago.
Lorena, secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en segunda fila ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste chaleco negro, su cabello lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio en ventas de ropa nueva de gran variedad para su clientela, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 2 años, trabaja con su esposo.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su negocio la compra en distribuidoras de ropa en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería chalecos, buzos, poleras de diferentes tallas y modelos .
Las metas en su negocio son seguir creciendo para poder tener otro puesto. Lorena vive junto a su marido y sus 2 hijos y no de sus sueños son tener una casa propia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is named "Flor Nacional" and consists of 15 entrepreneurs who engage in different trades.  These businesses include selling used clothing, selling new clothing, selling "pan amasado" (Chilean kneaded bread), selling flowers, managing a store, providing services, and other activities.  All of the members are from the community of San Bernardo, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Lorena is the secretary of this Communal Bank group.  In the photograph, she is seated in the second row and in the first position (from left to right).  She is wearing a black jacket and has her hair down.  Lorena is in the retail trade, selling a wide variety of new clothes to her customers.  She has been in this business for two years.  Lorena works with her husband.  The merchandise she needs for her business is purchased from clothing distributors in the city of Santiago.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise.  Her goals for her business include continuing her growth so that she can open another vending post.  Lorena lives with her husband and two children.  She dreams of having a house of her own.  Lorena is pleased with and appreciative of the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.  In addition, she feels comfortable participating in her group since the members are unified, respectful, and trustworthy.  

San Bernardo is a city that is located 18 kilometers due south of the main square in Santiago (the Chilean capital).  It is known as the folklore capital since it hosts the International Folklore Festival every January.  This event highlights the various ethnic groups of the country and musical groups from all over South America gather there. Chilean artisans, as well as those from other countries nearby, also participate in the Traditional Craft Fair. In the month of April, an event called "Abril Cuecas Mil" celebrates the "cueca" (a traditional Chilean dance) throughout the entire community.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like vests, track suits, and t-shirts of different styles and sizes.

loans.name: Avanzar Todos Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Avanzar Todos Juntos” está conformado por 15 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de chocolates artesanales, tejido, artesanía, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes la comuna de La Florida ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Katherine quien en la foto se ubica en la parte del fondo cerca de la pared de izquierda a derecha, ella es morena y su cabello de color negro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio en venta de ropa, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 8 años.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por la gran variedad y lo económico.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para abastecer su negocio.
Las metas en su negocio son crecer con su local para tener mucha clientela.
Katherine vive junto a su marido y 2 hijos y uno de sus sueños son poder tener una casa propia, y terminar sus estudios para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Katherine está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos.
La Florida es una comuna ubicada al suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Su población actual es muy diversa, representando a todos los sectores socioeconómicos (alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo). La zona cuenta con una activa vida comercial, la que se manifiesta en la existencia de varios nuevos centros comerciales. Es un sector que ha tenido un explosivo crecimiento demográfico en los últimos años.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Avanzar Todos Juntos” [Everyone Advance Together]. It is made up of 15 enterprising people who work in commerce, such as: clothing sales, artisanal chocolate sales, weaving, crafts, and services, among other things. All of them belong to the commune [a type of administrative district in Chile] of La Florida, located in the city of Santiago.

Katherine, who is located in the back of the photo, near the wall, near the middle, has darker skin and has black hair that she wears back. 

She works in the business of selling clothing. She has been doing this since she was 8 years old. She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago because there is a lot of variety there and it is economical.

With the loan, she will buy clothing to stock her business. Her goal for her business is to grow it and have many customers.

Katherine lives together with her husband and 2 children. One of her dreams is to have her own house and to finish her studies so that she can have a better quality of life.

Katherine is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that she has been given by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable in the group in which she participates because they are close.

La Florida is a commune located in the southeast of Santiago, the capital of Chile, in the region of Metroplitana. Its current population is very diverse and represents all of the socioeconomic sectors (upper class, upper middle class, middle class, and lower class). The area has a lot of commercial activity, which is manifested in the many new shopping centers. It is an area that has had explosive demographic growth in the last few years.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Soñadores Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Soñadores” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, preparación y venta de comida rápida, juegos en maquinas de azar, repostería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la cuidad de San Antonio.
Ingrid quien en la foto se encuentra sentada ocupando el primer ligar de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo pantalón gris, polera blanca y encima lleva un chaleco color negro, usa una cartera color café, su cabello es de color negro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y juegos de maquinas de azar, desde hace 1 año. Su local lo ubica en su propia casa.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en la cuidad de Santiago, ya que es mucho más conveniente y con mayor variedad.
Con el crédito comprará una maquina de juegos de azar y mercadería para la venta de ropa.
Sus metas son tener un local en el centro de la ciudad de San Antonio, para generar mayores ingresos.
Ingrid vive junto a su marido y su hija pequeña. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son tener su local para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ingrid está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
San Antonio es un puerto de la región de Valparaíso, siendo esta una de sus principales características, ubicado en el litoral central de Chile. Se desarrolla en forma importante la pesca y venta de pescados y mariscos. Pese a la actividad portuaria y comercial del puerto, existe un alto índice de cesantía.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Soñadores.” It is made up of 17 enterprising people who work in commerce, specifically in clothing sales, preparation of fast foods, video games, gambling machines, baking, and services, among other things. All of them live in the city of San Antonio.

Ingrid, in the photo she is first from the left, dressed in gray pants, a white sweater, and over that a black coat, has a brown purse, her hair is black, and she is wearing it back.

She has been selling clothing and also has had gambling machines for 1 year. Her business is located in her own house. She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago because it is much more convenient and has a large variety.

With the loan, she will buy a gambling machine and clothing merchandise.

Her goal is to have a store in the center of the city of San Antonio, so that she can earn a larger income. Ingrid lives with her husband and their young daughter. Her dream for her family is to have a store so that they can have a better quality of life.

Ingrid is very happy and grateful for the loan and the services provided by Fondo Esperanza. She also explains that she feels very comfortable in the meetings and her communal bank, because the members are generous and united. 

San Antonio is a port in the region of Valparaíso. It is characterized by being a port city and being located on the central coast of Chile. Fishing and fish and seafood sales are important industries. Despite the port and commercial activities, there is a high rate of unemployment.

loans.use: to buy a gambling machine and clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Abatiganda 9 Zone 2 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Elias fait partie du groupe Abatiganda Zone 2/Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «les courageux». Il a 46 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 6 ans à 16 ans, dont 4  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Elias est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisant et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.


Pour faire croitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie d’utiliser des fertilisants sélectionner et sollicite d’autres crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter d’autres champs pour agrandir l’étendue de son agriculture. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants et sa famille en général.
texts.en:
Elias is a member of the group Abatiganda Zone 2/Rsz. The name of the group means “the brave”. Elias, age 46, is married with five children aged 6 to 16, four of whom go to school. He attended six years of primary school. 

Elias is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.  

Elias plans to expand his activity by obtaining additional loans and using selected fertilizers. In the coming years, he would like to acquire more fields to increase his farmable area. He will use the profits earned to pay for his family’s healthcare and his children’s tuition.

loans.use: to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Aidai

texts.ru:
Айдай 45 лет, вдова, воспитывает 3 детей. Айдай в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2008 года занимается торговлей строительными материалами, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 30,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня доход от бизнеса составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айдай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Айдай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса чтобы иметь возможность обучить детей в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
Aidai is 45 years old. She is a widow and is raising 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, Aidai sells construction materials, having launched her business in 2008 with an initial investment of 30,000 som (KGS). Presently, her profits total approximately 10,000 som (KGS) per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Aidai has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS), which she will use to expand the assortment of her merchandise. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, so as to be able to pay for post-secondary education of her children.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of her products

loans.name: Ashirbubu

texts.ru:
Аширбубу 54 года, вдова, воспитала 2 детей. Аширбубу работает в пельменном цехе и качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1985 года занимается земледелием, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня доход от бизнеса  в выращивании фасоли  и ее реализации составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аширбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку минеральных удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Аширбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ashirbubu is 54 years old, a widow, and has raised 2 children. She works at a dumpling factory and also cultivates crops in order to provide an additional source of income for her family. Ashirbubu started this business in 1985 with an investment of 10,000 som (KGS), and presently earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of beans.

In order to continue developing her business, Ashirbubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase mineral fertilizers. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 7 filhos e todos ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupa diversa, e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (fraldas, biquínis, chapéus, guarda chuvas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja construir quartos de aluguer, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a subida de preços de material de construção e elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
She's married and has seven children, all of which still attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She runs her own business selling various types of clothing. With the present loan she intends to purchase merchandise (diapers, bathing suits, hats, umbrellas, etc.) in order to stock up.
In the future she wishes to build rooms for renting. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled and request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is the rising prices of construction supplies and the high living costs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for selling (diapers, bathing suits, hats, umbrellas, etc.).

loans.name: Mario

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos e todos ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 	
Trabalha como segurança e nos tempos livres faz a construção civil, e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, chapas, pedra e outros) para aumentar a sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
No futuro pretende apostar muito na formação dos seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a toda sua família.
texts.en:
He's married and has four children, all of which still attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his nephews who live with him.
He works as a security guard and during his free time he does construction work. With the present loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, metal sheets, rocks, etc.) in order to enlarge his house and provide more comfort for his family.
In the future he intends to invest a lot in his children's education. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled and request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is to finish building his home and to provide more comfort for his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, metal sheets, rocks, etc.).

loans.name: Karen Yesenia

texts.es:
Karen Yesenia tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada, y tiene 2 hijos, vive en una colonia periférica de  San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Karen tiene un negocio de venta de comida, ella vende desayunos, almuerzos, baleadas, pollo con tajadas etc. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y los clientes son los mismos vecinos o personas que pasan por la zona. Dice que le va bien con el negocio, porque la comida siempre tiene mucha demanda a diario. En algunas ocasiones también vende comida por encargo. 
Para  mantener el negocio dando una buena atención a los clientes solicito un préstamo a Odef de 10,000 lempiras para comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar los alimentos como carnes, condimentos, granos, refrescos, también otra parte para comprar utensilios nuevos para cocinar los alimentos para dar una mejor higiene y calidad en la preparación de los mismos.
Comenta que esta agradecida con ODEF y KIVA por la oportunidad en otorgarle el préstamo para que su negocio mejore.  Su plan es aumentar sus ventas para obtener más ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Karen Yesenia is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a an outlying neighborhood of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Karen has a business selling food. She sells breakfast, lunches, "baleadas" (Honduran stuffed tortillas), chicken with fried plantains, and other dishes. This business is established in her house and her customers consist of neighbors and people passing through the area. Karen says that she is doing well in her business because her food is always in demand each day. On a few occasions, she will sell food made to order.

In order to maintain her business and provide good service to her customers, Karen is requesting a loan from ODEF in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can buy the necessary supplies for preparing food such as meats, condiments, grains, as well as soft drinks. Part of the loan will also be used to buy new utensils for cooking food so that her dishes will be of quality and prepared under better sanitary conditions. Karen says that she is grateful to ODEF and Kiva for the opportunity to obtain this loan so that she can improve her business. Her plan is to increase her sales so that she will have more income to help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Elsa Marina, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el municipio de Trinidad Santa Bárbara. Ella anteriormente realizaba trabajos de costurado de zapatos y hace un año decidió fabricar cajas de cartón para zapatos. Este producto lo vende en los talleres de zapatería de la comunidad y sus alrededores. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita y es por 12,000.00 lempiras, que lo necesita para la compra de materia prima que utiliza para la elaboración de cajas para zapatos, como ser cartón, grapas y grapadoras. Ella quiere ver un buen crecimiento en su negocio, y estar unida con su familia y sentir que su negocio es propio.
texts.en:
Elsa Marina, 33, is married living with her husband and her three children in the municipality of Trinidad, Santa Bárbara.  She used to work sewing shoes and a year ago decided to manufacture cardboard boxes for shoes.  She sells the product to shoe shops in the community and adjacent areas. 

This is the second loan she’s requested.  It’s for 12,000 lempiras that she needs to buy raw materials she uses to make the shoe boxes like cardboard, staples and staplers.  She wants to see good business growth and to be united with her family and to feel that her business is her own.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Sonia Dominga

texts.es: Doña Sonia, tiene 52 años de edad, casada y vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara, quien hace aproximadamente 10 años estableció su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como azúcar, jugos, papel higiénico, arroz, manteca, refrescos, especias, huevos y otros.
