Giovana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una carreta, que le servirá para la venta de panes; asimismo, podrá comprar más cantidad de panes para su venta; de esta manera Giovana podrá incrementar sus ingresos y en un futuro no muy lejano podrá comprar más carretas y con ello conseguir su gran sueño de contar con una casa propia y tener en ella una bodega donde pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
Giovana is a very hard-working woman who is devoted to her family.  She is 30 years old and lives in the city of Ica together with her partner.  The couple have a seven-year-old child.  With a lot of effort, Giovana completed her secondary education.  Sadly, she was unable to continue on to pursue a higher education owing to her financial situation though she would have liked to have been able to study for a secretarial degree.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and the support of her partner who works as a manager in a bakery, Giovana works as a bread distributor.  She works around 5 hours a day in this business and is popular with her customers thanks to her good customer service and charm.

Giovana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a cart which she will use to sell her bread from.  She will also be able to buy more bread to sell.  In this way, Giovana will be able to increase her income and, in the not-so-distant future, she will be able to buy more carts and achieve her big dream of owning her own home and setting up a store there in which to work.

loans.use: to buy a cart from which to sell her bread

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is married and has one child. She sells charcoal at Ampayin; she has done this for the past six years. Her husband is a farmer. Araba uses her income to assist her husband in the general up-keep of their family. She will use the loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fish monger; she is standing in front of the oven she uses to smoke the fish. Ama buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale.  She has been selling smoked  fish for 15 years now. She is married an has six dependents. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. Ama will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. She will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Kinoya

texts.en:
Kinoya is 34 years-old, married, and supports a family of three. He is a farmer doing maize farming for the last four years earning a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

This is his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase planting seeds, fertilizers to plow the land. The anticipated profits will be used to support the business after the planting season. His future plans are to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase planting seeds, fertilizers to plow the land.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer de 28 años muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pequeño hijo de 3 años con el cual en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de la ciudad y en ocasiones le gusta preparar un riquísimo "Ceviche" para compartir gratos momentos con su familia. 
Reyna con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de un primo muy cercano, se dedica a la venta de jugo de caña, ella le dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 200 clientes, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su agradable personalidad y buena atención hacia sus clientes.
Reyna se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar un extractor de jugo y un motor gasolinero los cuales le servirán como maquinaria para realizar mejor su trabajo y de esta manera pueda incrementar sus ingresos económicos, asegurando la educación y bienestar de su pequeño niño para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda llegar a ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Reyna is a very hard-working 28-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa together with her 3-year-old son.  In her free time, she likes to go for walks with him around the warm and welcoming streets of the city.  She often likes to prepare the delicious 'ceviche' (a fish dish marinated in citrus juices) and share pleasant moments with her family.

With a lot of hard work and commitment, and thanks to the support of a close cousin, Reyna works selling sugar cane juice.  She works approximately 10 hours a day in her business and can serve up to 200 customers.  She believes that her business is doing well thanks to her kind personality and the good customer service she offers.

Reyna is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a juicer and a gas engine which she will use in carrying out her work.  This will enable her to increase her income and guarantee the education and well-being of her young son so that, in the not-so-distant future, he can become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a juicer and a gas engine

loans.name: Koinanke

texts.en:
Koinanke is 35 years old and married. He supports a family of seven. He is a farmer who has harvested maize and beans for the past eight years. His monthly income is KES 5,000. 

Koinanke is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to buy farm implements, fertilizers and seeds.

The anticipated profits will be used to increase his farm acreage. Koinanke's future plans are to undertake large-scale farming and create employment opportunities for workers.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 29 years old and married. She supports a family of four. She has owned a motorbike transport business and a salon for the past four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 24,000. 

This is Purity's third loan for KES 40,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase spare parts for her motorbike and service it. The anticipated profits will help her to run her business activities. Her future plan is to have a fleet of vehicles for her transport business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorbike and service it.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is a 53-year-old married woman with two children. She's from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Erminda used her last loan to purchase ingredients needed to make banana-cue (barbecued banana). Her business has matured and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase bananas. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase bananas.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
Doña  Maria vive en Granada,  es comerciante se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Inicio su negocio con capital propio y el apoyo del esposo hace 30 años, sus productos los comercializa en un puesto propio que tiene en el mercado, también hace rifas para ayudarse con otros ingresos para los gastos del hogar. 
Solicito el crédito para comprar más mercadería como pintura de labios, pintura de uñas, vanidad, mascarilla para cejas, entre otros para aprovechar las ventas del mes de la madre y poder obtener mayor ganancias con el objetivo  de hacerle mejoras a su humilde casa y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Granada and is a businesswoman who works selling cosmetics.  She started her business with her own capital and the support of her husband 30 years ago.  She sells her products in her own stall that she has in the market and she also has raffles to help with additional income for household expenses.  

She requests this loan to purchase more merchandise such as lipstick, nail polish, and mascara, among other beauty products to make the most of sales for mother's month and obtain a better profit with the objective of making improvements to her humble home and having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as lipstick, nail polish, mascara, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe  tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Guadalupe siempre le ha gustado el comercio, siempre ha vendido mercadería como ropa nueva,  pero hace dos años que también decidió vender joyas en enchape de oro, como ser aretes, pulseras, cadenas y otros para generar más ingresos. Ella vende según pedido, tiene clientes que le compran al por mayor en temporadas de ferias o días festivos para reventa.
Esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras, es su segundo préstamo con la institución y lo va invertir en la compra de producto de enchape en oro para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de los clientes, ya está la temporada de la feria en la ciudad y va aprovechar  para incrementar sus ingresos. Su meta es generar más ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y convertirse en una distribuidora de productos de enchape.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 45 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in a neighborhood in the suburbs of San Pedro Sula.

Guadalupe has always enjoyed selling things, and in the past has sold products such as new clothing. However, two years ago she started to sell gold plated jewelry such as earrings, bracelets and chains to generate more income. She sells on order from her customers, and has customers who buy wholesale for resale during fair times or holidays.

She has requested 10,000.00 Honduran lempiras. This is her second loan with the institution, and she plans to invest the money in purchasing gold plated products to meet her customers’ orders. It is holiday time in her city and she wants to take advantage of this to increase her income. Her goal is to generate more income to support her husband with the household expenses, and to become a gold plated product distributor.

loans.use: To buy gold plated products to cover her customers’ orders.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente, de 35 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo, vive en el Níspero Santa Bárbara. Don Vicente tiene una fuente de ingresos que es una finca de café, anteriormente se dedicaba al cultivo de granos básicos como frijoles para el consumo y venta. Su padre le dio una herencia de 4 manzanas de terreno donde tiene su cultivo propio. Su motivación ha sido que el café está dejando muy buenas ganancias, tiene 11 años de mantener esta finca aunque su experiencia es de más años ya que desde pequeño ha trabajado la agricultura con su padre.  Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 12,000.00 Lempiras para mantenimiento y limpieza a la finca de café. Su meta es que su finca se mantenga y cosechar buena producción para lograr obtener los ingresos necesarios para su familia y mejorar su casa. Agradece a ODEF y a KIVA por el apoyo financiero brindado ya que es de mucha ayuda para ir creciendo y mejorando la producción.
texts.en:
Vicente is 35 years of age. He is married, has one child, and lives in Níspero Santa Bárbara. Vicente’s income comes from a coffee plantation. He used to work growing basic grains such as beans, which were for consumption and for sale. He inherited 2.8 hectares of land from his father, where he grows his own crops. 

Vicente’s coffee crops generate very good income. He has managed this plot of land for 11 years, although he has more years of experience as he worked in agriculture with his father from a very young age. He has requested a second loan of 12,000.00 Honduran lempiras for the upkeep of the land and to clear it of weeds. His goal is to maintain his plantation and harvest good produce so that he can obtain the income needed by his family and make improvements to his house. He would like to thank ODEF and Kiva for the financial support they give, as it is a great help to allow him to continue growing and improving his produce.

loans.use: To ensure the upkeep of his coffee plantation, buy fertilizer and cover the costs of clearing the land of weeds.

loans.name: Doris Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Doris tiene 46 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos de 26 y 30 años de edad quienes están casados, ella vive con su esposo y un sobrino en una colonia suburbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula.
Hace 4 años que inicio su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas como ser pastelitos fritos rellenos con carne y arroz con repollo y encurtido y venta de pollo frito con tajadas y refrescos. La venta la  realiza de forma ambulante a través de vendedores que tiene contratados. Ella contribuye mucho a la generación de empleo a personas de la comunidad quienes le venden la comida. Esta solicitando 8,000.00 Lempiras para comprar insumos para elaborar comida como harina de maíz, carnes, verduras, productos de empaque y otros. Los préstamos le ayudan a incrementar la producción y los ingresos familiares. Su meta es establecer el negocio en su casa y también ambulante. Agradece a ODEF y a KIVA por la oportunidad brindada para mejorar el negocio y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Doris is 46 years of age. She is married and has two children aged 26 and 30, who are married. She lives with her husband and nephew in a neighborhood in the suburbs of the municipality of San Pedro Sula.

Four years ago Doris started her own fast food business, selling small fried pastries filled with meat and rice with cabbage and pickle, fried chicken with fried plantains, and sodas. Her produce is sold on the street through various sellers who she has contracted. She makes a great contribution to generating employment for people in her community, who sell the food for her. 

Doris has requested 8,000.00 Honduran lempiras to buy supplies to prepare food, such as corn flour, meat, vegetables and packaging products, among others. The loans help her to increase her production and family income. Her goal is to have her business in her home as well as on the street. She would like to thank ODEF and Kiva for the opportunity given to her to improve her business and her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food, such as meat, vegetables, corn flour and packaging products.

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
Cupertino tiene 37 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la ciudad de Pucallpa se encuentra en la selva peruana, en Pucallpa encontramos mucha flora y fauna variada, es un lugar donde podemos apreciar la belleza de la naturaleza y sobre todo despejarnos del ruido. A su lado vive su esposa con la cual tiene 3 hijos de 9, 11 y 13 años, a quienes ama muchísimo y sobre todo se esfuerza por darle una vida digna. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta realizar algunos arreglos o reparaciones en su casa y en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz a la cubana que es arroz con plátano frito y carne frita. El solo estudio hasta el sexto grado de educación primaria pro le hubiera gustado terminar la escuela y aprender a manejar a camiones.

Con mucho entusiasmo Cupertino trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, el se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 70 clientes en el día, también trabaja en su campo de cultivo sembrando arroz y frejol;  él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque vende productos de calidad.

Cupertino está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como refaccionar su techo, mejorar las paredes de su vivienda ya que estas son de calamina, entre otros, de esta manera el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una educación a  sus hijos y ser un gran comerciante”.
texts.en:
Cupertino is 37 years of age. He lives in the city of Pucallpa, located in the Peruvian jungle. Pucallpa has lots of varied flora and fauna, and is a city where you can appreciate the beauty of nature and get away from the noise. 


Cupertino lives with his wife, with whom he has three children aged 9, 11 and 13. He loves his children a lot, and makes a great effort to give them a dignified life. When he has some free time he likes to fix up and repair his house, and also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, Arroz a la Cubana, which is rice with fried plantain and fried meat. Cupertino only studied to sixth grade in primary school, but he would have liked to finish school and learn to be a bus driver.


Cupertino is very enthusiastic when working in his business selling fruit. He spends about 10 hours a day in work and can have up to 70 customers each day. He also works in his field where he grows rice and beans. He thinks his business does well because he is very friendly with his customers, and above all because he sells quality produce.


Cupertino is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their help, he will be able to make improvements to his home. These include repairing the roof, improving the walls which are made of corrugated metal sheets, and other repairs. In this way he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life, and continue working to realize his biggest dream: to provide his children with education and be a successful seller.

loans.use: To improve his home (repair the roof and improve the walls).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, age 56, who is a resident of Taguig in the Philippines. Rosalio is her husband and business partner. Elizabeth is a mother to three children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elizabeth operates a retail business. She buys herbal products from wholesalers, and then sells them at a profit. The products she sells include vitamins, coffee and other products. Customers are attracted to her products due to her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy herbal products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elizabeth hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional herbal supplies and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Timinah

texts.en: Timinah is a married woman with two school-going children. She has been operating a grocery business for the past 3 years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a cereals shop in the future. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She operates a café which has been running for the past 6 years. Jane lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Food and school fees are her greatest monthly expenses. She intends to use the loan to purchase beans, rice, meat, and sugar. She aims at expanding the business and hire employees in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, meat, and sugar.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a widow with four children, all of whom are working. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a poshomill machine for grinding maize at the market, whereby her potential customers are the community members. She dreams of expanding and hiring more employees in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase fuel for operating her poshomill machine. Amina joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for operating her poshomill machine.

loans.name: Babatt Group

texts.fr:
CES MEMBRES POUR LA PLUS PART ONT LE MÊME CYCLE QUE LE BANC VILLAGEOIS CRÉE LE 06 JUIN 2001. ELLES HABITENT LE MÊME VILLAGE ET ELLES EXERCENT LE PETIT COMMERCE COMME ACTIVITÉ PRINCIPAL.

MADAME SOUADOU QUI EST A LA DROITE DE LA PHOTO LEVANT LA MAIN ET L EMPRUNTEUSE EN VEDETTE. ELLE EST VEUVE ET MÈRE DE 09 ENFANTS DONT 05 GARÇONS ET 04 FILLES. ELLE EST ÂGÉE DE 66 ANS.

ELLE ACHÈTE DU SUCRE ET DU POISSON DANS LES GRANDES VILLE DE LA RÉGION POUR LES REVENDRE AU VILLAGE OU LA DEMANDE ET TRÈS FORTE.

ELLE COMPTE ACHETER UN SAC DE SUCRE ET UN PANIER POISSON SEC QU ELLE VA REVENDRE EN DÉTAIL. LA MARCHANDISE EST  RENOUVELLEE. 

ELLE VISE A ASSURER L AVENIR DE SES ENFANTS QUI D AUTRES EN PAYANT LEUR SCOLARITÉ ET RENFORCER SES ÉPARGNES.
texts.en:
These group members are mostly on the same cycle as the 'banc villageois', created on the 6th of June, 2001. They live in the same village and are principally small retailers.

Souadou, on the right of the picture, with her hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is widowed and the mother of 9 children, 5 boys and 4 girls. She is 66 years old. She buys sugar and dried fish in the large towns of the area and resells it in the village, where demand is very high. She plans to renew her merchandise and buy a bag of sugar and a basket of dried fish, which she will resell, retail. She aims to ensure a good future for her children by, amongst other things, paying for their education and building up her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar and dried fish.

loans.name: Carolina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Carolina es originaria de Granada, de 41 años  de edad, casada, madre de 4 hijos estando a su cargo solo la menor de 16 años quien actualmente estudia su secundaria. Carolina inicio su negocio de venta de productos plásticos y cosméticos  con el apoyo de su esposo quien luego de estar trabajando en conjunto con ella, el decide viajar al extranjero para buscar mejores oportunidades de trabajo, se queda a cargo del negocio Carolina cual trata de mantenerlo por si sola ya que no recibe apoyo de nadie.

Tiene otros ingresos provenientes de las remesas que el esposo le envía, dinero que obtiene con arduo trabajo que realiza en el extranjero. Mientras tanto Carolina   comercializa su producto en los alrededores de Granada. 
Solicito el crédito Kiva  para comprar mercadería tales como bolsas plásticas y cosméticos, el cual le ayudara grandemente ya que le permitirá incrementar el inventario y mejorar las ventas sobre todo en esta época en el cual se celebra el día de las Madres. Los planes de ella a futuro son mejorar la seguridad del negocio en infraestructura, la próxima meta a seguir es trabajar duro para obtener mejor condiciones de vida y poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Carolina is originally from Granada. She is 41 years of age, married, and a mother of four children. Only the youngest of her children, who is 16 and a secondary school student, remains under her care. 


Carolina started her business selling plastic products and cosmetics with the support of her husband. After working some time with her, her husband decided to travel abroad to look for better job opportunities. Carolina was left in charge of the business, and tries to run it herself as she receives support from nobody.


She has other income in the form of the money which her husband sends to her, which he earns with the hard work he carries out abroad. Carolina sells her products in the areas surrounding Granada.


Carolina has requested a Kiva loan to buy merchandise such as plastic bags and cosmetics. This will help her a lot as she will be able to increase her stock and improve her sales, particularly around this period, which is Mother’s Day. In the future she plans to improve the security of her business infrastructure, and her next goal is to work hard to improve her living conditions and realize her dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as plastic bags and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
This is Mamerta, age 74, who is a resident of Taguig City in the Philippines. She is married to Teodorico, a carpenter, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Mamerta oversees operations of the couple's jeepney motor vehicle transportation business. (Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines.) She has one jeepney unit with a 14-to-16-person capacity. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Mamerta is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000. She will utilize the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney motor vehicle for her transportation business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mamerta dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

Note: All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney motor vehicle for her transportation business.

loans.name: Jentah

texts.en:
Jentah is a single woman with two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. 

For the past 2 years, she has operated a grocery-selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale grocery shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of bananas, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of bananas, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 54, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pc 2 Thioce Est Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée depuis le 02/09/2008.
Il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et des quartiers environnants.
Elle sont unis par des relations sociales communes et s'activent toutes dans le petit commerce de détails.

Madame Aissa est une femme marié âgée de 51 ans et mère de 4 enfants et 4 autres qui lui sont confiés .elle fait le commerce de chaussure  préfabriqué ,d’huile de palme et de jus de citron depuis longtemps. son nouveau crédit de 50000f lui permettra de se procurer la marchandise pré citée .
Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à payer la scolarité de ses enfants ,et d'acheter de la  nourriture pour la maison mais de renforcer ses épargnes au  niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on the 2nd of September, 2008. It is made up of women who live in the same district and surrounding neighbourhoods. They are united by common social relationships and all work as small retailers.

Aissa is a 51 year-old married woman, and the mother of 4 children. She also has 4 more children in her care. She has been selling pre-made shoes, palm oil and lemon juice for a long time. Her new loan of 50 000 francs will allow her to restock on her merchandise. Her profits allow her to pay her children's educational expenses, to buy food for the household and also to build up her savings in the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy pre-made shoes, palm oil and lemon juice.

loans.name: Kepha

texts.en:
Kepha is a resident and a farmer in Nyamira area of South Rift Kenya. He is aged forty-four and married with four children aged between ten and two years. His farm produces mainly bananas, beans, and maize among other crops. He has twenty years of experience in active farming. He gets additional income from a timber hardware business.

Kepha has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow, which he believes will provide the family with milk for daily consumption as well as income to meet other family needs. He also plans to buy more land to expand his farming business in the future. He adds that the farming income will also help him in educating his children.

He says harsh weather conditions are the major challenge but hopes the Juhudi Kilimo loan will improve his farming income and enable him to build a good residential house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Imnazar

texts.en:
Imnazar is a 59-year-old married woman, and she has a 28-year-old son. Imnazar is a conservative person, so her husband appears in her Kiva photo.

The scope of her employment is agriculture, and she has been engaged in that for 20 years. She sells milk products at the bazaar. Her family helps her. She plans to expand her business and will use the income to help her son get married. There are three cows at her stalls, and she wants to obtain 1000 AZN to buy one more cow. Imnazar is very responsible woman, and she hopes for your help and support. 

On the photograph you can see Imnazar's husbands.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 53, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Gil, a driver, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 (Philippine pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fatou Sabibou

texts.fr:
CE MEMBRE HABITE DANS LE MÊME VILLAGE QUE LES AUTRES MEMBRES DU BANC VILLAGEOIS CRÉE LE 06 JUIN 2001. ELLE S ACTIVE DANS DANS LE PETIT COMMERCE.

MADAME FATOU EST MARIÉE ET MÈRE DE DEUX ENFANTS DONT UN GARÇON ET UNE FILLE. ELLE EST ÂGÉE DE 43 ANS

ELLE COMPTE S APPROVISIONNER ET REVENDRE DANS LES MARCHES ENVIRONNANT.

ELLE VA ACHETER DE L HUILE DE PALME ET DES ARACHIDES EN QUANTITÉ ET D ACHETER CHAQUE SEMAINE UN SAC DE PAIN DE SINGE ET UNE BASSINE DE BISSAP.

AVEC LES BÉNÉFICES GÉNÉRÉS PAR SES ACTIVITÉS ELLE ASSURE SA SANTE CELLE DE SES ENFANTS ET LA NOURRITURE DE SA FAMILLE.
texts.en:
This member lives in the same village as the other members of the "banc villageois", created on the 6th of June, 2001. She is a small retailer.

Fatou Sabibou is married and the mother of 2 children, a boy and a girl. She is 43 years old. She plans to get supplies and resell them at the surrounding markets. She will buy palm oil and a large quantity of groundnuts, and will also buy a basket of monkey bread and a bowl of hibiscus flower juice each week. With the profits generated by her business, she is able to take care of her own and her children's health and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy monkey bread, hibiscus flower juice, palm oil and groundnuts.

loans.name: Shovkat

texts.ru: Шовкат женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Жена занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Более 13 лет Шовкат занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота.  Его сын помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Шовкат хотел бы получить займ для покупки цемента, досок, кирпича, ДСП и ДВП, а также на остальную сумму хочет установить окна, двери и покрыть пол. Шовкат надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Shovkat is married. He is the father of three children and a responsible family man. His wife provides sewing services. For over 13 years, Shovkat has been buying and reselling cattle. His sone helps him in his business. Shovkat would like to receive a loan to buy concrete, bricks, particle board and fiber boards, and to use the remaining funds for the installation of windows, doors and flooring. Shovkat is hoping for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase  concrete, bricks, particle board and fiber board.

loans.name: Orlando Martin

texts.es:
Orlando es un hombre de 49 años, con un gran espíritu emprendedor y muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, caracterizada por sus hermosas playas y clima cálido, Orlando convive con su pareja y su hijo de 17 años, con quienes le gusta compartir gratos momentos familiares.
Desde hace más de 10 años, Orlando se dedica a trabajar como chofer de mototaxi, el inició su negocio manejando una mototaxi alquilada, gracias a su esfuerzo y entusiasmo logró comprar una mototaxi propia con la cual trabaja actualmente, él cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su personalidad alegre y buen trato en la atención a sus clientes.
Orlando se siente muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que cuenta con un terreno y desea realizar la construcción de su casa; de esta manera desea poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y lograr que su hijo pueda llegar a ser un profesional y un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Orlando, age 49, has a great enterprising spirit, and he is a very hard-worker.  He lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for its beautiful beaches and warm climate.  Orlando lives with his life partner and his 17 year old son.  He likes to share amiable time with his family.

Orlando has been working as a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for over ten years.  When he started his business he drove a rented mototaxi.  Thanks to his effort and enthusiasm he managed to buy his own mototaxi, which he currently uses for work.  He believes that his business is going well because of his happy personality and the good treatment and service that he gives his customers.

Orlando is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to him he will be able to carry out the plan for his house.  He has the land, and he wants to build his house.  In this way he is hoping to be able to give his family a better quality of life.  He also wishes that his son will be able to become a professional and an honorable man.

loans.use: to build his house on land that he has.

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
This is Flocerfida, 62, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Aniceto, her business partner.  She is a mother to her children. Flocerfida and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Flocerfida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Flocerfida is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Flocerfida hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a business of selling boiled eggs at the market. His potential customers are town dwellers. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase crates of eggs for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase crates of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 20 years old, single and supports her parents. She has been running a restaurant for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

With her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, she intends to purchase service items, foodstuffs and other food supplies. The anticipated profits will be used to support running the restaurant's business.

Her future dreams are to grow her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase service items, foodstuffs and other food items

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is 30 years old and is married to Rose, who contributes to the family income. He has been running his supplies business for a period of about one year with an income of about KES 9,500.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he wants to use it to buy more stock of diapers and tissues for sale. He hopes to grow his business and start a big shop of supplies.

loans.use: to buy stock of diapers and tissues for sale.

loans.name: Gantsooj

texts.en:
Mr. Gantsooj, 33, is a gas fitter. He has been doing this job for five years. He lives with his wife and his two sons on his small plot of land in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. His wife works as a nurse in the regional medical center. 

Gantsooj wants to rebuild his wooden fence using block bricks/grey big bricks made from coal ash and cement because his old fence is damaged and old. He believes that the fence will be stable and good-looking. 

The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of bricks for rebuilding his fence. Previously, he took a loan to build his small house.

loans.use: to cover the cost of bricks for rebuilding his fence.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина добрая и трудолюбивая женщина, она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей, старшему 4 года, а младшему 1,5 года.  Муж работает кассиром в ресторане «Зайтун». Более 8 лет она торгует на центральном рынке города. Она занимается розничной торговлей детской обуви и женских национальных платков и шарфов. Раньше она закупала товар на соседнем рынке, а сейчас закупается товар на «Атуш» базаре города. Муж помогает ей по бизнесу, особенно в доставке товаров. Зарина, хотела бы получить займ для покупки летного ассортимента товара. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Zarrina is kind and hardworking. She's married and the loving mother of two children, ages 4 and 1.5. Her husband works as a cashier in a restaurant called "Zaitun". 

For the past eight years, Zarrina's run a business in the city's main market. She sells children's shoes, women's handkerchiefs and scarfs. She used to purchase her products at a neighboring market, but now she buys it on the "Atush" bazar. Her husband helps Zarrina run the business, especially with delivering and transporting goods. 

Zarrina is asking for a loan in order to purchase some summer merchandise. She hopes for your help and charity.

loans.use: To buy summer merchandise.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
This is Luisa, 53, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Mario, an accountant, and is a mother to her two children. Luisa and her children manage the family household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luisa maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange.  A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers depend on for their income. Luisa's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Luisa dreams of expanding her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed for her business

loans.name: Hannah Karina

texts.es:
La joven Hannah, casada, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería es originaria de Granada, madre de dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad actualmente van al colegio. Ella inicio trabajando a la edad de 9 años con su mama y hermana salían a las calles a vender enchiladas, buñuelos etc asi empezó a adquirir experiencia una vez casada sigue vendiendo, luego la mama enfermo y murió ella decide seguir trabajando con sus hermana con el tiempo fue ahorrando para poner su propio negocio el que actualmente es una pulpería, cuenta con otros ingreso ya que el esposo recibe liquidación de su trabajo y aporta para el negocio y los gastos del hogar, también se ayuda con la venta de cosméticos Avon y ropa. Su expectativa es Mantener el negocio en su casa ya que donde se encuentra cuenta con bastante clientela y seguir creciendo con diversos productos. 

Solicito el préstamo para productos básico de la pulpería tales como avena, pan, arroz, azúcar, café, jabón, y productos alusivos al día de las madres, todo lo necesario para surtir su negocio con el objetivo de aumentar sus ventas para obtener mas ganancias, su planes futuros es solicitar un nuevo préstamo para terminar de mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Hannah is married and a merchant in the grocery store business.  She is originally from Granada and is a mother of two children aged 4 and 6 who attend school.  She started working at the age of 9 with her mother and sister.  They would work as street vendors selling enchiladas, fried pastries, etc. and in this way she began to gain experience.  She continued working once she got married and then her mother became ill and passed away.  She decided to keep working with her sister.  With time, she saved enough to open up her own business which is a small grocery store.  She has other income since her husband receives severance pay from his job and contributes to the business and household expenses. She also sells Avon cosmetics and clothing to help her income.  Her hope is to maintain her business in her home because in this location she has many customers and to continue growing with a variety of products. 

She is requesting this loan to buy basic products for the small grocery story such as oats, bread, rice, sugar, coffee, soap, and Mother’s Day products - everything necessary to stock her business with the objective of increasing her sales so as to have greater earnings.  Her plans for the future are to request a loan to improve her home’s infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy basic products for her small grocery story such as oats, bread, rice, sugar, coffee, soap, and Mother’s Day products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for her call center business.

loans.name: Rahiema

texts.en:
This is Rahiema, 32, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rahiema operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rahiema hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Munkhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbayar, 45, works as support personnel at a construction company. He has been doing this job since 2007. He lives with his wife and his four children in his small old house, which is in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

He bought his plot of the land and house in 2007 and he never made any repairs or renovation to his house. He decided to make repairs to his old house. At first, he planned to insulate the walls of his house because it becomes very cold inside the house without the wall insulation, and it costs too much money for the smoky coal to get the inside of the house warm. Also, it is the worst influence on the air of the city. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters, where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Mr. Munkhbayar is taking will used to buy the building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of his house to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.use: to buy the building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of his house to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.name: Byambatsog

texts.en:
Byambatsog, 34, runs a taxi. He lives with his wife and his three children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, which is in Ulaanbaatar's ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. 

He has been running his business since 2010 and now it is the main income source of his family. Her wife has been unemployed for a long time and she wants to start a new business. 

This time Byambatsog is requesting a loan to repair his taxi, which is damaged. He believes his business will be good after the repair.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene, 39, drives a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his two children in his house, which is in the Ulaanbaatar ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. 

He has been running his business for 1.6 years and now it is the main income source of his family. This time he is taking a loan to repair his taxi because it is old and needs repair.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: G.s. En Dios Confiamos Group

texts.es: G.S  EN Dios Confiamos  sus integrantes  zenovia,  Domitila, Lilliam. Las cuales tiene actividad económica diferentes , a pesar de todo ellas se han podido comprender, ayudar mutuamente, para ser responsable y tener buenas relaciones como grupo,  senovia  su actividad es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación,  la cual la ha podido sacar adelante  e invertirle gracias al  apoyo que fundación les brinda con los financiamiento ella necesita el dinero para la compra de  productos  como:   galletas, fósforos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, jabón  entre otros.
texts.en:
The members of the En Dios Confiamos solidarity group are Zenovia, Domitila and Lilliam. They all have different businesses, but despite this they have been able to understand and help one another to be responsible and work well together as a group. Zenovia runs a small grocery store in her house. This has helped her get ahead, and she has invested in her business thanks to the financial support given to her by the foundation. 

She has requested this loan to buy products such as cookies, matches, rice, sugar, oil, detergents and soap, among others.

loans.use: To buy cookies, matches, rice, sugar, oil, detergents and soap, among others.

loans.name: Lorena Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Lorena, es ama de casa y comerciante se dedica a la venta de pasteles y tortas de cumpleaños, está casada y es madre de un hijo. Ella aprendió el oficio de maestra pero de ejercer esta carrera ya que al morir su madre no tenía a nadie quien el cuidara a su hijo. Pero busco otra manera de cómo generar ingresos para aportar con los gastos del hogar y entonces de dedico a vender pasteles, mientras su esposo se dedica a ser chofer de carga pesada. 
Ella solicita un crédito Kiva para comprar una batidora para hacer sus pasteles y repostería. Este crédito le ayudara en gran manera pues podrá agilizar el proceso de producción para cumplir con los pedidos y darse a conocer ya que desea convertir su negocio en un Pastelería Famosa donde asistan bastantes clientes y salir adelante siendo una empresaria exitosa en la ciudad de Granada.
texts.en:
Lorena is a housewife, and also operates a business selling pastries and birthday cakes. She is married and has one son. She studied to become a teacher and started down that career path, but when her mother died, she did not have anyone to care for her son while she was away at work. By baking and selling cakes and other baked goods, she found another way to generate income and help with household expenses, while at the same time being present in her son’s life. Her husband works as a heavy load driver.

Lorena is requesting a Kiva loan in order to purchase an electric mixer for making her cakes and pastries. The support from this loan will be of great help to her as it will allow her to streamline and speed up her baking process, helping her to complete more customer orders in a shorter amount of time. She hopes, in time, to turn her bakery into a famous bakery that is well known and serves a large customer base, making her a successful businesswoman in the city of Granada.

loans.use: to purchase an electric mixer for making cakes and pastries.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон добрый и воспитанный человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет троих сыновей. Жена работает в салоне маникюрщицей. Более 12 лет Илхомчон занимается купле- продажей колбасных изделий, сыр и сосиски на центральном рынке. Товар привозит сами поставщики разных фирм города. Является собственником бизнеса, начинал с мелкой продажи и за несколько лет достиг таких хороших результатов. Илхомчон запрашивает займ в размере 10000 сомони и намерен использовать его для закупа колбасных изделий. Он надеется на вашу доброту и щедрость.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon is a kind and civil person, he's married and has three children. Ilhomjon's wife works as a manicurist in a beauty salon. For the past twelve years, Ilhomjon has run a business focused on buying and selling various meats, cheese and sausages on the city's central market. The city's suppliers deliver it to the market themselves. 
Ilhomjon began his business with small sales and achieved some very impressive results in the following years. 
He's asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni in order to purchase meat products. Ilhomjon is hoping for your help and charity.

loans.use: to purchase meat products.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren is 32 years old and he lives with his wife and his son in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt, in his brother’s plot of the land. 

He works as a watchman in a private company. His wife works as an accountant in other company. He owns a small plot of the land close to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He wants to build a small family house there, so he is requesting a loan to buy the building materials to build his family house. He hopes that his family will have their house next year.

loans.use: To buy the building materials to build his family house.

loans.name: Tungalagtamir

texts.en:
Tungalagtamir, 25, works as a driver. He does not own a home and now he lives with his wife in a rental house. He has been doing his job since 2009 and his wife works as a railway woman. 

Tungalagtamir moved out from his parents house three years ago and he never had his own capital. Recently, he decided to purchase a small plot of land in a rural area that is close to the city. But he lacks enough money. He is taking a loan to cover the cost of his purchasing the plot of the land for his family.

loans.use: To cover the cost of his purchasing a plot of the land for his family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, beans, maize and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, beans, maize and rice.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
El  Sr.  Guadalupe tiene 59 años de edad, él nos cuenta que trabajo desde muy joven y que no teme a ningún desafío y trabajo. Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de leche ya que tiene un tambo, además de eso se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería como ser de prendas y zapatos.
El comenta que luego de mucho esfuerzo  logro  comprar  para su moto carro para el reparto de la leche de vaca y de esa forma poder facilitar su trabajo. El Sr. Guadalupe cuenta con una gran clientela; y comenta quuecon este trabajo logro mejorar su vivienda y darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos.
El necesita de este crédito para la compra ropas con lo cual podrá abastecerse y seguir vendiendo sus productos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 59 years old. He told us he has been working since he was very young and that there are neither challenges nor jobs that can scare him. Owing a milking yard, Guadalupe sells milk; on top of this he also sells haberdashery products such as clothes and shoes.
He says that with great efforts he succeeded in buy a vehicle to distribute his cow milk, in order to make his job easy. Guadalupe can count on many customers, and he says that thanks to his job he has succeeded in making improvements to his house and in providing his children with the mandatory education.
The reason he needs this loan is to purchase clothes to stock-up his inventory, in order to keep on selling his products.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Don Pedro habitante del departamento de Granada, casado, se dedica al comercio tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura para carros. Inicio su negocio de manera familiar primero como ayudante  hace 15 años, luego con el tiempo que llevaba trabajando con su familia él se sentía que ya tenía experiencia para trabajar solo y decide poner su propio negocio a la edad de 28 años.
 Actualmente en su negocio cuenta con 2 trabajadores y un aprendiz a quienes les paga semanal, su servicio lo brinda  en la misma comunidad y en los alrededores de Granada ya que tiene bastantes clientes por su experiencia, es reconocido por el buen trabajo que realiza, no cuenta con otros ingresos depende de su taller de enderezado, su expectativa es seguir con su creatividad, entregar buen trabajo y ser puntual para mantener siempre a sus clientes. 
Solicito el préstamo para compra de  pinturas y  herramientas para dar por terminados trabajos que tiene pendientes el cual le ayudara porque entregara su trabajo en el tiempo solicitado, con el objetivo de obtener más ganancias y mejorar su negocio.
Sus planes futuros es comprar su propio terreno y construir su propia casa para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in the administrative division of Granada. He is married, and has an auto bodywork and car paint workshop. He started in the family business 15 years ago as an assistant. Over time working with his family he felt that he had enough experience to work alone, and set up his own business when he was 28 years old.

His business currently has two employees and an apprentice, who he pays on a weekly basis. He offers his services in the local community and the areas around Granada. He has many customers due to his experience, and is well-known for the good work he does. He has no other income and depends on his auto bodywork shop. He hopes to continue with the business, delivering good work and being punctual to keep his customers.

He has requested this loan to buy paint and tools to finish some pending jobs he has. This will help him as he will be able to deliver his work on time, which will give him more income and help his business.

In the future he hopes to buy his own plot of land and build a house to provide for his family’s future.

loans.use: To buy paint and tools.

loans.name: Antonio Angel

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre de 46 años, soltero, natural de la ciudad de Ica, caracterizada por su clima cálido y gente acogedora; Antonio gusta de escuchar música en sus ratos libres, así también le gusta cocinar uno de sus platos favoritos como es el "Picante de Pallares".
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Antonio trabaja en su negocio de venta de juguetes, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender entre 30 a 35 clientes, él cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que ofrece buenos precios y tiene una muy buena atención hacia sus clientes. 
Antonio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de más mercadería (juguetes) para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera poder obtener mejores ingresos, y en futuro no muy lejano Antonio sueña con tener su propia tienda y convertirse en uno de los mayores distribuidores de juguetes, mejorando de esta manera su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio is 46 years of age and single. He is from the city of Ica, which has a warm climate and welcoming population. Antonio likes to listen to music in his spare time, as well as cooking one of his favorite dishes, Picante de Pallares (a spicy butterbean stew).


Hard-working and dedicated, Antonio works selling toys. He spends approximately 12 hours each day in his business, and can handle between 30 and 35 customers. He thinks that his business does well because he offers good prices and has very good customer service.

Antonio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to buy more merchandise (toys) to supply his business. This will allow him to generate better income. In the near future Antonio wants to have his own store, becoming one of the largest toy distributors and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (toys) to supply his business.

loans.name: Rolando Alcides

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa la ciudad de Pucallpa se encuentra en la selva peruana, en Pucallpa encontramos mucha flora y fauna variada, es un lugar donde podemos apreciar la belleza de la naturaleza y sobre todo despejarnos del ruido. Rolado vive al lado de su esposa y juntos tienen 4 hijos, cuyas edades comprenden 3, 7,7 y 10 añitos, son su adoración y sobre todo su motor para seguir adelante, aunque en ocasiones le sacan canas verdes. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo tuvo estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería mecánica.

Con mucho entusiasmo rolando trabaja en su negocio de duplicados de llave, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo con calidad.

Rolando está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más llaves para poder realizar su trabajo, de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una ferretería”.
texts.en:
Rolando is 45 years of age and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Pucallpa is located in the Peruvian jungle. Pucallpa has lots of varied flora and fauna, and is a city where you can appreciate the beauty of nature and get away from the noise. 


Rolando lives with his wife, and they have four children aged three, seven, seven and ten. He adores his children and they are what motivate him to get ahead, although sometimes they drive him crazy. In his spare time he likes to play football with his neighborhood friends, and to eat one of his favorite dishes, delicious rice with chicken. 


Due to his parents’ scarce financial resources he only went to primary school, but he would have liked to study mechanical engineering.


Rolando works in his key-copying business with lots of enthusiasm. He spends approximately 10 hours per day at work, and thinks that his business does well because he is very friendly to his customers and, above all, because he provides a quality service.


Rolando is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy more keys for his business. This will enable him to improve his income and continue fighting to realize his biggest dream, which is to own a hardware store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (keys).

loans.name: Orlando Adrian

texts.es:
Orlando es un hombre de 57 años, natural de la ciudad de Chincha, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, Orlando es un hombre de familia que con la comprensión y ayuda de su esposa, han dedicado sus esfuerzos en sacar adelante a su hijos y  hacerlos profesionales, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar noticias y en ocasiones le gusta preparar su platillo favorito el Arroz Chaufa. 
Con mucho entusiasmo y empeño, Orlando se dedica a su negocio de alquiler de una maquina mezcladora para construcción; asimismo, brinda servicio de taxi y apoya en la venta de bisutería del negocio de su esposa, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 20 clientes, Orlando cree que su negocio marcha bien por el buen servicio y amabilidad que brinda a sus clientes. 
Orlando se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá abastecer su nuevo negocio de una pequeña tienda, con productos de primera necesidad, tales como tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.; de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos y con ello espera poder comprar un vehículo propio que pueda servirle para trabajar, y en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder terminar la construcción de su hogar.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 57-year-old gentleman and a native of the city of Chincha. He is married and has three children. Orlando is a family man who understands and helps his wife. Through their efforts, they have been able to move their children forward and see them become professionals. In his free time, he enjoys listening to the news and occasionally preparing his favorite dish -- fried rice.

With great enthusiasm and effort, Orlando engages in his business of renting out a cement mixer for construction jobs. In addition, he provides taxi services and helps with his wife's trinket business. Orlando works approximately 12 hours a day and is able to serve up to 20 customers. He believes his business is doing well because of the friendly service he provides to his customers.

Orlando is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. He thanks them for the assistance they have provided so that he can start a new business, a small store. Orlando plans to buy basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, oil, and other items so that he can increase his income. With his earnings, he hopes to buy his own vehicle that he can use for work. In the distant future, he wants to finish the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity products for opening a general store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret still practices farming and the business is doing well. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Margaret will use the loan to pay school fees for her son. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the farming business to buy seedlings and fertilizer to boost the farming business which will help her service her loan successfully. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine, 38, is engaged in selling women’s clothes and shoes, trinkets and chandeliers. Kristine buys merchandise from China and Turkey and resells it at a rented stall in the market. She has been running her business about 10 years and her occupation allows her to provide for her family. 

Kristine lives in Yerevan with her mother who helps her in business. When Kristine goes to China and Turkey for merchandise purchasing, her mother replaces her at the stall.
 
Kristine is a translator and she has worked as an English teacher. Sometimes she gets offers for simultaneous translations, and this allows her to gain extra income.

Kristine is asking for a $2,000 loan to buy summer season clothes and shoes from China to resell.

loans.use: to buy summer season clothes and shoes from China to resell.

loans.name: Nooretet

texts.en:
Nooretet is 39 years old and married. She supports a family of five children. She is a beans farmer and has been in this business for the last 12 years with a monthly income of KES 17,000. 

She is requesting a second loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd., and this will facilitate her in preparation of the farm and purchase of fertilizers.

She hopes to use anticipated profits to expand her farm and reinvest. Her future dreams are to improve the family's living standards and educate her children

loans.use: to prepare the farm and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a mother of three children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future. 

Fatuma is requesting KES 30,000 to purchase sacks of maize, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: David Rolando

texts.es:
DAVID ROLANDO tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar.

DAVID ROLANDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cebada, trigo, habas también se dedica a la cría de pollos, cerdos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, cerdos y ganado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales. 

El desfío al que se enfrenta es el transporte y vías de comunicación. 

El sueño es poder tener un vehículo propio.En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly y disfrutar de la música clásica y dedicarse a la construcción.
texts.en:
David Rolando is 22 years old, he is single, he has no children and he lives with his mother in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province.

David Rolando is a farmer, and he plants maize, barley, wheat and broad beans; he also breeds chickens and pigs.

He is requesting a loan to buy chickens, pigs and cattle; thanks to this loan he will be able to buy the animals he needs.

The main challenges he has to face are transpiration and communications.

He dreams of owing a vehicle of his own. In his free time he like playing volleyball, listening to classical music and engaging in DYI.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Mario Santiago

texts.es: El Sr Mario Santiago  inicio su negocio hace varios años con un poco de capital propio , esta iniciativa de trabajo la adquirió por la necesidad de tener un medio para poder mantener a su familia, en la actualidad el ha adquirido experiencia  en la elaboraracion de los diferentes platillos que ofrece a su cliente, lo cual le ha ayudado a obtener muy buenas reputación, a incrementar su venta  por su servicio, el está solicitando el refinanciamiento para compra productos necesario para la elaboración de diferentes platillos. Como: arroz, tomates, chiltomas, carne de res y de pollo, sal, condimentos, utensilios de cocina entre otros.
texts.en:
Mario Santiago started his business several years ago with a small amount of his own capital. He did this because he needed a way to support his family. Since then he has gained experience in preparing the various different dishes he offers his customers. This has earned him a very good reputation, as well as allowing him to increase his sales. 

He is requesting this loan to buy products that he needs to make his different dishes, such as rice, tomatoes, sweet peppers, beef and chicken, salt, seasoning and kitchen utensils, among others.

loans.use: To buy rice, tomatoes, sweet peppers, beef and chicken, salt, seasoning and kitchen utensils, among others.

loans.name: Ana Bell

texts.es:
Ana tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, además en él se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, algodón, paprika, entre otros. Ana vive al lado de sus 5 hijos  cuyas edades comprenden 27, 16, 12, 10 y 5, a los cuales quiere muchísimo y a quienes saca adelante sola ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono y ella se convirtió en padre y madre para ellos,  el mayor de sus hijos siempre la apoya, sobre todo cuando ella sale a trabajar ya que la ayuda con el cuidado de sus hermanos menores.  Cuando tiene un tiempo libre a Ana le gusta ver televisión y en ocasiones preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Ella solo estudio hasta el primer grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Medicina.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ana trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, dulces, golosinas, entre otros, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque cocina muy rico.

Aba esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, agua mineral, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y así podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una vivienda mas grande”.
texts.en:
Ana, 44, lives in the district of Santiago, Ica, Peru, which is known for its warm climate.  The district is also characterized by development in agriculture, especially the cultivation of grapes, asparagus, cotton, and paprika among other crops.  Ana lives with her five children whose ages are 27, 16, 12, 10, and 5.  She loves them very much and helps them get ahead on her own since the father of her children abandoned her.  She became a father and a mother for them.  Her eldest child always supports her especially when she goes to work and helps her take care of the younger children.  When she has free time, Ana likes to watch television and occasionally prepare her favorite dishes one of which is the delicious “Carapulcra con sopa seca”.  She only attended school up until the first year of high school, but she would have liked to study Medicine. 

Ana works with great enthusiasm at her business of selling food, sweets, and snacks among other things.  She works at her job for about 8 hours a day and can attend up to 20 customers a day.  She believes she does well at her business because she is very kind to her customers and mostly because she is a great cook.  

Ana is very grateful with the loans from Kiva - thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy soft drinks, snacks, and mineral water among other things.  In this way she will be able to have more products to offer her customers and will be able to keep working to realize her biggest dream: To give her children a good education and to have larger home.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks among other things.

loans.name: Madrid Lorena

texts.es:
Madrid es una mujer de 46 años, viven en la ciudad de Ica, es casada y tiene un hijo de 18 años, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir momentos gratos con su familia y en ocasiones los consiente preparando su platillo favorito el "Arroz con Pollo"; con mucho empeño Madrid terminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Derecho.
Con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo, Madrid trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado; asimismo, cuenta con un negocio de alquiler de mototaxis (02), ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 6 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 9 clientes, ella cuenta con la fidelidad de sus clientes debido a su carisma y buena atención.
Madrid se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento y reparación general que necesitan sus mototaxis para que se encuentren operativas y puedan ser utilizadas para su alquiler; de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos y en poco tiempo espera poder tener un local propio para la venta de ropa y calzado y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
