texts.es: Julieth invirtió su credikiva en la compra de mercancías variadas, la cual exhibió en su catálogo, con descuentos especiales, logrando captar la atención, el interés el deseo y la acción de compra de sus clientes.  Desde que recibió su credikiva, las ventas han aumentado y por eso se propone aplicar a un nuevo crédito, con el cual comprará nuevamente mercancías femeninas, como accesorios ropa exterior y calzado, para responder a su creciente clientela. Aprovechando las ofertas de cada campaña para incrementar su utilidad. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva:  “Estoy muy agradecida de la ayuda recibida y ojalá puedan seguir apoyándonos a otras personas emprendedoras, que solo necesitan recursos para prosperar y sacar adelante a su familia.”
texts.en:
Julieth invested her Kiva loan in a variety of merchandise that she showed in her catalogue.  With special discounts she managed to get her customers' attention, interest, desire, and purchases.

Her sales have increased since she got her Kiva loan, so she is applying for another loan to buy women's merchandise such as accessories, clothing, and footwear, to respond to her growing clientele and take advantage of seasonal sales to increase her profits.

She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "I am very grateful for the help I have received.  I hope you can continue supporting us, other enterprising people who only need resources to prosper and get their families ahead."

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, clothing, and footwear.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Margaret has operated her grocery business for the past two years, her major customers being members of her community. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.

With the loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Los Helechos (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama los helechos y se integra de tres personas quien cada uno se dedica a su  actividad y viven en una comunidad llamada reforma que esta a una hora de Tecpatan.

   Quien se le tomo  la entre vista se llama Tomas quien es soltero  y a un vive con sus padres  y trabaja para sostenerlo y darle lo más necesario  a ellos.

   El solcito el préstamo  para invertirlo  en la compra de  materiales, como  son  cemento, arena y cal para la elaboración de block en donde lleva trabajando nueve años siete meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha estado  obteniendo  sus ingresos para su familia.

   Don tomas se dedica a esta actividad para apoyarse con los gastos que se generan en su hogar y comenta que este negocio es bueno ya que  con ello  obtiene muy buenas ganancias.
 
   Lo  que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad el siga trabajando y con el  préstamo apoyarse para comprar los materiales  para elaborar los block.

     Las personas que integran en el grupo son las señoras:
María Ruth, quien invertirá en la compra y venta de fierros viejo y la señora Alicia  invertirá en la compra de  marranos  para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Los Helechos," and is made up of 3 people who each have their own business and live in the community of Reforma, which is an hour away from Tecpatan.

Tomas was interviewed for this posting.  He is single and lives with his parents.  He works to support them and to provide for their needs.

He is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials, such as cement, sand and lime, that he will use to make cement blocks.  He has been doing this type of work for 9 and a half years.  He comments that it is going very well, because with this business he has been earning the income he needs for his family.

Tomas works to support the expenses of his household, and he says that this business is good, because he gets very good earnings from it.

What he wants is to continue to work in this small business.  This loan will support him by allowing him to purchase the materials he needs to make cement blocks.  

The other members of this group are:  Maria Ruth, who will invest the loan in her business buying and selling scrap metal, and Alicia, who will use the loan to purchase pigs to fatten and later sell.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make cement blocks

loans.name: Mercado 16 De Febrero Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Mercado 16 de Febrero, está Conformado por la señora Fidelina va a comprar con su préstamo pollo entero por mayoreo y verduras, la señora Marina va a comprar productos naturales por paquete, la señora Olga va a comprar frutas y verduras por mayoreo plátanos, sandia, melón, piñas, papayas, cebollas, papas, la señora Carmen va a darle mantenimiento a baffles, luces, amplificadores. La señora Olga tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos 1 varón que es ingeniero y 2 mujeres una están estudiando la primaria y la joven la universidad, ella vende frutas y verduras en el mercado y aguas frescas, frutas, habas, cacahuate en la escuela primaria, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar vasos desechables, cacahuate, haba, azúcar y frutas y verduras mangos, piñas, sandia, jícama, y verduras, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años, a ella le gustaron las ventas, ella trabajaba con una señora vendiendo verduras  en el mercado y le gustaron las ventas, su negocio es importante porque le ha dado muchas cosas de ahí comen se visten y salen a pasear, a ella le gusta vender en la primaria con los niño, su negocio es conocido por la fruta de primera calidad, fresca y sabrosa. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que su negocio crezca más y que sus hijas terminar su carrera. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos la confianza que nos dan, gracias a sus préstamos crecemos los negocio y la familia está mejor esperamos no decepcionarlos y  que nos sigan favoreciendo con sus préstamos”.
texts.en:
The name of this solidarity group is Mercado 16 de Febrero, which comprises Fidelina, who will use her loan to purchase wholesale whole chickens and vegetables; Marina, who will purchase natural products by the package; Olga, who will purchase wholesale fruits and vegetables (banana, watemelon, melon, pineapple, papaya, onion, potato); and Carmen, who will perform maintenance on loudspeakers, lights, and amplifiers. 
Olga is 40 years old and married. She has three children: her son is an engineer, one of her two daughters is in elementary school, and the other goes to university. She sells fruit and vegetables in the market, and fruit drinks, fruit, beans, and peanuts at an elementary school. She requested her loan in order to purchase disposable cups, peanuts, beans, sugar, and fruits and vegetables (mango, pineapple, watermelon, jicama). 
She started her business 20 years ago. She worked with a lady selling vegetables in the market and was happy with the sales. Her business is important because it has provided her with many things: enough income for food, clothing, and leasure. She likes selling at the school with the children, and her business is known for its top-quality fruit, which is fresh and tasty. 
Her hopes and dreams are that her business will keep growing, and that her daughters will finish school. She wants Kiva and Fundación Realidad to know that “We are grateful for the trust they deposit in us. Thanks to their loans we are able to grow, expand our businesses, and our families are better off. We hope not to dissappoint them and that they continue favoring us with their loans."

loans.use: to purchase disposable cups, peanuts, sugar, beans, watermelon, pineapple, melon, banana, papaya, and vegetables.

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Dolores Del Socorro  tiene como actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva  tiene este negocio hace diez años, el cual surgió por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para la mantención de su familia, negocio el cual ha podido mantenerlo y prosperarlo con el financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, y ropa de cama entre otros.
texts.en: Dolores Del Socorro’s economic activity is selling new clothes; she’s had this business for ten years.  It arose because of the need she had to have a way of working to support her family.  She’s been able to keep it going and prospering by means of financing that Fundación León 2000 has given her.  This loan will be invested in the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, suits and bed linens among others.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bed linens, among others.

loans.name: El Calvario Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Calvario” está conformado por 9 integrantes, todas son mujeres, personas muy trabajadoras. El grupo se reúne en una colina en donde lo mejor que se puede apreciar es le sol por las tardes. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron las integrantes del grupo y lo eligieron ya que donde viene se llama así también porque el lugar donde viven hay una capilla que también se llama El Calvario es donde se celebra la crucifixión de Jesús en Semana Santa.

Doña Elia quien es la representante del grupo nos cuenta que tiene 50 años de edad está casada con el señor  Juan desde hace 29 años de edad juntos formaron una familia con hijos e hijas pero hasta el momento ya solo tiene  un joven que ya no estudia pero aun depende de dicha pareja. Doña Elia tiene una tortillería y una tienda de abarrotes, su tortillería tiene un año que la inicio no tiene ningún nombre nos cuenta que la dificultad que presenta con frecuencia es para comprar maíz, gas y leña ya que está muy caro ya que siempre ha comprado esto  porque esto es lo fundamental para que su tortillería siga funcionando algo  curioso que nos cuenta es que su mama fue quien le enseño hacer tortillas también aprendió hacer el nixtamal para las tortillas es por eso que Su tienda tiene ya tiene 6 años nos comenta que la inicio ya que su esposo la apoyo mucho y la motivo para que juntos iniciaran su negocio solo que ahora su dificultad es la competencia que tiene pero no se desanima todo lo contrario fue cuando decidió iniciar su tortillería. 
Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar maíz, gas, leña y dulces para surtir su tienda de abarrotes nos cometa que el crédito le ayuda de mucho ya que cuando llega su crédito aprovecha para surtirse y no estar comprado cada semana. También nos cuenta que la meta es hacer crecer sus dos negocios más que nada la tienda se la quiere dejara a una de su hija para que su hija tenga una solvencia económica estable.
Sus ganancias las utiliza para comprar alimentación, calzado, y gastos para el hogar esto ayuda mucho a su esposo ya que cuando se queda sin trabajo no se preocupan tanto ya que tienen sus ganancias que obtienen de sus ganancias.

Doña Elia y el grupo están muy agradecidas ya que podrán invertir el crédito en sus actividades como por ejemplo: las señoras Luisa, Margarita, Petra, María Guadalupe, comprarán borregos para criarlos y engordarlos para después venderlos, Doña Enriqueta comprará "guajolotes" (pavos) también para engordar y vender, mientras tanto Cristal invertirá en perfumes, tlapalería y colchas. Finalmente María Elena invertirá en paletas de hielo y Alberta comprará ropa de dama y caballero para su venta.
texts.en:
The group "El Calvario" (the Calvary) is made up of 9 members, all hard working women.  The group meets on a hill where one can enjoy the sun in the afternoons.  The group name was chosen by the members because where they live there is a chapel that is also named El Calvario and its there that the crucifixion of Jesus is honored during Holy Week.
Doña Elia, who is the representative of the group, is 50 years old, married to Mr. Juan since she was 29 years old and together they have a family of daughters and sons.  Currently they have only one child that is no longer in school but still depends on them.  Doña Elia has a tortilleria and a grocery store.  She started the tortilleria a year ago and it has no name.  She frequently has difficulties buying corn meal, gas and firewood because of the high prices.  These are essential items for the running of her tortilla making business.  She tells us that it was her mother that taught her how to make tortillas.  She also learned how to make the cooked maize for the tortillas.  Her store has been operating for 6 years.  She started it with her husband, who gave her a lot of support and encouraged her to open the business.  She currently has some competition but she is not discouraged by it, on the contrary, it has supported her decision to open the tortilleria.
At this time she is requesting a loan to buy maize, gas, firewood and sweets to supply her grocery store.  She comments that the loan helps her a lot since when she receives it she can stock up and does not need to purchase items every week.  Her goal is to continue to grow her two businesses, especially the store as she plans to leave it to one of her daughters so that she can have financial security.  
She uses her income to buy food, shoes and cover some household expenses.  This is of great help to her husband because they do not have to worry as much when he does not have work.
Doña Elia and the group are very grateful for the chance to invest the loan into their businesses.  Luisa,  Margarita, Petra, and María Guadalupe will buy sheep to raise and fatten up for later resale; Doña Enriqueta will buy turkeys to also fatten up and resell;  whereas Cristal will invest in perfumes, hardware and bedspreads.  Finally, María Elena will buy popsicles and Alberta will purchase clothing for men and women to later sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, gas, firewood, sweets, beverages, bread, milk, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Triunfadoras” es la primera vez que está trabajando con la institución sin embargo la vez que visitamos a las integrantes estaban muy contentas porque supieron que iban estar en una foto como grupo. La asociación está conformada por 7 mujeres que viven en una comunidad de san Miguel Agua Bendita. Las integrantes son: Manuela, María Elena y Eusebia quienes  invertirán  en borregos para cría y engorda, María Teresa invertirá en dulces para su venta, Sabina y Francisca compraran pollos y guajolotes para cría y engorda.

El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ya que todas son mujeres que quieren triunfar en sus negocios y familias, el lugar donde viven se caracteriza por tener la fiesta más grande que es la del 29 de septiembre que celebran al señor San Miguel.

María Rosa, quien es la representante del grupo, nos cuenta que tiene 24 años está casada desde hace 4 años con su esposo José Doroteo quien se dedica a construir casas, juntos han formado una familia con dos niños que aún no van a la escuela. Rosa, como mejor la conocen el comunidad, es muy trabajadora ya que por las tardes se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como elotes, chicharrones  preparados y esquites; a los chicharrones les pone verdura, como jitomates, lechuga, mayonesa, queso rallado y los elotes les pone, mayonesa, queso rallado, y chile piquín, los esquites son granitos de maíz que les pone mayonesa, papitas de pollo, epazote, y chile piquín. Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comparar todo lo que necesita como elotes, chicharrones, mayonesa, queso rallado, lechuga, jitomate aguacates, vasos, cucharas etc. Nos cuenta que en la actividad lleva ya tres años y la inició cuando una vez  acompaño a su suegra a  vender sus productos también antojitos mexicanos y como vio que se vendía muy bien ella decidió iniciar a vende ella también. Nos cuenta que vende todas las tardes sus cosas las empieza a  preparar desde al medio día para que por la tarde este lista, carga toda sus cosas en su burrito un animal que le ayuda de mucho para trasportar sus antojitos mexicanos, cuando son los fines de semana le ayuda su esposo ya que es cuando más se vende porque por lo general es cuando las familias están reunidas y le compran mas. La única dificultad que presenta Rosa es cuando compra gas porque es muy caro y cada vez sube más sin embargo no se desanima ya que cuando no puede comprar gas tienen la leña que se corta en su comunidad, también porque le gusta mucho vender porque puede platicar con todas sus vecinas por las tardes. Pero más que nada porque sus ganancias ayudan mucha su familia porque puede comprarles, ropa, comunidad, también ahorra para poder construir su casa propia es su meta vivir independiente ya que por el momento se encuentra viviendo con sus suegros.

Rosa y las integrantes están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que Kiva les ofrece porque será de gran ayuda en sus negocios.
texts.en:
This is the first time that the group "Triunfadoras" is working with the loan institution. The group members were very happy when the institution visited and they found out that they would take a group photo together. The group is made up of 7 women who live in the community of San Miguel Agua Bendita. The group members are: Manuela, María Elena, and Eusebia, who will invest in raising sheep; María Teresa, who will invest in sweets to sell; Sabina and Francisca, who will invest in raising chickens and turkeys; and María Rosa, who is the group representative.

The women chose the group name, which means "Winners", because they are all women who want to triumph in their businesses and families. Their community is known for having the biggest celebration, which is the celebration of San Miguel on September 29.  

María Rosa is 24 years old and has been married for 4 years to her husband José Doroteo, who builds houses. Together they have two young children who are not yet in school. 

Rosa, as she is known in the community, is very hard-working and spends the afternoons selling Mexican snacks such as corn on the cob, fried pork rinds, and toasted corn. She dresses the pork rinds with vegetables such as tomatoes and lettuce, mayonnaise, and shredded cheese. To the corn on the cob she adds mayonnaise, shredded cheese, and piquin chili pepper. She dresses the toasted corn kernels with mayonnaise, chunks of chickens, epazote herb, and piquin chili pepper.

Rosa is requesting this loan in order to purchase everything she needs such as corn, pork rinds, mayonnaise, shredded cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, avocados, cups, spoons, etc. 

She has been working in this activity for 3 years. Rosa started the business after one occasion when she accompanied her mother-in-law in selling her Mexican snacks, and when Rosa saw how well her mother-in-law sold the snacks she decided that she herself would begin to sell as well. 

Rosa sells every afternoon; she begins preparing the snacks at noon so that they are ready for the afternoon. She carries all of her supplies on her very helpful donkey. On the weekends her husband helps her; they are the busiest days because in general families get together and purchase more. 

The only difficulty Rosa faces is the purchase of gas because the gas is very expensive and the price rises every time. However, she keeps her spirits up because when she cannot buy gas she uses the firewood that is cut in her community. She also loves to sell because she can chat with all of her neighbors during the afternoons. But more than anything, her earnings help her family a lot because she can buy clothing and can save up for building her own house. Her goal is for her family to live independently, since right now they live with her parents-in-law. 

Rosa and the other group members are very grateful for the opportunity that Kiva offers them because it will help them greatly in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise, pork rinds, piquin chili peppers, avocados, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.es:
Ascensión, habita en la comarca Cusirisne en las afueras Teustepe, donde la agricultura y la crianza de Ganado forman parte de las actividades diarias de la gente que ahí vive. Ascensión está casado, tiene 9 hijos  todos sus hijos lograron finalizar la primaria. El se dedica a las labores de siembra, este oficio lo aprendió por medio de su padre que desde niño le enseño a trabajar la tierra. Hoy en día el realiza esta misma actividad junto con su esposa y sus hijos y sobreviven en base  a las siembra y la crianza de ganado.
El está requiriendo el préstamo para compra insumos y semilla para sembrar frijol. Este crédito le ayudara a adquirir com mas rapidez y facilidad la compra de abonos para la próxima siembra que está por comenzar. Una de sus metas es lograr ampliar su área de siembra de frijoles para aprovechar al máximo el terreno que posee para generar ingresos y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Asención lives in Cusirisne in the outskirts of Teustepe where agriculture and cattle raising are part of the daily activities of people who live there.  Asención is married and has nine children; all of his children managed to complete elementary school.  

He works growing crops, an activity he learned from his father who taught him to work the land when he was a little boy.  Today, he does this same activity with his wife and children and they survive based on growing crops and raising cattle.

He needs a loan to buy supplies and seeds to plant beans.  This loan will help him acquire more quickly and more easily the manure for the next planting that he’s about to start.  One of his goals it so manage to expand the area planted with beans to make maximum use of the land he has to generate income and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: William Leonicio

texts.es: William, padre de 5 hijos, vive en Teustepe municipio de Boaco de oficio agricultor siembra maíz y frijol , el no logro finalizar sus estudios de primarios por dedicarse a trabajar , pero sus hijos si lograron terminar la primaria. El inicio su actividad trabajando con su papa ayudándole a trabajar en las siembra de maíz el tenia 10 años de edad. A los 18 años formo su familia y se independizo, con el paso del tiempo y la ayuda de financiamientos logro tener su propio terreno para siembra , lo que el cultiva lo vende en la ciudad de Boaco . El solicito el crédito para comprar insumos para siembra de granos básicos. Una de sus metas es comprar un motor para bomba de riego y sembrar hortalizas.
texts.en: William’s the father of five children.  He lives in Teustepe, Boaco Municipality.  He’s a farmer by occupation; he grows corn and beans.  He didn’t finish elementary school because he went to work but his children did manage to complete elementary school.  He started working with his father helping him with the corn crops; he was 10 years old.  At the age of 18 he formed his own family and became independent.  With the passage of time and with help from loans he succeeded in having his own land to plant on.  What he grows he sells in the city of Boaco.  He asked for the loan to buy supplies for his basic grains crops.  One of his goals is to buy a motor for an irrigation pump and to plant greens.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.es: La señora Sergia, originaria de la comarca Pochotal en las afueras de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, ella se dedica a trabajar en la venta de artículos del hogar tales como sabanas, hamacas, almohadas. Estos productos los distribuye sus productos en la ciudades cercanos y el departamento de Chontales, sala cada día a vender viajan muchas veces largas distancias en busca de nuevas clientes y conocer más lugares para poder vender lleva 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad la cual le ha permitido alimentar a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, antes se dedicaba a vender carbón pero las ganancias era muy pocas. Por esta razón decidió dedicarse a la venta ambulante de artículos para el hogar. Ella requiere el préstamo Kiva para compra de telas, artículos de plásticos, adornos, etc. Pues empieza la temporada de las ventas altas  ya que se acerca el día de las  madres, su expectativa es que una vez que cancele el crédito la ganancia la invertirá en su negocio para tener una mejor estabilidad económica y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sergia is from Pochotal in the outskirts of Teustepe, Boaco Municipality.  She works selling articles for the home like sheets, hammocks and pillows.  She distributes these items in nearby cities and in Chontales Department.  

She goes out every day to sell and often travels great distances in search of new customers and to get to know other places to sell in.  She’s been in his business for 8 years and it has allowed her to feed her children and help her husband cover household expenses.  She used to sell charcoal but profits were very small.  Because of this she decided to start selling items for the home from place to place.

She needs a Kiva loan to buy fabric, plastic items, decorations, etc. because the season of high sales is stating due to the approach of Mother’s Day.  
Her hope is that once she repays the loan she will invest the profits in her business to have better economic stability and to continue supporting her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric, plastic items and decorations.

loans.name: Elmina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito da Marracuene Provincial de Maputo, de 47 anos casada vive na casa própria, mãe de 1 filho já empregado. Responsabiliza se pelo neto que vive com ela
E proprietária de um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 5 anos onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tais como: óleo, massa, arroz ovos e mais tendo um lucro mensal que investe nas despesas da casa e do estabelecimento. Conta com ajuda de um empregado que lhe ajuda nos dias em que se ausenta para as compras.
Este é seu quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume dos seus produtos, os três primeiros todos de 10.000.00mt e o quarto de 15.000.00mt foram também para o comércio. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e solicitar mais crédito e iniciar uma nova obra.
texts.en:
Elmina was born in the Marracuene District in the Maputo province.  She is 47 years old, and owns her home.  She has one son who is already employed and she supports her grandson, who lives with her.  She has owned a store for more than 5 years where she sells basic goods items such as cooking oil, cornmeal, rice, eggs, etc. She has monthly profits which she invests in household expenses and in her store.  

Elmina has one employee who helps her on the days when she is gone making purchases.  This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to increase her stock of merchandise.  The three initial loans were for 10.000.00mt and the fourth was for 15.000.00mt.  They were also used for her business. She is confident that she will pay off her loans before they are due, and request additional loans to begin a new project.

loans.use: to buy various products for sale.

loans.name: Mayllen Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Mayllen” está conformado por 15 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, alimentos, venta de pan amasado y sopaipillas, venta de pescado, venta de sabanas, kiosco, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Conchalí ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Juana quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la segunda fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco color negro, usa un pañuelo alrededor de su cuello color celeste, su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color negro.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a la venta de ropa, desde hace 3 años. Su negocio lo ubica en su casa. 
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en grandes distribuidoras de ropa de gran variedad y a precios convenientes.
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva.
Sus metas son poner un  local para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Juana vive junto a su marido y su pequeña hija de 13 años de edad. Sus sueños son esperar que su hija termine sus estudios y sea una profesional, para ver su tarea cumplida.
Juana está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Conchalí es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile)  ubicada hacia el norte de la misma. Posee un barrio industrial delimitado, y múltiples actividades económicas y comerciales de pequeño tamaño, incluyendo ferias libres, talleres artesanales, garajes, terminales de buses, entre otros. El sector microempresarial es muy relevante en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is Mayllen, which comprises 15 entrepreneurs who are in the sales business. Specifically, they sell clothing, food, kneaded bread and sopaipillas, fish, sheets, and some have kiosks or provide other services. They all belong to the municipality of Conchalí, which is located in the city of Santiago.
Juana is standing in the second row in the picture. She is the second person starting from right to left, wearing a black vest and a light blue scarf around her neck. She has black hair and is wearing it tied back.
She has been working in the retail business, specifically selling clothing, for three years. Her business is located in her home. Her merchandise includes a great variety of clothing, which she purchases at profitable prices from large distributors in the city of Santiago. She will use the loan to purchase new clothing.
Her goals are to open a store in order to generate higher income, so that she can have access to a better quality of life.
Juana lives with her husband and their young daughter, who is 13 years old. Her dream is to wait for her daughter to finish school and become a professional, so that she can see her job is done.
Juana is very grateful and happy with the loan and services offered by Fondo Esperanza. She also says that she feels very comfortable with the communal bank's group meetings, because there is generosity and unity.
Conchalí is a municipality within the metropolitan area of Santiago, Chile's capital, and it is located in the northern part of this area. It has a defined industrial area, and many economic activities and small businesses, including street markets, craft workshops, garages, bus terminals, etc. The microenterprise sector is very relevant to its commercial actvity.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing.

loans.name: Marcia Leticia

texts.es: La señora Marcia , es habitante del municipio de la concepción , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja en una empresa privada , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y sobre todo construir una casa grande para que vivan cómodos , doña Marcia desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de cítricos , la mayor afectación que se le presentan son las plagas que invaden el cultivo , ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una mejor cosecha , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva , ya que son muchas las mujeres agricultoras que logran creer en su cultivo con estos proyectos para el desarrollo de la agricultura .
texts.en: Marcia lives in Concepción with her husband who works for a private firm.  Her plan for her family is to improve living conditions, above all to build a large house so they can live comfortably.  Marcia has been growing citrus fruit for several years.  The greatest affliction that presents itself is the infestations that invade the crops because she lacks the fertilizer and supplies needed for a better crop.  She is grateful for the support provided by Afodenic through Kiva funds because there are many women farmers who manage to grow with their crops with these projects to develop agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos y vive con dos de sus hijos y tres nietos, en el departamento de Olanchito, Yoro.
Doña Margarita tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería donde vende golosinas como churros,  refrescos,  galletas,  paletas,  helados y venta de plátanos. Ella tiene hace 3 años este negocio donde estableció un pequeño espacio para poder exhibir los productos. Doña Margarita también cuenta con la ayuda económica de sus hijos.
Doña Margarita para poder surtir su negocio y aumentar su inventario ha solicitado su primer préstamo con ODEF de 5,000 lempiras y el producto que comprara es golosinas, refrescos y plátanos para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes.
Su meta es poder vender otros productos de mayor demanda y poder construir un anexo donde solo  funcione su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita, 61, is a single mother; she has five children and lives with two of them and with three grandchildren in Olanchito Department, Yoro.

Margarita has a business which is a small grocery store where she sells snacks like churros, soft-drinks, cookies, lollipops, frozen treats and bananas.  She’s had the business for three years; she set aside a small space to display her products.  Margarita also gets economic help from her children.

In order to stock her business and increase inventory, Margarita has asked ODEF for her first, 5000 lempira, loan to buy soft-drinks, snacks and bananas to continue offering to her customers.  Her goal is to be able to sell other products that are in high demand and to be able to build an annex where her store can operate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: El señor Rubén habitante del departamento de Estelí, casado, de oficio comerciante se dedica al servicio de molino desde hace 3 años, padre de 6 hijos de los cuales solo dos están a su cargo. Inicio su actividad con capital propio y apoyo de su hija, anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica pero decidió salirse por problemas de salud, en su negocio se siente satisfecho ya que tiene su propios clientes es un negocio estable pues le genera ingresos diarios para la alimentación. Solicita el crédito para la compra de un motor para el molino, el estima que el crédito  le ayudara ya que tendrá repuestos para su molino que le permitirá realizar su trabajo sin dificultades, sus planes futuros es aprovechar las temporadas de mas trabajo para aumentar sus ingresos y poder  salir adelante, su meta próxima es llegar a comprar otros molinos para darle una mejor atención al cliente y hacerle mejora a su vivienda para vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Señor Rubén lives in the department of Estelí.  He is married, and a businessman by trade who has been providing milling services for the last three years.  He is the father of six children, of whom he's responsible for only two. 

He began his activity with his own capital and the support of his daughter.  Previously he worked in a factory, but he decided to leave it due to health problems.  He is satisfied with his business as he has his own customers and it is a stable business which earns income on a daily basis for food.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a motor for his mill.  He expects that the loan will help him, as he will be able to make repairs to his mill which will allow him to do his work without difficulties.

His future plans are to take advantage of those seasons with most work to increase his income and be able to move ahead in life.  His next goal is to purchase additional mills so as to give his customers better service, and to make improvements to his home so as to live comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his mill.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 8 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells electronic machines such as television sets. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more television sets for resale, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Robert hopes that, in the future, he will be able to own a bigger shop.

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more television sets for resale,

loans.name: Arao

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Gaza, de 46 anos vive maritalmente na casa própria com sua família. Responsabiliza se pelos pais que vivem em Gaza enviando lhes uma sexta básica de 1.000.00mt mensalmente.
Trabalha com serralharia a mais de 5 anos na sua própria casa no período das 7h as 17h tendo de lucro um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa, da obra e da serralharia pois é o único serralheiro na zona e tem tido muita aderência. Pretende comprar material como: rebarbadora, varões chapas lisas e mais para satisfazer a demanda dos seus clientes. Pretende futuramente erguer um salão de beleza para sua esposa.
Este é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuvku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua ferramenta de trabalho, nunca trabalhou com outros bancos mas esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e solicitar mais crédito para dar início da construção do salão de beleza.
texts.en:
Arao was born in the Gaza province.  He is 46 years old, married, and lives in a home he owns with his family.  He also supports his parents who live in Gaza by sending them a sixth of 1.000.00mt per month.

He has been a metalworker for over 5 years.  He works out of his house from 7am to 5pm and his earnings are used for household expenses, project expenses, and metalworking expenses.  He is the only metalworker in the area and has a good clientele.  He plans to purchase materials such as a metal saw, various sheet metal panels, and more in order to meet customer demand.  In the future, he plans to construct a beauty salon for his wife. 

This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, which he will use to buy work tools.  He has never had a loan with other banks, but he is confident that he will pay of the loan before it is due and request additional loans to start construction on the beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase metalworking materials.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es: Sandra Isabel mujer emprendedora. Desde hace veintisiete años que ejerce la profesion de la Docencia en uno de los colegios ubicados en nuestra capital managua. Su esposo quien tiene como oficio el ser ebanista le ayuda a que juntos puedan equilibrarse con gastos del hogar. Con creditos anteriores ha podido avanzar en cantidad lo que es el mejoramiento y remodelacion de su vivienda. Siendo este su onceavo ciclo de credito agradece a Kiva y a la micro-financiera que con gran disposicion le han abierto sus puertas de financiamientos. Ahora con este credito se propone terminar el porche de su casa, comprando asi perlines, angulares, soldaduras, laminas de zinc, tubos galvanizados, angulares entre otros y asi finalizar la construccion del mismo. Esperando obtener con la misma infraestructura mayor seguridad y mejores condiciones de vida. Agradece la oportunidad de pertenecer a la gran familia de creditos.
texts.en:
Sandra Isabel is an enterprising woman.  She’s been working as a teacher in a school located in our capital, Managua, for twenty-seven years.  Her husband works as a cabinet maker and together they are able to balance out their household expenses. 

With previous loans she’s been able to advance with home improvement and remodeling.  This is her 11th credit cycle and she thanks Kiva and the micro-lender that with great disposition have opened doors to financing for her.

With this new loan she plans to finish the porch on her house buying purlines, angle braces, welding, metal sheets, galvanized tubing, among others to finish building it.  She hopes with this infrastructure to obtain better security and living conditions.  She is grateful for the opportunity to belong to this great family of loans.

loans.use: to finish the porch.

loans.name: Alexandra Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Alexandra , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual labora en una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gatos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos que van a clases y necesitan de sus cuidados , doña Alexandra desde hace varios años trabaja en una empresa privada pero su sueldo no le ajusta para poder comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción y así realizar la construcción de un baño ya que para ella es de mucha urgencia , por que donde actualmente se bañan es al descubierto en una pila que tiene y lo tienen que hacer por la madrugada para que los vecinos no los vean. El préstamo lo va a invertir en materiales de construcción .
texts.en:
Alexandra lives in Ticuantepe with her husband who works for a private firm to help her with household expenses.  They have two children attending school that need their care.  

Alexandra has been employed by a private firm for several years but her salary is insufficient for her to be able to buy construction materials all at once to build a bathroom which is urgent for her because they currently have to bathe in a tank out in the open so she has to do so at dawn so that the neighbors won’t see her.  She will use the loan to buy building materials.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincial de Inhambane, de 39 anos fez a 7ª classe, é solteira mãe de 3 filhos. Vive na casa própria e não responsabiliza se por ninguém. 
Funcionária do Hotel Xisaka a mais de 5 anos, trabalha em turnos como auxiliar no período da manhã das 6h as 14h e no período da tarde das 15h as 22h. Tendo um salário que aplica nas despesas da casa e da obra. Para e além do trabalho tem uma banca em sua casa onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Não tem empregados e conta com ajuda do seu filho.
Este é seu Segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: cimento e areia para o reboco da parede de fora em sua casa. O anterior no valor de 5.000.00mt foi para o comércio, pretende pagar com muito sucesso para aceder a outros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Rufina was born in the province of Inhambane.  She is 39 years old and completed school through the 7th grade.  She is a single mother of 3 children.  She owns the home where she lives and does not support anyone else.  

She has been an employee of the Xisaka Hotel for more than 5 years.  She works as an assistant in shifts, either in the morning from 6am to 2pm or in the afternoon from 3pm to 10pm.  She receives a salary which she uses for household expenses and her construction project.  In addition to her job she has a stand in her home where she sells basic goods.  She does not have any employees although her sons helps her out.    

This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials such as cement and sand to finish the exterior walls of her home.  The previous loan was for 5.000.00mt, which she used for her business.  She plans to make her payments successfully to have access to future loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and sand.

loans.name: El Safiro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama El Safiro, está conformado por las señoras Gladis Angélica, Guadalupe, Azucena Cristina, Alberta y Marcela Consepción quienes van a comprar harina, pintura, aceite, cajas, bolsa, papel para elaborar obleas. Por su parte, la señora Nely Yadira va a comprar pulpa de tamarindo, jamoncillos, palanquetas y alegría por mayoreo. 

Las integrantes quieren decirle a Kiva y a Vision Fund (anteriormente FRAC) “Gracias por sus préstamos, nos brindan el apoyo de salir adelante con nuestros negocios, Dios los conserve y que nos sigan favoreciendo con sus prestamos a las personas que más lo necesitamos". 

La señora Marcela Consepción tiene 39 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene un hijo varón. Ella elabora obleas de varios tamaños  para vender. Ella solicitó su préstamo para comprar harina, aceite, pintura, bolsas, pegamento para surtir su negocio y tener en existencia para ir trabajando. Ella inició su negocio hace 9 años por necesidad y falta de recursos económicos. Su negocio es importante porque es de donde obtiene su ingreso y con el cual pudo pagar la operación de ojos de su hijo y el tratamiento posterior. Marcela Consepción está muy feliz con el préstamo que va a recibir porque dejará de tener preocupaciones al surtir de materia prima su negocio. Sus sueños y esperanzas son mejorar su actividad, dar empleo a otras personas y que su hijo viva mejor.
texts.en:
Gladis Angélica, Guadalupe, Azucena Cristina, Alberta y Marcela Consepción are the members of the Safiro communal bank who are going to buy flour, food coloring, oil, boxes, bags, and paper to make wafers.

Nely Yadira will buy tamarind pulp, candy, peanut brittle, and sesame seeds wholesale. 

The members want to tell Kiva and Vision Fund (previously FRAC), “Thanks for the loans.  They give us the support to get ahead in our businesses.  May God keep you, and may you continue helping us with your loans to the people who need them the most.”

Marcela Consepción, age 39, is married and has one son.  She makes different sizes of wafers to sell.  She requested her loan to buy flour, oil, food coloring, bags, and edible gel (glue).  This is to stock her business and to have materials on hand to keep on working.  She started her business nine years ago due to necessity and the lack of financial resources.  

Her business is important because that is where she gets her income.  With that income she was able to pay for an operation on her son’s eyes and for his post-operative treatment.  Marcela Consepción is very happy with the loan she is going to receive because she will stop worrying about stocking her business with raw materials.  

Her dreams and hopes are to improve her business, to give employment to other people, and for her son to live better.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, paint, bags, and edible gel (glue).

loans.name: Tomas Victorino

texts.es: El Sr. Tomas Victorino de 54 años de edad, casado con dos hijos menores de edad, tiene su actividad económica un taller de torno y soldadura el cual tiene 21 años de tener el negocio, el inicio con ahorro propios que tenia del trabajo anterior como técnico en torno y rectificación de culatas. En la actualidad este emprendedor ha demostrado responsabilidad , calidad de servicio lo que le ha permito  aumentar su clientela servicio que le presta a la población  en general como son empresas privadas, estatales , agricultores de la zona y transportista en general Tomas ha manifestado que los prestamos le han mejorado sus ganancias por la inversión de materia prima para su taller de esa forma el no atrasos los trabajo de mis clientes y de esta manera mantiene sus venta y sus ganancias, su sueños y su metas es poder construir una propiedad para sus hijos. El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar material como: laminas, varilla de soldar, tanque de oxigeno, prensas, desarmadores, taladros. Entre otros.
texts.en:
Tomas Victorino is 54, married, and has two minor children. He has as his business a lathe and welding workshop, and has had the business for 21 years. He started it with his own savings that he had from his previous job as a lathe and cylinder head technician.

Now this entrepreneur has demonstrated responsibility and quality of service that has allowed him to increase his clientele. He services the general public as well as private companies, state enterprises, area farmers and the transport sector in general.

Tomas has stated that the loans have improved his earnings by enabling him to invest in raw material for his workshop. That way he doesn't delay customer jobs and maintains his sales and earnings. His goals and dreams are to build a house for his children. 

He needs the loan to buy material such as sheet metal, welding rods, oxygen tank, presses, screwdrivers, drills and other items.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal, welding rods, oxygen tank, presses, screwdrivers, drills and other items.

loans.name: Hortencia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Hortencia comerciante trabajando siempre para el bien comun de la familia. Hace ya varios años que se dedica a la realizacion de tortillas negocio que ha sido el medio para llevar el sustento dia a dia a sus hijos. Su esposo quien es jubilado recibe una pension por parte del Estado misma que les ayuda a mantenerse y a llevar con mas ligereza las obligaciones del hogar. Uno de sus proyectos para este 2012 es invertir en su vivienda comprando asi materiales de construccion tales como: cemento, bloques, arena, piedrin, alambre de amarre, tablas, clavos y terminar de esta forma pequeños detalles de remodelacion de un cuarto. Expresa sentirse muy contenta por pertenecer a la gran familia de Kiva y Afodenic que han sido el mejor de los medios de financiamientos ya que son cuotas flexibles de pago, pudiendo asi de igual manera poder cumplir con otros compromisos de su familia.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a merchant always working for her family’s wellbeing.  She’s been working for several years making tortillas, a business that’s been her means of providing day to day sustenance for her children.  Her husband is retired and receives a government pension which helps them support themselves and be able to meet household expenses a little easier.

One of her projects for 2012 is to invest in her home buying building materials like cement, blocks, sand, gravel, wire, boards and nails and by this finish the small details of remodeling a room.  

She states that she feels very happy about belonging to the great Kiva and Afodenic family which have been the best means of financing because of the flexible installments that make it possible for her to also be able to meet other family commitments.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: El señor Franklin H. tiene como profesion el ser Administrador de Empresas, sin embargo a la falta de empleo que se vive a diario en nuestro pais no le fue posible llegarla a ejercer, por lo que continua con su oficio de cadete de taxi, mismo que le ha sido de gran ayuda para ofrecerle dia a dia mejores condiciones a los suyos. Su esposa quien labora para una empresa privada le es importante ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. En esta ocasión siendo este su noveno ciclo de credito lo re-invetira para el buen mantenimiento de su vehiculo comprando asi con el credito amortiguadores traseros, amortiguadores delanteros, llantas y reparacion de aire acondicionado. Obteniendo de esta forma poder incrementar sus ganancias a travez de la gran ayuda que la micro-financiera le ha dado al darle una oportunidad der ser sujeto de un credito.
texts.en:
Franklin H. has a degree in Business Administration. However, due to the constant unemployment rates suffered in our country, it was not possible for him to find a job in his field, which is why he continues with his occupation as a taxi driver, which has been of great help for him to provide better conditions for his family. His wife works for a private company, and helping her husband with household expenses is important to her. 
This is his 9th loan cycle, and this time he will reinvest in good maintanence for his vehicle. He will use the loan to purchase rear shock absorbers, front shock absorbers, and tires, and will repair the air conditioning. Microfinancing has offered him great help by giving him the opportunity to qualify for a loan, and this investment will allow him to increase profits.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products for her store.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Martha Luz, tiene 30 años de edad, está viviendo en unión libre con su esposo y junto a sus 2 hijos reside en una aldea cercana al municipio de Olanchito, Yoro.
Martha Luz, hace 2 años que estableció su propia actividad de negocio en su casa. Ella vende comida, pastelitos fritos rellenos de carne y arroz, baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena de frijoles, huevo y queso, hamburguesa y refrescos. para ver su negocio en crecimiento ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a ODEF por Lps.5,000.00,del cual piensa comprar producto para surtir y tener los ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como ser: carnes, harinas, verduras y otros ingredientes necesarios. Su meta es trabajar a diario para hacer crecer el negocio y ayudar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha Luz, 30, lives in a common law relationship with her husband and two children; she lives in a village near the municipality of Olanchito, Yoro.

Martha Luz set up a home-based business two years ago.  She sells food: little fried turnovers stuffed with meat and rice, 'baleadas' (flour tortillas stuffed with beans, eggs and cheese), hamburgers and soft-drinks.

To see her business grow, she’s asked ODEF for a 5000 lempira loan to buy products to stock up with and have ingredients needed to prepare her food like: meat, flour, vegetables and other necessary ingredients.

Her goal is to work hard every day to make the business grow and to help her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Anibal

texts.es:
Don Juan de 46 años de edad, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería es originario de Estelí, su nivel académico estudio ciencias sociales, casado, orgulloso padre de 2 hijos mayores de edad. Inicio su actividad con capital propio ya que antes se desempeñaba en una empresa y de la liquidación que recibió de su trabajo decidió poner su negocio de pulpería, anteriormente tenia un negocio de venta de ropa que tuvo que quitar por problemas de salud, en su actual negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposa comercializando sus productos en su domicilio, se siente satisfecho con el negocio ya que  le va bien pues cuenta con sus clientes debido a que no tiene mucha competencia en la zona siendo un lugar bien transitado lo que genera ingresos diarios. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de zinc y pago de mano de obra para componer el techo de su casa ya que cuando llueve se pasa el agua, el cual estima le ayudara para que la mercadería no se le  humedezca.
Sus  planes futuros es llegar a  convertir  su negocio una distribuidora para obtener mayores ingresos, tener un mejor nivel económico y poder terminar de construir su casa para vivir cómodamente junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 46, is a merchant; he has a grocery store.  He’s from Estelí and he studied Social Sciences.  He’s the proud father of two adult children.  He started his business with his own capital because he used to work for a firm and decided to use his severance pay he got from the firm to set up his grocery store.  He used to have a clothes sales business that he had to close for health reasons.  His wife helps him with his current business selling his products at home.   He feels satisfied with the business because he does well because he has his customers and doesn’t have much competition in the zone and it’s a place with many passers-by that generate daily income.

He’s asking for the loan to buy metal sheeting and to pay labor costs to repair the roof on his house because when it rains water leaks in; he feels that this will help to keep the merchandise from becoming damp.

His plan for the future is to turn his business into a distributorship to earn better income and to have a better economic level and to be able to finish building his house to live comfortably alongside his family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Cristobla Evaristo

texts.es: El señor Cristóbal , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene hijos a su cargo , don Cristóbal desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presento durante el ciclo de producción fue las grandes lluvias que se llevaron gran parte del cultivo y con lo poco que logro sacar pago su préstamo , pero ahora no cuenta con capital para invertir en fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para seguir trabajado su cultivo de piña .El préstamo lo va utilizar para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en:
Cristóbal lives in Ticuantepe with his wife who works as a fruit and vegetable merchant to help him with household expenses since his has two children in his care.

Cristóbal has been growing pineapple for several years.  The greatest affliction he’s faced during the growing cycle was the strong rains that swept away a great part of the crop.  With the little he was able to produce he repaid his loan but now has no capital available to invest in fertilizer and supplies needed to continue working in his pineapple crops. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Don Marvin Antonio, es un hombre honesto y luchador. Hasta el dia de hoy continua con su labor de Guarda de Seguridad, un trabajo de mucha responsabilidad y riesgoso puesto que expone su propia vida para salvaguardar la de terceras personas. Muy agrecido de pertener a la gran familia de Kiva y Afodenic. Como objetivo, ha sido la mejora a su casa, en donde ha venido trabajando por parte, debido a su condicion economica, ya que tiene que cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar por eso trabaja dia a dia para obtener resultados positivos. Con este nuevo financiamiento mejorara un cuarto invirtiendo en la compra de materiales de construccion tales como Hierro, cemento, alambre de amarre, arena, bloques, piedrin, tablas, clavos entre otros, logrando con esta mejora a su vivienda una meta mas y un mejor nivel para los suyos que es lo que mas esencial para el.
texts.en:
Marvin Antonio’s an honest, hardworking man.  To this day he continues working as a security guard, a job with much responsibility and risk because he exposes his very life to keep others safe.  

He’s very grateful to belong to the great Kiva and Afodenic family.  His objective has been to make home improvements that he’s been doing in stages because of his economic situation since he has to cover all his household’s expenses which is why he works day to day to obtain positive results.

With this new loan he will improve a room buying building materials like rebar, cement, wire, sand, blocks, gravel, boards and nails among others attaining with this home improvement one more goal and a better standard for his loved ones which is what’s most essential for him.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Ndira Gueye

texts.fr: Madame Ndira est une femme mariée qui est employé comme agent administratif dans la commune de la localité ou elle vit. Le salaire qu’elle gagne étant très juste pour satisfaire tous ses besoins, elle s’active depuis 2003 dans le commerce afin de se procurer des revenus supplémentaires pour arrondir les fins de mois. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’acquisition de produits cosmétiques destinés  à la vente. Ce financement lui permettra d’acquérir un équilibre social.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndira is a married woman who is employed as an administrative representative in the commune of the town where she lives. The salary she earns is barely enough to support herself, so she has been active in commerce since 2003 to gain the extra revenues for making ends meets. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch office and is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for acquiring cosmetics for resale. This financing will enable her to achieve some stability in her life.

loans.use: to acquire cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Baidy

texts.fr: Monsieur Baidy  est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal. C’est un enseignant coranique de profession, et exerce cette activité depuis 1998. Il consacre  quatre heures de temps de la journée a son activité dans une garderie ou il est embauché, mais il dispense parallèlement  des cours a domiciles afin  de pouvoir supporter les charges de sa famille. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs  dans le but de faire face aux frais médicaux d’un parent très proche.  Ce financement lui permettra d’assister  un proche et assurer l’équilibre social au sein de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Baidy is a married man who lives in Senegal. He is a teacher of the Koran by profession, and he has been doing so since 1998. He devotes four hours a day to this activity at a daycare center, where he is employed. But he also gives lessons at his home concurrently to be able to support his family. 

Mr. Baidy is a member of a U-IMCEC branch office and is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs with the goal of coping with medical expenses for a close relative. This financing will enable him to help his relative and to ensure stability within his family.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses of an immediate relative, who is in his care

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 66 años de edad es habitante de la comarca Monte Fresco en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, de oficio agricultor, lleva trabajando en esta actividad casi toda su vida, pues inicio desde muy joven sembrando maíz y frijol producto de su ardua labor ha podido comprar sus tierras que hoy en día posee y las cuales trabaja junto con sus hijos que lo apoyan en todo el proceso de siembra y ayudan a aportar en el hogar. 
Requiere el préstamo para  comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar frijoles. Después de cancelar su crédito desea comprar cerdos para engorde y vender toda su producción de frijoles a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Juan is 66 and lives in the Monte Fresco district on the outskirts of Teustepe. He is married, and a farmer by trade. He has been doing this work almost all his life, as he started from a young age, planting corn and beans. 

As a result of his hard work he has been able to buy the land that he owns today, and that he works with his children, who support him in the entire planting process and help to contribute to the household expenses.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor in order to plant beans. After paying off his loan he wishes to buy pigs to fatten, and to sell his entire production of beans at a good price.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor, in order to plant beans.

loans.name: Armonia Group

texts.es: Armonía es un grupo solidario de Credituyo que está cumpliendo su primer ciclo en esta institución. Ellas escogieron este nombre porque querían un nombre que sonara alegre y amigable.  Erendira es una de las mujeres del grupo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y junto con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos, de 16 y de 8 años que ahorita están estudiando. Hace 2 años comenzó con su negocio de ropa y bisutería para poder proveerles a sus hijos con un mejor futuro. Erendira siempre ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora. Ella comenzó con su negocio de bisutería aprendiendo en internet como se hacían las pulseras y los collares. El negocio de bisutería de Eréndira ahorita le está yendo bastante bien con su negocio y sí tiene mucho surtido, pero solicitó el crédito para surtir otra vez de ropa ya que le acaban de ofrecer unas pacas de ropa a un muy buen precio.
texts.en:
“Armonía” (Harmony) is a Credituyo communal bank fulfilling its first cycle in this institution.  They chose this name because they wanted a name that sounded cheerful and friendly.

Eréndira is one of the women in the group. She’s a hardworking woman who with her husband has two children who are 16 and 8 years old that are currently studying.

Two years ago she started with a clothing and costume jewelry business to provide her children with a better future.  Eréndira has always been a very enterprising woman.  She started the costume jewelry business learning from the Internet how necklaces and bracelets were made.  Eréndira’s costume jewelry business is doing very well right now and she has quite a bit of stock but she asked for the loan to once again stock up on clothes because she’s just been offered some bundles of clothes at a very good price.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Dox Jam 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Dox Jam 2,regroupe 5 femmes toute épouses de gendarmes qui se sont constituées en GIE.Leur activité consiste dans l'ensemble à vendre des produits cosmétiques, des tissus, du parfum, des chaussures et méme le petit déjeuner.
La présidente, madame Anta Fall fait du commerce de parfum,d'encens et de chaussures.Elle a acquis une expérience de 15 ans dans ce domaine.Elle veut un crédit pour satisfaire une commande de chaussures qu'elle va vendre à crédit.Elle peut réaliser des économies de 75000F CFA par mois.Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Grace à son activité, elle gère au quotidien les besoins de ses enfants et appui son mari dans la dépense journalière.Elle aimerait dans l'avenir, diversifier son commerce et le hausser à un plus haut niveau.
texts.en:
The loan group "Dox Jam 2" comprises five women who are all wives of police officers and who are together to form an 'economic interest group'. Their work overall involves selling cosmetic products, fabrics, perfumes, shoes, and even breakfasts.

The president, Ms. Anta Fall, does commerce in perfumes, incense, and shoes. She has acquired fifteen years of experience in this domain. She wants a loan to fulfill an order for shoes, which she is going to sell on credit. She can realize savings of 75,000 francs CFA per month. 

Ms. Anta Fall is married and a mother with a family. Thanks to her work, she manages the day-to-day needs of her children and supports her husband in meeting daily expenses. 

In the future, she would like to  diversify her business and raise it to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy incense, perfumes, shoes, fabrics, and cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es: Don Jose E. soltero de 57 años de edad posee una pulperia desde hace ocho años aproximadamente en su propia casa de habitacion. Inicia su negocio de pulpero con inciativa propia y con ahorros que el venia obteniendo desde muchos años atrás. Siendo uno de sus principal objetivo el llevar a cabo la construccion de su cuarto y mejorar pequeños detalles interiores de su vivienda recurre a la micro-financiera para gozar de este primer ciclo de credito, con el cual obtendra mayor comidad para el y una oportunidad de financiamiento que a futuro podra destinarla tambien para el crecimiento de su negocio. Con el prestamo comprara los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, arena, piedrin, hierro, bloques, ceramica, perlines, laminas de zin entre otros. El señor manifiesta sentirse muy contento ya que esta infraestructura le traera a su hogar mejores condiciones de vida y a su vez ayudara al bienestar de sus familiares.
texts.en:
Don Jose E. is 57 years old, single, and has managed a grocery store out of his home for approximately eight years. He started this business on his own and with the savings he accumulated over many years. One of his main objectives is to build a room and improve small details inside of his home. He has resorted to microfinance and will be participating in his first loan cycle. Don Jose hopes to achieve greater comfort and the opportunity to receive future loans for growing his business.

With this loan, he will buy the following construction materials: cement, sand, gravel, iron, blocks, ceramic tiles, crossbeams, zinc sheets, and other supplies. Sr. Jose says that he is very pleased that improvements to the infrastructure of his home will bring about better living conditions and promote the welfare of his family members.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Pc2 Sindia Lorong Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée depuis le 02/08/2008. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même quartiers et 

des quartiers environnants.

Ses membres sont unis par des relations sociales communes.

Madame Maimouna est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans et mère de 7 enfants tous des garçons.

Elle fait du commerce de fruits depuis longtemps. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine .

Son nouveau crédit de 55000 lui permettra de se payer des paniers de mangues qu'elle va revendre au niveau de 

la route nationale.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels mais également 

d'aider son mari dans la gestion alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on 02/08/2008. It is composed of women who live in the same neighborhood and surrounding neighborhoods. Its members are united by common social ties. 

Madame Maimouna is a married woman aged 30 and the mother of seven children, all of them sons. She has been selling fruit for a long time. She has a good deal of experience in this field. Her new loan of 55,000 XOF will allow her to buy baskets of mangoes which she will then sell along the highway. 

The profit from her business will allow her to support herself but also to help her husband feed their family.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: El Mimbre Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Mimbre” está ubicado en el centro de San Pedro El Alto, pero para llegar a la casa del grupo es necesario llegar caminando y es muy casado, ya que hay que recorrer una vereda muy larga. El nombre del grupo se eligió porque así se llama el barrio donde viven los integrantes. En dicha comunidad, se llevan a cabo las fiestas más grandes el 31 de diciembre y 1° de enero, donde se celebra la llegada del año nuevo.

El grupo está integrado por personas muy alegres y agradecidos con la institución, son ocho mujeres y un hombre. Todos han solicitado el crédito para ocuparlo en sus comercios: Doña Irene invertirá en su mercería, María Juana en una tienda de abarrotes, la señora Cesárea comprara borregos, la señora Josefina invertirá en comprar reparaciones de un taxi para su esposo, la señora Eulalia compara jarcería para sus venta, Doña Modesta comprara fregones (productos de limpieza) para su venta, María Josefina invertirá en accesorios de fantasía, Don Leonardo invertirá en abarrotes, semillas, frutas  y legumbres.

Doña Cesaria quien es la represente del grupo, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada con el señor Demetrio desde hace 30 años, juntos formaron una familia pero por el momento ya no tienen dependientes aunque están apoyando a nieto con sus estudios: Yosmar quien estudia el cuarto grado de primaria.

Doña Cesaria tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 20 años hasta ahora no tiene nombre pero esta pensando en ponerle uno. Cesaria ya lleva un largo periodo trabajando con la institución. Esta vez solicitó el crédito para surtir su tienda de abarrotes; comprara dulces, jabón, leche, huevo, pan etc.  Cesaria comenta que inicio vendiendo dulces en su casa y después pensó en iniciar su tienda de abarrotes. La dificultad  que presenta es la competencia que tiene en el lugar donde vive, pero no se desanima ya que continuamente abren muchas tiendas que al final terminan cerrando. el crédito le ha ayudado de mucho ya que puede comprar mercancía suficiente para dos o tres meses. Está muy agradecida ya que con sus ganancias, su calidad de vida ha mejorado y esa era una de sus metas. Las ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar y para la educación de su nieto entre otras cosas.

Ella y el grupo en general están muy agradecidos con el préstamo otorgado ya que será de gran ayuda para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
El Mimbre Group is located in the center of San Pedro El Alto, but to get to the group's house you have to arrive on foot and it is very tiring because you have to travel a very long way.  They chose the name of the group because it is the name of the neighborhood where the members live.  In this community the biggest celebrations are on 31 December and 1 January, when they celebrate the arrival of the new year.

The group is made up of very happy people who are grateful to the institution.  They are eight women and one man.  All of them have requested the loan to use in their businesses.  Irene will invest in her merchandise and María Juana in a grocery store.  Cesárea will buy lambs.  Josefina will invest in taxi repairs for her husband.  Eulalia will buy plastic goods to sell.  Modesta will buy scouring pads (cleaning products) to sell.  María Josefina will invest in costume jewelry and Leonardo in groceries, seeds, fruits, and vegetables.

Cesaria, who is the representative of the group, is 54 years old and has been married to Demetrio for 30 years.  They had a family together but at the moment no longer have dependents, although they are supporting a grandson in his studies, Yosmar, who is in fourth grade.

Cesaria has had a grocery store for 20 years.  Up to now it has not had a name, but she is thinking about giving it one.  Cesaria says she began selling candy in her house and later thought about opening her grocery store.  The difficulty that comes up is the competition in the area where she lives.  She does not get discouraged, though, because new stores are constantly opening but later end up closing.

Cesaria has been working with the institution for a long time now.  This time she requested the loan to supply her grocery store; she will buy candy, soap, milk, eggs, bread, etc.

The loan has helped her a lot because she can buy enough merchandise for two or three months.  She is very grateful because her quality of life has improved with her profits, and this was one of her goals.  She invests her profits in the household expenses and on her grandson's education, among other things.

She and the group in general are very grateful for the loan granted because it will be very helpful to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, bread, eggs, soda, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un joven con muchos deseos de superación , es agricultor, muy  trabajador y vive en una comunidad  situada en  la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
El está solicitando un préstamo de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para  comprar insumos agrícolas para su cosecha, como  abono ,  fungicidas  y herbicidas ya que debe  proteger sus cultivos durante el proceso de producción .  Con estos abonos, Santos  aumentará la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones,  así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes,  y además podrá hacer frente a todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su familia.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica y este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Santos is a young man who has tremendous drive to succeed. He is a farmer and a very hard worker. Santos lives in a small community in southern Costa Rica called La Danta, which is located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on agricultural activities such as growing tubers, coffee, corn, beans, as well as raising cattle.

Santos is requesting a loan of 600,000 CRC in order to buy farming supplies for planting such as compost, fungicides, and herbicides to protect his crops throughout the production process. With the use of compost, Santos will increase the capacity of the soil to absorb various nutrients. The fungicides will prevent the appearance of fungus on his crops and result in a better quality product for his customers. He will also be able to fulfill all of his obligations and payments so that his family can get ahead.

Santos is a member of La Danta Communal Credit Enterprise, S.A., one of the 110 credit organizations in Costa Rica. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Erick

texts.es:
Erick es  un joven de agricultor, quien vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi-montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería.

Erick confía en que con este proyecto de financiamiento agil y a bajo costo, el puede ayudar a  su familia a mejorar su situacion  economica .  Actualmente  Erick está solicitando un microcrédito  de  ¢1.050.000 (un millón cincuenta mil  colones), para sembrar cacao, el cual  venderá a buen precio en el centro de acopio de su comunidad.  Erick forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica, con este crédito espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Erick is a young farmer, who lives with his family in a rural community in Costa Rica called San Gabriel.  It is located in Yolillal, Upala, in the province of Alajuela.  It is a rural community with a relatively large area and a semi-mountainous topography, located in Costa Rica in Central America.  The main activities in this area are farming basic grains, and on a smaller scale, livestock.

Erick confides that he will be able to help his family improve their financial situation with this financing project that is both speedy and low-cost.  Erick is currently requesting a micro-loan of ¢1,050,000 (one million and fifty-thousand colones) for planting cocoa, which he will sell for a good price at the collection center in his community.

Erick is part of the Communal Credit Company of San Gabriel, which is one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  With this loan, he hopes to be able to continue growing as a micro-business, and to move his business forward.  He also highlights that thanks to this kind of organization and the means afforded by the loan, he can spend more time on productive activities and in this way earn greater profits.

loans.use: to grow cocoa.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is from the Khoni district, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, Rita, his 7-year-old daughter, and his mother. Yuri works as a worker in a local lemonade factory. He works, on average, eight hours each day and earns 250 Laris each month. Also, the family has a small piece of land for a vineyard. Most of the harvest is consumed by the family; only a small surplus is sold to the local market. The family lives below the poverty line, and they receive relevant social assistance from their local government.
