loans.use: to buy stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 45 years old. She is married to John and together they have two children. She sells cooked food and has been in the business for the past 21 years.

This is her first loan. She was introduced to KADET LTD  by a staff. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of maize, beans and flour for her business.

She hopes to open a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase stock of maize, beans and flour

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is 45 years old and has five children. She has been selling charcoal for six years and has four employees. This is a business she has valued because she has managed to use the income from the business to educate her children and provide for her family. Being the breadwinner in her family, she works hard in her business so as to meet her family's needs.
Dorcus hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne used her previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy men's and women's suits. She made more profit from the business.  With the additional income from her business, she was able to pay school fees for her child, who is in school. She hopes to open a big boutique in the future.

She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 27 years old and single. He hawks clothes and shoes. He has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

This will be his second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of clothes for sale, as this will help upgrade the business. 

In future, he wants to expand the business

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 46 years old, married and blessed with four children. To earn a living, she runs a mobile phone money transfer business. Besides, she operates a laundry business to earn extra income. Naomi works hard in her business so as to meet her family's needs. She hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs 40,000 Kenya shillings to add float for her business.

loans.use: To add float for her business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina used her previous loan to buy fruits. She was able to grow her business and earn more income. She has also manged to employ one person in her business. She has requested another loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add a stock of vegetables to her grocery.

loans.use: To add stock of vegetables

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 47 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos todos mayores de edad que ya son independientes. Ella nos cuenta que antes de empezar con el negocio estudió cursos de mecánica dental, una vez culminado dichos estudios decidió montar en su casa su negocio de elaboración de prótesis (hace aproximadamente 10 años). Con la ayuda de su marido pudo juntar un capital y así poder contar con herramientas de trabajo, y hoy gracias a la buena atención; a la calidad y buen precio, tuvo gran aceptación y con ello muchos clientes hasta la actualidad. 
Ana solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo las prótesis a sus pacientes y de esa forma seguir trabajando y creciendo como profesional.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old, she is married and she has 2 grown up children already economically independent. She has told us that before starting her activity she studied Dental Technologies; once finished her studies she decided to establish her prosthesis manufacturing activity in her house (she started approximately 10 years ago). Thanks to her husband’s help she has been able to save enough money to buy some working tools, and now she has many customers thanks to her good care, the great quality of her job and her good price.
Ana is requesting a loan to buy supplies in order to keep on preparing prosthesis for her patients, thus keeping on working as well as growing as a professional.

loans.use: To buy supplies in order to keep on preparing dental prosthesis.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells cooking utensils, saucepans, and bowls at Abreshia near Elmina. Ekua has compelated J.H.S. She is a single parent and has three children.  Ekua has been in this business for the past two years.  As a single parent, she is responsible for feeding and clothing her children and paying for their school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils and bowls to sell.  She hopes to use the profits from her business to build a shop to sell her cooking utensils.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking utensils and bowls to sell

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en: Aunty  is a hairdresser. She also sells accessories  at  Abreeshia   near Elmina.  Auntie is  single and so uses her income to pay her accommodation and  utility bills.  Her loan will be used to purchase  accessories  to sell,  hair creams,  hair extensions and a hair dryer for her work.   She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase  accessories  to sell and  hair creams,  hair extensions and a hair dryer for her work

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has two children. He sells manure to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. He also practices dairy farming to generate more income. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business and employ people. He has requested a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy farm manure to sell.

loans.use: To buy farm manure to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es: Mabel con su anterior credikiva, compró telar para fabricar pantalones en tela de dril que vendió a colmenas en la ciudad e Montería, tierra ganadera de Colombia. Ahora tiene un nuevo mercado que explorar, en las ciudades de Barranquilla y Montería, pues le han encargado bermudas, masculinas y femeninas en telas de cuadros.En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará telas en variados colores y diseños de cuadros, para responder a su creciente demanda.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva por su apoyo, porque con el crédito barato me ayudó a incrementar poco a poco la producción de ropa. “
texts.en:
With her previous credikiva loan, Mabel bought fabric for making denim pants that she sold in the La Colmena area of the city of Monteríá in the cattle-raising area of Colombia. Now she has a new market to explore, in the cities of Baranquilla and Monteria, as she has orders for men's and women's plaid bermuda shorts. 

Currently, she is applying for a new credikiva loan with which she will buy fabric in a variety of colors and plaid designs, to respond to growing demand. 

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Many thanks to Kiva for their support, because the inexpensive credit helped me increase clothing production little by little."

loans.use: To buy fabrics in a variety of colors and designs in order to respond to growing demand.

loans.name: Nesiamon

texts.en: Nesiamon is 32 years old, married and supports a family of eight. She has been a sheep farmer for the last seven  years. Her monthly income is 20,000 KES. With her fourth loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD, she plans to purchase potatoes for planting, chemicals, more rams for fattening and resale during the peak of holiday season. This will improve on her prospects to acquire a variety of animals/heifers for resale. Her future plans are to educate her children and better the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for planting, chemicals, and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 32 years old and a business lady. She is married to John, a businessman. They are blessed with two children, aged five and three years respectively. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Hellen will use the loan to buy a stock of second-hand clothes for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of second-hand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 34 years old, married to Isaiah, and together they have four school age children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans on time. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

She hopes to be a leading farmer in her home area.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old and married to Karen. They are blessed with six children, aged 20, 16, 13, 11, eight and five years, respectively. 

He owns a welding and fabrication shop which he started 20 years ago. He earns an income of KES 20,000 per month. He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase another welding machine. 


The anticipated profit will help him educate his children. His dream is to see his business grow bigger. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase another welding machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, 30, is married to John and they have one seven-year-old child.

She has been operating a restaurant for the last four years, making a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy chairs and tables for use. 

Lilian's profits will be used to plow back into the business. Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 54-year-old mixed crop farmer, and he is married to Judith who is employed. They are blessed with three children.  He has been in a mixed crop farming business as a primary business and a dairy farming business as a secondary business for the past 15 years, with the monthly income of approximately KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. David will use the loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and animal feeds. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.


His hopes and dreams are to buy another farm for farming which will increase his income which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and animal feeds.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old, and he is a single business man. He has been running a food stall for the past five years while getting a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to cater to his basic needs. 

He is applying for his third loan KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and rice in bulk for use in his business.

With the anticipated profit from his business, he will support his parents. His hopes to open a restaurant and educate his siblings.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sugar, and rice in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 53-year-old widow blessed with children between the age of 24 and 30 years. She owns a food stall, a business she started eight years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She has requested a loan for KES. 10,000 to purchase foods such as rice, beans, cooking oil, and baking and maize flour.

The anticipated profit will help her to open another branch in town. Her dream is to grow her business and own a restaurant. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase foods such as rice, beans, cooking oil, and baking and maize flour.

loans.name: Sella

texts.en:
Sella is 51 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged 30, 25, 20 and 18 years respectively. She practices dairy farming, a business she started 17 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 17,600. 

She has requested a loan worth KES. 40,000 to purchase dripping pipes and renovate her greenhouse tank. The anticipated profit will help her expand her horticultural farming as well as repay her loan. 

She hopes to invest largely in greenhouse farming. This is her second loan.

loans.use: To purchase dripping pipes and renovate her greenhouse tank.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old. An enterprising businessman, he is single but supports his parents and siblings. He has been a hawker for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to cater for his basic needs. He is applying for his 3rd loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

George will use the loan to buy belts, watches, albums and matchboxes. With the anticipated profit from the business he will boost his business further. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and educate his siblings.

loans.use: to buy belts, watches, albums and matchboxes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María sigue dedicandose al negocio de venta de adornos y autopartes, ella sigue tienendo un puesto de venta alquilado en un centro comercial. Ella sigue pertenecinedo al banco comunal “Juntos Unidos” de la Asociacion Arariwa. En esta oportunidad requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia como por ejemplo  adornos, pararrayos, radios, faros y otras cosas más.
texts.en: María keeps on running her activity, selling decorative accessories and spare parts for cars, and she keeps on working in her rented stall located in a mall. She is still a member of “Juntos Unidos” (Together United), a Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa. In this occasion she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of some products, such as decorative accessories, lightning conductors, radios and headlamps among other things.

loans.use: To buy decorative accessories, lightning conductors, radios and headlamps.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru: Более 2-х лет трудолюбивый и добрый молодой семьянин Маруфчон занимается ремонтом сотовых трубок и предоставляет услуги автомобиля для проведения мероприятий. Его семья очень дружная, на воспитании имеет двух сыновей. Жена продавщица на центральном базаре. Маруфчон обслуживает своих клиентов в области. Данный бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, за обслуживание одного мероприятия он получает от 100 до 150 сомони в зависимости от месторасположения мероприятия. Маруфчон запрашивает займ для покупки нового автомобиля с целью более высококачественного обслуживания клиента. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Marufchon is a kind and hardworking young family man. For over two years, he has been repairing cellular phones and provided transportation services for various events. He has a close-knit family. He is raising two sons. His wife is a vendor at the local market. Marufchon's customers come from the local region. This business brings him a good income: from one event, he earns between 100 and 150 KGS, depending on the location. Marufchon is requesting a loan in order to buy a new car and be able to provide a higher quality of service. He is hoping for your compassion and help.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Jairo Josue

texts.es: El joven Jairo de 24 años de edad, soltero, es originario de Estelí,  de oficio comerciante presta servicio de Cyber Café, actualmente estudia su tercer año en la carrera de ingeniería en sistema, en su  negocio cuenta con dos años de experiencia. Inicio su actividad con dinero que tenia ahorrado ya que anteriormente  tenia el negocio de nintenderia pero decidió quitarlo porque no tenia tiempo para atender los dos negocios y vio que el Cyber café le generaba mas ganancias es un negocio muy rentable y además le permite poner en practica lo que han aprendido en la universidad. El requiere el préstamo para comprar un proter para serigrafía el cual estima el crédito le ayudara a iniciar  otro negocio el cual ve que hay mucha demanda de parte de su clientela como es hacer camisetas,carteles serigrafiadas. El se considera un joven muy dinámico y emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante, sus planes futuros son terminar su carrera  para ser alguien más competitivo dentro  del mercado del comercio y  comprar otras computadoras para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Jairo, 24, is single and is a native of Esteli.  He is a merchant who has a cyber cafe.  He is now in his 3rd year studying for a degree in computer systems engineering.  He has two years of experience with his business. He started out with money that he had saved, because he previously had a video game business.  But he decided to quit that business because he didn't have time to tend to two businesses, and he saw that the cyber cafe would generate more income because it is a more profitable business.  Also, the business is allowing him to put into practice what he has learned at the university.  He needs a loan to buy a serigraph plotter to make silkscreens, with which he plans start up another business for which there is a lot of demand on the part of his customers.  With this machine, he will make T-shirts and silk-screened posters.  He considers himself to be a very dynamic and enterprising youth, with a strong desire to get ahead.  In the future he plans to finish his degree, so that he can become a person who is more competitive in the market, and buy other computers to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a serigraph plotter

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas has been making and selling herbal medicines in Nakuru town for the past 10 years. He is 35 years old and married to Marsellah.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of medicines for sale and thereby sustain his business and also make more income.

In the future, Thomas hopes to grow his business and open a pharmacy and sell as well as supply all kinds of medicine in Nakuru town.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Nidia Liz

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,ella vende chompas,polos entre otras aretesanias,la socia tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar artesania como polos y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member keeps on running her activity, selling handicrafts. She sells sweaters and polo shirts among other handicrafts. She owns a shop and she works there from 8 am to 6 pm, and thanks to her job she is able to provide for her children. She dreams of expanding and improving her handicraft selling activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts items such as polo shirts and sweater.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy polo shirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and is married to Amos. They are blessed with three children aged 15, 10, six years respectively.  She runs a retail shop, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has requested her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase packets of tea leaves, a sack of sugar and rice, and two bales of maize flour. 

The profit she earns will help her educate her children. Her dream is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase packets of tea leaves, a sack of sugar and rice, and two bales of maize flour.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a thirty-year-old lady, single with one child aged five. She sells household items like cups, plates, jugs, and basins in Oloitoktok.  Sylvia has been in business for four years and gets a monthly income of fourteen thousand Kenya shillings. 

This will be Sylvia’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of cups and thermoses for sale. She plans to use the profits to increase stock to expand the business. 

In future she hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cups and thermoses for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 29 years old lady from Kisumu and is a single mother of a three year old child.

Margaret is a shopkeeper, a business she has been doing for the last three years, and makes a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more retail stock of sugar, cooking fat and milk. Her profits will be used to add more retail stock and also educate her child.Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, milk and cooking fat for sale.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
OSWALDO tiene 60 años de edad es casadao tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hios de 12 y 17 años de edad, vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

OSWALDO es maestro albañil. Solicita el crédito para comprar mezcladora, barillas, picos, palas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las herramientas que tanta falta le hace.

Las compras lo hará en guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
El sueño es poder agrandar la casa para vivir más comodamente. En el tiempo libre le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Oswaldo, 60, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children, ages 12 and 17, in Guaranda in Bolívar province. Oswaldo is a master bricklayer. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a concrete mixer, rods, spades, and shovels. With the loan support, he will be able to buy the tools he needs. He will purchase then in Guaranda in Bolivar province. His dream is to be able to expand his house so that he can live more comfortably. He likes to clean the house in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy a concrete mixer, rods, spades, and shovels.

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es: La señora Luz de 48 años de edad es originaria de Estelí, su nivel académico es de Licenciada en Contabilidad pero también se desempeña en el mercado del comercio pues tiene su negocio de pulpería   en el que cuenta con 21 años de experiencia. Inicio su negocio con dinero propio ya que su deseo es salir adelante con su familia, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo, esta satisfecha en el lugar donde se encuentra pues cuenta con sus propios clientes. Solicita el crédito para invertir en su inventario en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jugos, jabón, salsa natura, etc. Sus planes futuros es crecer en productos para su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus metas próximas es preparar a sus hijos  para que tengan un mejor futuro y puedan salir adelante como familia.
texts.en: Luz is 48 years old and she is from Estelí. Her academic level is a bachelor’s degree in accounting, but she also works in commerce. She has a small grocery store that she had for 21 years. She started her business with her own money because she wants to help her family get ahead. In her business, she has her husband’s support. She is happy with its location because the area has its own customers. She is requesting the loan to invest in inventory such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, juice, soap, tomato sauce, etc. Her plans for the future are to offer more products in her business and to satisfy the needs of her customers. Her immediate goal is to prepare her children so they will have a better future and so that they can get ahead as a family.

loans.use: rice, sugar, cooking oil, juices, soap, tomato sauce, etc.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 34 years old, married to Pauline with two children and supports two other family members. Edward has been running a general store for three years, earning a monthly income of 8,600 KES.

This will be Edward's second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to purchase more stock, such as sugar, tea leaves, and household goods. He also plans to reinvest any profits in his business. In the future, Edward hopes to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as sugar, tea leaves, and household goods for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 29 years old, married to Francis and has two children. For the past three years she has sold fresh fruits and vegetables, earning a monthly salary of 9,000 KES. 

This will be Grace’s first loan with KADET. She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan which she will use to grow her business. Her ambition is to use her profits to purchase a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en: Alfonso and his family make artisanal cheese from the fresh milk at his small dairy in Tlaxcala, Mexico. The biogas from his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow him to dramatically cut the energy costs of his small workshop. Thier cheeses will be sold at the local markets, and reducing his costs of production will allow him to be more profitable. The organic fertilizer from his biodigester will help improve his production of organic alfalfa and corn that helps support his dairy and his family, and the waste treatment will allow his dairy to be cleaner and healthier. He hopes that this improved productivity of his cheese making will allow him to continue with this tradition, while also reducing his impact on the environment.

loans.use: To buy a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana is 23 years old, married to Mary and blessed with a six-month-old baby. He provides transport services through his bicycle, a business he began two years ago.  He earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. He wants to purchase another bicycle to boost his business and has requested his first loan in the amount of KES 10,000.

The profit he earns will aid him in repaying his loan and fulfilling the basic needs for his family. His dream is to see his business prosper as well as to bring up a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase another bicycle for transportation.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is married with six children and only three of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (three grandchildren). She sells second hand clothes at the market. She works five days a week. She has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include the rainy season and the increasing prices of clothes in Uganda. She hopes to see her business grow into a wholesale business. She would also like to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a farmer. This is a business/trade she has run for over 10 years. She is married mother of four children. She carries out tree farming in the area. This trade has proved profitable because of the high demand for trees for building and for charcoal. She also carries out animal farming. She started the entire business with one goat that gave birth and she now has three dairy cows.

Chizi was introduced to Milango by an employee and is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Her future goal is to construct a permanent house and increase the number of animals on her farm. 
She believes this will help her pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Natividad tiene 54 años, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, es dueña de una Despensa muy bien surtida, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que siempre se esfuerza por poder salir adelante.
Natividad cuenta que empezó a trabajar en esto hace más de 10 años, debido a la necesidad de contar con un almacén dentro del barrio, y lentamente gracias a su trabajo ha podido ir creciendo.
Ella solicita este crédito para comprar más productos de consumo masivo como arroz, fideo, harina, azúcar, aceite y panificados, de esa forma seguir brindando productos de buena calidad, variados y a buen precio y así aumentar su venta y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Natividad is 54 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. She runs a very well supplied small store, and she is a very hard-working and tenacious woman always making efforts to get ahead in life.
Natividad told us she started working in this field more than 10 years ago because there was a need for a general store in her neighborhood, and little by little she has been able to grow thanks to her job.
She is requesting a loan to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and backed products. Thanks to this investment she will keep on selling high quality products, consequently increasing her sales and her income.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and backed products.

loans.name: Anita Lucia

texts.es:
ANITA LUCIA tiene 35 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con la hija de 5 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

ANITA LUCIA es auxiliar de servicios, además tiene una panaderia. Solicita el crédito para comprar 3 quintales de harina de trigo, maíz, huevos, levadura. 

Con la ayuda del crédito tendra mayor cantidad de materia prima para trabajar en la panadería. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son es darle la educación a la hija. 

El sueño es poder ver que en negocio prospere. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar y ayudar a la hija en las tareas.
texts.en:
Anita Lucia, 35, is single and has a daughter. She lives with her 5-year-old daughter in Guaranda in Bolivar province. Anita Lucia is a service assistant and also has a bakery. She is requesting a loan to buy 3 quintals of wheat flour, corn, eggs, and yeast. 

With the loan, she will have more supplies for her work in the bakery. The challenge she faces is providing for her daughter's education. Her dream is to see her business thrive. In her free time, she likes to take care of her daughter and help her with her homework.

loans.use: to buy 3 quintals of wheat flour, corn, eggs, and yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of beans

loans.name: María Jose

texts.es:
La señora María José es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y carismática de 35 años, casada y madre de dos niños de 5 y 11 años. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y cremas desde hace 5 años. 
Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de productos Avon y después fue invirtiendo en otros productos con el crédito anterior logro aumentar el negocio invirtiendo en mayor cantidad y variedad de productos y su meta es lograr tener una boutique surtida en ropa, cosmética…etc.
texts.en:
María José is a hard-working, enterprising, and charismatic 35 year old woman.  She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 11.

She has been selling clothes, cosmetics, perfume, and creams for five years.  She started this business selling Avon products.  Later she invested in other products.  With her previous loan she was able to increase her business by investing in a greater quantity and variety of products.

Her goal is to manage to have a boutique stocked with clothing and cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Muyoyeta

texts.en:
Muyoyeta runs a small mobile money transfer business in a fishing town called Kalabo. He recently got married and is a proud father of a baby boy who is 21 months old. Muyoyeta is 26 years of old.

Muyoyeta did not complete his high school education due to financial constraints, but this has not stopped him from trying. Now that he owns his own business, he has started attending evening classes so that he can get his high school diploma and set a good example for his son.

He has lived in the town of Kalabo all his life. He says he is happy to finally be able to offer his hometown a way of sending and receiving money that is easy, safe and affordable. When asked what challenges he faces in his business, he points to the fact that he does not have enough working capital to satisfy his customers. He goes on to explain that this is especially a challenge for him because his hometown of Kalabo has no banking services, and so when he runs out of cash, he has no choice but to electronically send all his working capital to a nearby town called Mongu, and have someone send some cash to him via a speed boat. This can take about two hours and he is charged a fee of K 50,000 (about $10). This is money that is meant to be his profit. He fears that should it happen that a boat capsizes, he would lose all his working capital.

Muyoyeta is hopeful that once he gets his Kiva loan, he will be able to serve more customers without the risk of losing all his money and earn more profits to help him finish his education and give a better life to his young family.

In the video, Muyoyeta is being interviewed by a representative from Mobile Transactions Zambia.

loans.use: To increase his working capital so that he can serve more customers and earn more profits

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a 60-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 12 to 38. He describes himself to be a focused and influential man. He operates a retail store where he provides shoe repair service and also sells handmade leather shoes. He has been involved in this business for 39 years. His business is located at a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be low bargaining power from the customer sometimes. He will use the 21,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy a water tank for his family use. Abel had earlier on received loan proceeds of 20,000, 30,000, 30,000, 35,000, 99,000 and 100,000 KES which he managed to repay well. His business goal is to run a shoe manufacturing company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will increase income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Vicente existe un grupo integrado por 10 personas cada una de ellas con una actividad economica diferente, 

María de la Luz vende abarrotes, Susana se dedica a la venta de bisuteria, Zobeida tiene un taller de costura, Paula vende pollo, Margarita vende abarrotes, Yolanda vende antojitos, Isabel vende ropa, Guadalupe vende tacos, Gudelia vende tacos también y Berenice vende comida. Estas mujeres decidieron llamar "La Esperanza" a su grupo ya que ellas tienen la esperanza de que este crédito les dará la oportunidad de mejorar sus vidas.

Isabel tiene la edad de 41, años solo estudio la secundaria y está casada con el señor Raymundo quien trabaja como agricultor. La pareja tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando. Isabel comenta que siempre había tenido la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos. Hace más de 9 años, con el apoyo de su familia, abrió su propio negocio de venta de ropa para dama y caballero en un pequeño local en el centro de su comunidad al cual llamó "Novedades Chelo". Con el paso de los años, el negocio ha prosperado y también ha ganado muchos clientes. Isabel quiere que su negocio continúe creciendo para poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos y darles una mejor vida. Isabel invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de blusas, pantalones, vestidos, short, faldas, ropa interior, camisas, playeras para resurtir su negocio. A Isabel siempre le ha gustado tener mercancía variada y vender ropa para personas de todas las edades ya que piensa que eso es lo que le a ayudado a ganarse a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the community of Vicente, there is a group of 10 members who are involved in different activities. María de la Luz sells groceries, Susana sells costume jewelry, Zobeida has a dressmaker's shop, Paula sells chicken, Margarita sells groceries, Yolanda sells candies, Isabel sells clothing, Guadalupe sells tacos, Gudelia also sells tacos, and Berenice sells food. These women decided to call their group "La Esperanza" since they hope that this loan will give them the opportunity for a better life.

Isabel, 41, only finished high school and is married to Raymundo, who is a farmer. The couple have 3 children who attend school. Isabel says she has always wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and their children studies by going to work. Over 9 years ago, with the help of her family, she opened her own store offering men's and women's clothing in a small space in the center of her community called "Novedades Chelo." During that time, the business has prospered, and she has many customers. Isabel wants her business to continue to grow so that she can pay for her children's education and give them a better life.

Isabel will use the loan to buy a variety of blouses, pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear, shirts, and t-shirts to restock her business. Isabel has always wanted to have a broad selection of merchandise and sell clothing for people of all ages, as she believes this helps her acquire more customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of blouses, pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear, shirts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Saucito 2 Group

texts.es:
Simona es una señora muy trabajadora y cuenta con 54 años de edad, está casada con el señor Octaviano que es empleado de la Secretaría de Educación Pública. La pareja tuvo 6 hijos pero solo una continúa viviendo con ellos, actualmente cursa el 4° semestre en la especialidad de Química por lo que en estos momentos, Brenda, su hija, es cuando más los necesita.

Simona es comerciante, se dedica ala venta de productos Telcel, como: Celulares, Cargadores, Carátulas, tarjetas de tiempo aire (tarjetas prepagadas) entre otras cosas. Tiene tres años con su negocio y quiere hacerlo un poco más grande ya que una de sus metas es poner otras sucursales en las localidades más cercanas de donde ella vive.

Simona es integrante del grupo Saucito 2, grupo integrado por 10 mujeres trabajadoras y responsables que a continuación serán mencionadas junto con cada una de las actividades que realizan. Simona vende productos de la marca Telcel, Levit vende artículos domésticos, Emperatriz vende productos de abarrotes, Santa vende comida, Florencia vende llantas y pinturas para el mantenimiento de autos, María Luisa vende tarjetas prepagadas para celulares, Fabit vende frutas y verduras, Juvencia vende pan, Antonia vende trastes y Victorina vende Ropa.
texts.en:
Simona is 54 years old and is a very hardworking woman.  She is married, and her husband Octaviano is employed by the department of public education.  They have six children, but only one of them, their daughter Brenda, is still living with them and is currently in the fourth semester of a chemistry course. Brenda is there for them when they need her most. 

She sells Telcel products such as phones, covers, chargers and pre-paid cards.  She has been in this business for three years and wants to expand it a little; one of her goals is to open other branches closer to where she lives.

Simona is a member of the group Saucito 2, which is made up of 10 dedicated and responsible women.  Each of the other members is listed below, along with what she sells:

Levit: household items
Emperatriz: groceries
Santa: food
Florencia: tires and paint for cars
María Luisa: pre-paid phone cards
Fabit: fruits and vegetables
Juvencia: bread
Antonia: cookware
Victorina: clothing

loans.use: to purchase cell-phone related products, such as pre-paid phone cards, covers and chargers.

loans.name: Ruth Gardenia

texts.es:
Ruth Gardenia tiene 31 años es soltera no tiene  hijos vive con los padres en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de LOs Rios.

Ella pertenece a la ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas.

Ruth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, las compras las realiza en ventanas y las realiza en la ciudad de ventanas.

El credito solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantres, y abonos la sembrar maiz. El credito le ayudado a suplir las necesidades de la familiares y de la produccion. El sueño de Ruth es sembran as y comprar un terreno.

Ha enfrentado desafios como la lluvia que ha dañado la siembra. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Ruth Gardenia is 31 years old, she is single and she has no children. She lives with her parents in Pueblo Viejo, a canton of the province of Los Rios.

She is a member of Anchoveta (Anchovy), a Communal Bank located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. She engages in agriculture.

Ruth is a farmer and she plants corn. She buys seeds in the town of Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure to sow corn. The loan has helped her in supporting both her family and her production. Ruth dreams of planting more corn and of buying some land.

She has faced many challenges such has the rain that has caused damages to her harvest. In her free time she likes practicing sport.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama La Capilla, está conformado por las señoras Antonia y Petra quienes van a comprar con su préstamo mangos, manzanas, tomates, chiles y jitomates; la señora Porfiria va a comprar perfumes; la señora Ángela va a comprar baterías, ollas, burros para planchar; la señora Reyna va a comprar telas e hilos; la señora Teresa va a comprar dulces paletas de caramelo, pelones y mangos; la señora Victoria Isabel va a comprar zapatos; la señora Deasy va a comprar cosméticos. La joven Deasy tiene 20 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene un hijo varon de un año de edad. Solicitó su préstamo para comprar perfumes, maquillaje, cremas, desodorantes, labiales, etc. porque va a iniciar su negocio de ventas por catálogo para obtener ingresos para su futuro y salir adelante con su familia. A Deasy le gusta este negocio porque tiene la posibilidad de conocer mucha gente. Sus sueños y esperanzas son continuar trabajando y que le vaya bien en su negocio para poder hacer su casa y darle lo mejor a su hijo. Las integrantes del grupo quieren darle a Kiva y a Vision Fund (FRAC) el siguiente mensaje: “Les agradecemos sus préstamos, gracias por confiar en nosotras, no los vamos a defraudar. Nos dan la oportunidad de crecer los negocios y vivir mejor con la familia”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called La Capilla.  Antonia and Petra are members who are going to use their loans to buy mangos, apples, tomatoes, and hot peppers.

Porfiria is going to buy perfumes, and Ángela is going to buy ironing boards and pots and pans.  Reyna is going to buy fabric and thread, and Teresa is going to buy candy, caramel lollipops, “pelones” (a popular tamarind-flavored candy), and mangos.  Victoria Isabel is going to buy shoes, and Deasy is going to buy cosmetics.

Deasy, age 20, is married and has a one year old son.  She requested her loan to buy perfume, make-up, creams, deodorant, and lipstick, etc.   She will do this because she is going to start a business of selling by catalog in order to get income for her future and to get her family ahead.

Deasy likes this business because she has the opportunity to meet a lot of people.  Her hopes and dreams are to continue working and that it goes well for her in her business.  She hopes and dreams of being able to build her house and give her son the best.

The members of the group want to give Kiva and Vision Fund (FRAC) the following message, “We are grateful for the loans.  Thanks for having trust in us, we will not let you down.  You are giving us the opportunity to grow our businesses and to live better with our families.”

loans.use: to buy perfume, make-up, creams, deodorant, lipstick, and nail polish.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es: La  señora  Norma  es  una persona  responsable y  muy  trabajadora  la cual  día  con  día se  esfuerza  para  salir  adelante, se  acerco   con  nosotros  ya que  actualmente  ella  esta  encargada de la  tienda  en  una  escuela de  la  ciudad y  desea  comprar   mercancía   ya  que  nos  comenta  que   le gusta  tener  inventario suficiente  para  cuando  sus   clientes  le  soliciten los  diversos  productos  que  ella   vende, ve  en  el crédito  la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio, agradece  el  apoyo  para  la  realización de  su  proyecto  ya  que    en  diversas  ocasiones se  le a  proporcionado  ayuda  para   hacer  de sus   sueños  una  realidad
texts.en: Norma is a responsible and hardworking person who exerts herself every day so that she can get ahead.  She approached us because she now has a store in a school in the city, and she wants to buy merchandise.  She tells us that she likes to have enough inventory on hand for when her customers demand the various products that she sells.  She sees in this loan the possibility of making her business grow, and she appreciates the support to put her plans into place, because on several occasions she has been provided with help to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: El Pinito Group

texts.es:
Margarito es un hombre trabajador, él cuenta con 46 años de edad y está soltero y por el momento vive solo.
Él es comerciante y tiene una venta de refrescos y está contento porque no es a primera vez que le dan el apoyo, ha sabido salir a delante por sí mismo y para el mismo, con este nuevo apoyo otorgado va a volver a surtir su negocio y además de refrescos va a vender jugos de diferentes sabores y marcas está satisfecho por las ventas de su negocio.

Margarito es uno de los integrante del grupo El Pinito que está integrado por 12 integrantes: 11 mujeres y 1 solo hombre. A continuación serán mencionados y las actividades a las que se dedican: Irenia vende camotes, Irma vende dulces, Araceli vende carne enchilada, Margarito vende refrescos, Epifania vende pozole, Juana vende pan, Gumesinda vende pollos, Prisciliana vende  artículos de plástico, Bernardita vende productos de abarrotes, Santa Catalina vende helados y chicharrones, Julgencia vende ropa y Rogaciana vende pollos.
texts.en:
Margarito is a hardworking, 46-year-old, single man who lives alone. He is a merchant who sells soft drinks. He is happy because this is not his first loan cycle, and he has learned to get ahead with loan support. With the new loan, he is going to restock his business, and in addition to soft drinks, he will sell a variety of juice brands and flavors. He is satisfied with his sales.

Margarito belongs to the communal bank El Pinito, which has 12 members: eleven women and one man.  Following is a list of the activities of the group members: Irenia sells sweet potatoes, Irma sells candy, Araceli sells meat enchiladas, Margarito sells soft drinks, Epifania sells corn stew, Juana sells bread, Gumesinda sells chicken, Prisciliana sells plastic items, Bernardita sells groceries, Santa Catalina sells ice cream and pork rinds, Julgencia sells clothing, and Rogaciana sells chickens.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for his retail business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: El  señor  Benjamin   es  una  persona  muy trabajadora  que se  preocupa  por la estabilidad  de  su familia  el actualmente   trabaja  en una  empresa de la  localidad,  pero  nos  comenta   que  desea  junto  con el apoyo  incondicional de su  esposa   iniciar  un negocio  de  venta  de  perfumes ,  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  obtener  mayores ingresos  los cuales  le  permitirán  ofrecerle  a  su   familia  mayores  comodidades.
texts.en: Benjamin is a very hardworking person who worries about the stability of his family.  He now works for a company in the area, but he tells us that he wants, with the unconditional support of his wife, to start a business selling perfumes.  He sees in this loan the possibility of getting a better income, which would allow him provide his family with more comforts.

loans.use: to buy perfumes

loans.name: Hilda Alicia

texts.es: Hilda  es una persona  emprendedora, la cual día  con día se  preocupa  por  brindarles  una  estabilidad  a  su  familia, nos  comenta  que  tiene  un  negocio  de venta  de  ropa  usada  el  cual  atiende  con mucho  entusiasmo  ya que   este le  permite   generar  ingresos  para  sacar  adelante  a  sus  hijos, es  por ello que  en esta  ocasión requiere  realizar  la  compra  de ropa para   su  negocio  ya  que    considera  que  el  tener   inventario   disponible  para  sus  clientes  es  lo  que  le a  permitido que  su  negocio este  creciendo  cada  vez  mas, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Hilda is an enterprising person who, day by day, is concerned about providing stability to her family.  She tells us that she has a business selling used clothing which she tends to with great enthusiasm, because it allows her to generate income to get ahead with her children.  For this reason, she now wants to buy clothing for her business, because she thinks that having more inventory available for her customers will allow her to grow her business over time.  She appreciates the support provided which will allow her to carry out her plans.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Randall

texts.es:
Randall es  un agricultor  muy joven de apenas 23 años de edad , padre de familia ya , vive en la zona sur del país, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas en la provincia de Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Randall está solicitando un préstamo de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para la compra de semilla de maíz y de frijol , abono granular y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el desarrollo y evitar también que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, El vende la cosecha en una asociación de la localidad y con esto mantiene a su familia y hace frente a otras obligaciones económicas, desea llegar a ser un productor grande y prosperar y tener mayores ingresos y comodidades para él y su familia y para ello hace el mayor de sus esfuerzos en la actividad agrícola 

Para Randall este es su primer préstamo como  socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica. para lograrlo .
texts.en:
Randall is a very young farmer aged 23; he is already a family man and a father, and he lives in the southern area of the country, in Concepción de Pilas in the Puntarenas province. The local economy is based upon fishing and agriculture activities, such as growing tubers, coffee, corn and beans and cattle breeding.

Randall is requesting a loan of ₡600.000 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy corn and bean seeds, pellet fertilizer and fungicides to protect his crops while they grow and prevent fungi from attacking them. He sells his crops in a business association of his community, and thanks to this activity he provides for his family and pays for other expenses. He wants to become a bigger producer and to prosper, to earn more money and give his family more amenities: this is why he engages in agriculture with so much dedication.

This is Randall's first loan as a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A, one of the 150 communal banks that exist in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy corn and bean seeds and agriculture supplies.

loans.name: Giovani

texts.es:
La señora Giovani, es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina”, del Distrito de yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos menores. 	
Lleva 7 años trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela Ramos le ha concedido para hacer crecer su negocio de compra de madera.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 500 pies de madera cedro, 700 pies de madera shihuahuaco, 900 pies de madera capirona,  300 pies de  caoba.
Para mantener su negocio ha tenido que trabajar mucho necesito aplicar nuevas estrategias que le dieron  buenos resultados y le permitieron seguir  creciendo en el negocio el cual trabaja junto a su esposo.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos por los créditos otorgados  para poder seguir  con su negocio, así su   familia esta asegurando el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Giovani is a member of the communal bank "Las Lomas de Yarina," in the Yarinacocha district of the department of Ucayali.  She is 35 years old, married, and has 2 minor children.

She has been taking loans from the Manuela Ramos organization for 7 years, and these have been granted to her for the purpose of growing her wood business. 

With this new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy: 500 feet of cedar wood, 700 feet of shihuahuaco wood, 900 feet of capirona wood, and 300 feet of mahogany wood.

In order to maintain her business, she has had to work a lot.  She needed to apply new strategies to give her good results and allow her to continue to grow the business in which she works with her husband.

Thanks to the loans granted by the Manuela Ramos organization so that she can continue with her business, her family is ensuring the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy wood at wholesale

loans.name: Mercedes Vanessa

texts.es: Mercedes invirtió su credikiva en la compra de productos de belleza para prestar un buen servicio a sus clientes y justamente esto fue lo que logró, porque amplió su cobertura de clientes y  vendió productos cosméticos. En la actualidad sus clientes han solicitado nuevos productos y por eso planea recibir un credikiva, con el que comprará productos de belleza de diferentes laboratorios y cosméticos, así como perfumería, con esta inversión incrementará el surtido, aumentará las ventas y también su clientela.  Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por tener en cuenta a las personas que tenemos negocios y no contamos con mucho capital de trabajo para continuar y con el apoyo de ustedes se nos hace mas fácil. “
texts.en: Mercedes invested her previous loan in the purchase of beauty products so she could offer quality service to her clients, and that is just what she did.  She expanded her customer base by selling cosmetic products.  Her customers are now requesting new products, and so Mercedes plans on getting another loan.  She will use it to purchase beauty products from different laboratories and cosmetics, like perfume.  With this loan, she will increase her stock, her sales and also her clientele.  Mercedes's message to the financial backers is the following: “Thank you for keeping in mind us business owners who don't have much working capital to keep going.  With your help, it is much easier for us.“

loans.use: to purchase beauty products from different laboratories and cosmetics such as perfume.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny, es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas”, del Distrito de Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, su esposo se dedica al transporte públicp de moto car.
Lleva pocos años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, préstamos que ha estado invirtiendo adecuadamente porque le generan ingresos diarios su negocio es el alquiler de moto car.
Con nuevo préstamo  de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprara: un motor,  para armar un nuevo moto car, 1 armazón, y un tanque de moto.
Trabajando con Manuela Ramos podrá implementar su negocio en muy poco tiempo este negocio les sirve para poder criar a sus hijos y vivir sin problemas.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Productivas,” [Productive Women] of Manantay district in De Ucayali Departament. She is 32, married, and has 2 small children. Her husband drives a public motorcar.

She has been receiving loans from Manuela Ramos for a few years.  She has invested the loans appropriately because the daily income they generate for her allow her to rent a motor car. With the new loan of S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles she will purchase: a motor for a new motorcar, a chassis, and a tank. Working with Manuela Ramos, she will be able to get her business going quickly.This business allows her to raise her children and get along without problems.

loans.use: to buy a motor.

loans.name: Jesus Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Jesús del pilar, es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres  Productivas”, del Distrito De Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos menores de edad.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela  Ramos le ha concedido para invertir en su negocio de madera y contribuir económicamente a su familia, esta actividad la realiza en su propia casa. 
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,700.00 nuevos soles tiene destinado comprar 700 pies de madera habilitada de cedro, 300 pies de madera caoba, 400 pies de madera tornillo.
Su negocio cada día está creciendo gracias a su trabajo que muchas veces es muy duro pero no imposible para una mujer trabajadora, Manuela Ramos seguirá apoyándola con los préstamos que solicite, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una aserradero como maestro afilador, de esta manera apoya a la económía familiar.
texts.en:
Jesus de Pilar is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Productivas," in the Manatay district of the department of Ucayali. She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 minor children.

She has been taking loans from the Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years, and these have been granted to her for the purpose of growing her wood business so that she can contribute financially to her family.  She runs this business from her house.

With this new loan of 1,700 Peruvian soles, she will buy: 700 feet of prepared cedar wood, 300 feet of mahogany wood, and 400 feet of tornillo wood.
Her business is growing each day, thanks to the work that she puts in, which is at times very difficult, but it's not impossible for a hardworking woman.  The Manuela Ramos organization will continue to support her with loans that she requests. Her husband works as an employee in a sawmill; he is a master saw blade sharpener, and in this way supports the family finances.

loans.use: to buy wood at wholesale

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela is from Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and single. Carmela used her last loan for her piggery to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan for her banana business to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow up her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito De San Fernando, Departamento De Ucayali. Tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Lleva tres años trabajando con  los prestamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la siembra de frutas, cuenta con una parcela de terreno el cual tiene que mantenerlo bien limpio y abonado para que las frutas puedan producir mejor.
Con este nuevo préstamo de de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 50 kilos de abono,  1 kilo de semilla de papaya, ¼ de semilla de pepinillo, ½ kilo de semilla da sandia, ¼ de semilla de maní, ¼ de semilla de cocona, ¼ de semilla de caigua, y el pago de la mano de obra del personal obrero.
De esta manera está trabajando con los prestamos, espera seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos y crecer mucho más.
texts.en: Ms. Lucinda is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Productivas" (Productive Women) of the District of San Fernando of the Department of Ucayali. She is 58 years old, married, and has three children, all of them grown. She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for three years, and earns a living growing fruits. She has a plot of land which she must keep very clean and well-fertilized so that she may receive better yields of fruit. With this new loan of 1,700 Peruvian soles she will purchase 50 kg of fertilizer, 1 kg of potato seed, 1/4 of gherkin seed, 1/2 kg of watermelon seed, 1/4 kg of seed peanut, 1/4 of cocona seed, 1/4 of caigua seed, and pay the labor costs for workers. In this way she is working with the loans. She hopes to keep working with Manuela Ramos and grow a lot more.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pc2 Mbour Toucouleur Group

texts.fr:
ce Banc Villageois a était créé en 2008,il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même quartier.
Elles sont unies par des liens sociaux et pratiquent la même activité .
Madam Amy est une femme divorcée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de 2 garçons .
Elle fait du commerce de chaussures pré fabriquées et de l’encens,depuis 20 ans.

Amy dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité.
son nouveau crédit de 200000F lui permettra de se payer la marchandise pré citée .
A l'aide de ses bénéfices elle parvient à régler ses besoins financiers et ceux de ses enfants .
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created in 2008. It is composed of women who live in the same district. They are united by social ties and have the same work.

Ms. Amy is a divorced woman, 51 years old, and a mother of two boys. She has been doing commerce in pre-made shoes and in incense for twenty years. 

Amy has good experience in her business domain. Her new loan of 200,000 francs will enable her to pay for the previously cited merchandise.  

Helped by her profits, she manages to meet her financial needs and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy shoes and incense

loans.name: Pc1 Femme Casamancaise Group

texts.fr:
le banc Villageois a était créé le 02/09/2008 . il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même quartier . 
elle son unies par des liens sociaux et font toutes le commerce.
Madame Nancy est une femme marié âgée de 58 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont une fille et 4 garçons ,son nouveau crédit de 200000F lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandise ( encens et du café traditionnel). 
avec ses bénéfices elle parvient a renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois tout en soutenant son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille .
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on September 2, 2008. It is composed of women from the same district. Its members are united by social ties, and they work in commerce.

Ms. Nancy is a 58-year-old married woman and mother of five children, a girl and four boys. Her new loan of 200,000 francs, will enable her to stock up with merchandise (incense and traditional coffee). 

With the profits, she manages to bolster her savings at the banc villageois while helping her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy incense and traditional coffee

loans.name: Ps Mbour Toucouleur Group

texts.fr:
le Banc villageois a était crée depuis le 02/09/2008.il est composé de femmes d'un même quartier.
Ses membres son unies par des relation sociale .Elles font toutes le commerce .
Daba est une femme marié âgée de 39 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont une fille et 4 garçon.
Madame fait du commerce de poisson, depuis plus de 6 ans.
avec son nouveau crédit de 350000F elle va acheter du poisson qu'elle va revendre au niveau de son quartier.
les bénéfice généré par son activité lui permettrons de participer a la dépense quotidienne et de s’occuper de ses enfants .
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on September 2, 2008. It is composed of women from the same district. Its members are united by social ties, and they work in commerce.

Daba is a 39-year-old married woman and mother of five children, a girl and four boys. She has been doing commerce in fish for over six years. 

With her new loan of 350,000 francs, she is going to buy fish, which she will resell in her district. The profits generated from her business will enable her to help cover day-to-day expenses and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria se ha dedicado a su pequeño negocio de venta de arroz de leche, buñuelos el cual vende ambulante, haciendo setenta vasos de arroz de leche y cien buñuelos diario, en donde estos años, ha logrado captar su clientela y que ha sido su medio de cubrir sus gastos a si como el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como carretonero.
Su condicion de vida es sencilla, el cual su meta ha sido la mejora de su casa, que ha venido levantando de concreto, con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en tres ciclos, abanzando a corto plazo. Continuara con el levantamiento de paredes en la parte de enfrente, a si como compra de zinc, perlines si le ajusta para su techo.
texts.en:
Maria worked in her small business as a street vendor selling arroz de leche (rice pudding) and buñuelos (yuca fritters). She made seventy cups of arroz de leche and one hundred buñuelos every day, and in those years, she managed to gain many customers. That business was her means of covering her expenses, along with the support of her husband, who works as a cart driver.

Her living conditions are modest. Her goal has been to improve her house, which she had been building out of concrete. With financing that Afodenic gave in three cycles, she made short-term progress. [With this loan,] she will continue with the building of the front walls, and if her budget allows, purchase metal sheeting and beams for the roof.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (stone, sand, cement, iron, metal sheeting, and beams) and to continue construction.

loans.name: Anita Guillermina

texts.es: Anita Guillermina es una mujer de  69 años de edad casada esta emprendedora tiene su actividad económica la comercialización de venta de chatarra, desde hace  18 años se inicio en dicha actividad con un poco de dinero propio y con el apoyo de su esposo, ha enfrentado mucho desafíos la familia el negocio la salud, tiempo, en la actualidad ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal, el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en el negocio y comprar hierro, latas, aluminios y otros.
texts.en:
Anita Guillermina is a 69-year-old woman who is married. She is an entrepreneur who has a business selling scrap metal. Anita started this business 18 years ago with a little bit of her own money and the support of her husband. She confronts many challenges in her family business, such as health and weather. At the moment, she has demonstrated that she is responsible, hardworking, and has the desire to succeed personally.

Anita wants to invest this loan in her business by purchasing iron, tin, aluminum, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy iron, tin, aluminum, and other materials.

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann is 23 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past five years, Joe Ann has been a farmer and grows a sort of palay (unmilled rice) to earn a living. Joe Ann earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. 

Joe Ann joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to reap a good harvest with her investment and apply appropriate pest-and-insect-killing fertilizer to boost growth and avoid the loss of capital. Joe Ann is planning to expand her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Aidaliz

texts.es:
La señora Aidaliz, es miembro del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina", del Distrito De Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, está  casada y tiene dos menores hijos de 7 y 5 años.
Lleva 1 año trabajando con los préstamos otorgados por Manuela Ramos para hacer crecer su negocio de venta de ropas para damas.
Con ese nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 comprará 1 docena de blusas, 1 docena de ropa interior, ¼  docena de pantalones jeans, 1 docena de polos para damas, ½ docena de polos para hombres, ½ docena de pantalonetas.
Su esposo se desempeña como agente de seguridad y el sueldo es muy poco, por ello Aidaliz decidió emprender su propio negocio.
Gracias a  Manuela Ramos pudo tener su pequeño capital y comenzar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Aidaliz is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Lomas de Yarina" (The Hills of Yarina), which is located in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is married and has two young children, ages 7 and 5.

Aidaliz has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for one year in order to grow her business of selling women's clothes. With this new loan of 1,000 PEN, she will buy one dozen blouses, one dozen undergarments, ¼ dozen jeans, one dozen polo shirts for women, ½ dozen polo shirts for men, and ½ dozen shorts. Her husband works as a security guard, but his salary is very low. For this reason, Aidaliz decided to start her own business. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she was able to acquire a small amount of capital to start her business.

loans.use: to buy various types of garments.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
For over five years in Camanga, Tukuran, Gemma, a 46-year-old married mother of three children has made a living through the operation of a retail business, selling a variety of food and homemade products. She earns 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur has been raising pigs for more than four years and earns 7,570 PHP per month. She’s 28 years old, yet she continues to hang on to her piggery livelihood to provide adequate life for her two children. She is a new member of GDMPC. In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Jocelyn hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is from Militar, Tukuran, Zambo. Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Analiza is married and has two children. Analiza has her own general store which sells daily use products such as sugar, milk, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Analiza has been engaged in her business for three years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

Analiza joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to do business. Analiza is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo [a brand of malted milk], shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Rafael Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja por cuenta propia , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ellos tienen hijos ya todos independientes , don Arturo desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio de ropa , la mayor afectación que se le presento durante este ciclo fue la operación de su esposa , ya que la señora se vio bien mal y tuvo que gastar en medicina , el préstamo lo quiere para comprar más pacas de ropa ya que sus clientes le demanda mas mercadería , pero no tienen el capital suficiente para realizar la inversión . ya que es su fuente de trabajo para sostener su hogar .
texts.en: Arturo lives in the town of Ticuantepe, along with his wife who works on her own.  Their plans are to improve their quality of life.  They have adult children on their own.  Arturo has been selling clothing for several years.  The major challenge he has had during this cycle is his wife’s operation.  His wife was very sick and he needed to pay for medical care.  He needs the money from this loan to buy more packs of clothing now that his customers are requesting additional merchandise.  He doesn’t have sufficient capital to make this investment and this is his source of work to support the household.

loans.use: to buy packs of clothing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is married and a mother of seven dependents. She is 35 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Virginia owns and operates a pedicab transport business. She established the pedicab transport business as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for two years. Virginia requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase pedicab spare parts and accessories. Virginia has been a good member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Virginia wants to purchase more pedicabs to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase pedicab spare parts and accessories.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a married woman with four children. Fe is 42 years old and resides at Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Fe is operating a fishing business venture, selling seafood products including fish, crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother of one child. She is 48 years old and resides at San Carlos, Tukuran, Philippines. 

Elena owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 15,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Recently, Elena joined GDMPC. In the future, Elena wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Carlos , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Carlos desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presento fue la operación de su ojo derecho ya que no podía ir al campo a trabajar y esto afecto grandemente ya que le robaron gran parte del cultivo , el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en: Carlos lives in Ticuantepe, along with his wife who works selling fruits and vegetables to help with the household expenses.  The family’s plans are to improve their living conditions.  Carlos has been raising pineapple for several years and his major challenge has been the operation on his right eye.  It prevented him from going to work in the fields and this affected him greatly because a large part of his crops were stolen.  He needs this loan to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies

loans.name: Mirna Ramona

texts.es:
Mirna, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, vive en una colonia de la ciudad de Olanchito, Yoro. Doña Mirna tiene 20 años de haber establecido su propio negocio en el mercado local donde vende verduras de todo tipo como ser papas, tomate, chile, ayote, remolacha, etc. y  condimentos. Tiene  muchos años de experiencia ella manifiesta que ama su negocio y ya tiene muchos clientes. Es una persona conocida, tranquila y trabajadora. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000.00 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de verduras frescas, granos básicos y condimentos o especias, para aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
Su visión es seguir atendiendo a sus clientes con amabilidad y bajos precios, y hacer crecer su negocio día a día.
texts.en:
Mirna, age 49, is married and has two grown children. She lives in a subdivision in the city of Olanchito, Yoro.

Doña Mirna established her own business 20 years ago at the local market where she sells all types of vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, chili peppers, acorn squash, beets, and other produce, as well as condiments. She has many years of experience. Mirna says that she loves her business and already has many customers. She is a well-known, peaceful, and hardworking individual.

Mirna is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to restock her business with fresh vegetables, basic grains, condiments, and spices so that she can increase her sales and her family income. Her vision is to continue serving her customers with friendliness and low prices. She also wants to grow her business day after day.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables, basic grains, condiments, and spices.

loans.name: La Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
El grupo la divina misericordia está integrado por 7 personas, cada una de ellas con una actividad económica distinta:

Emma: venta de frutas y legumbres.
Miguelina: venta de calzado.
Leonor: club de nutrición. 
Lino: panadería. 
Cristal: estética. 
Felicitas: venta de abarrotes.
Juana: venta de abarrotes.

Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de Vicente, la cual se caracteriza por estar en una región productora de azúcar.

Cristal es uno de los miembros del grupo tiene la edad de 35 años, solo estudio la secundaria y es soltera. Ella platica que como no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar con sus estudios inició a trabajar para ganarse la vida y un poco después decidió tomar un curso para ser estilista e iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio. Después de terminar su curso abrió una estética la cual está ubicada en el centro de su comunidad, ella ya tiene 4 años con su negocio y con el paso del tiempo ha logrado hacer muchos clientes ya que a muchas señoras les gusta su manera de trabajar y la buena atención que reciben. Cristal necesita este crédito para  comprar tijeras, tintes, navajas, alaciadora, secadora, etc. Cristal desea que con esta inversión su negocio continúe prosperando para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Divina Misericordia" (Divine Mercy) is made up of 7 people, each of whom runs a different business:

Emma: fruit and vegetable sales.
Miguelina: shoe sales.
Leonor: nutrition club. 
Lino: bakery. 
Cristal: beauty salon. 
Felicitas: grocery sales.
Juana: grocery sales.

This communal bank is located in the Vicente community, which is a sugar-producing region.
