Cristal is one of the members of the communal bank.  She is 35 years old, only finished secondary school and is single.  She says that since she didn't have the opportunity to continue with her studies, she went to work to earn a living.  Shortly after that, she decided to take a course to become a hairstylist and then started her own business.  After completing her course, she opened a beauty salon in the center of her community.  She has had her business for 4 years, and over time has earned a number of clients.  Cristal's customers like her work and the good service they receive.  Cristal needs the loan to purchase scissors, dyes, razors, a hair iron, a blow-dryer etc. Cristal hopes that with this investment, her business will continue to prosper so that she can offer an even better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, dyes, razors, a hair iron and a blow-dyer.

loans.name: Magie

texts.en: Magie is a 45-year-old resident of Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She has provided the needs of her three children from the little amount of 8,000 PHP she has been gaining monthly from her fish vending business for five years.  Her business is an aid to the income gained from her husband who does fishing. However, this year she joined GDMPC and she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Nohemi Isabel

texts.es: La Sra.Nohemi de 41 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y responsable  vive en casa de interés social hace aproximadamente 8 años, tiene 2 hijos y esta casada con el señor Jacobo ellos trabajan en una  maquiladora de la localidad para así poder sostener los gastos de la familia. El hijo mayor de Nohemi es casado y se independizo, ahora solamente su hijo menor aun esta estudiando y vive con ellos; los  sueños de Nohemi y su esposo es que su hijo menor pueda tener una carrera ya que consideran que es mejor herencia que pueden dejarla y el otro sueño que ellos tienen es tener un patrimonio sólido para cuando estén solos poder tener un lugar cómodo para pasar sus últimos días y poder recibir sus hijos y nietos, por lo cual desea ampliar su vivienda y requiere el apoyo para iniciar la construcción de un cuarto en la planta baja de su vivienda.
texts.en: Nohemi is 41 years old and is a very hardworking and responsible woman who has lived in subsidized housing for about eight years.  She has two children and is married to Jacobo.  They work in a local factory that makes products for export so that they can pay the household expenses.  Nohemi’s oldest son is married and on his own and only their youngest son, who attends school, lives with them.  Nohemi’s and her husband’s dreams are that their youngest son will be able to have a career and they believe that this is the best inheritance they can give.  Their other dream is for them to have solid heritage so that when they are alone they can have a comfortable place to spend their final years and welcome their children and grandchildren.  For this reason they want to expand their home and need support in order to begin construction on a room located on the first floor of their home.

loans.use: to build onto her home.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La señora Jovita es socia Del Banco Comunal  “Las Lomas De Yarina, del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, cada uno con familia.
Es socia re-ingresante, luego de un descanso, quiso volver a Manuela porque necesitaba de capital para  implementar su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas que lleva a vender por los caseríos rio abajo, su esposo  se dedica a la agricultura.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 comprará: 15 paquetes de gaseosas chicas de diversos sabores y marcas, 6 paquetes de agua mineral,  5 paquetes de guaraná, 2 paquetes de esporade, 3 paquetes maltin power.
Manuela Ramos apoya a las mujeres emprendedoras con ganas de salir adelante para apoyar a su familia y poder vivir cómodamente.
Jovita está muy contenta por regresar al grupo y  espera trabajar por mucho tiempo más.
texts.en:
Señora Jovita is a member of the communal bank "Las Lomas De Yarina" from the district of Yarinacocha, department of Ucayali.  She is 49-years-old, is married, and has seven adult children, each one with a family.  She is a renewed member; after a break she wanted to return to Manuela because she needed the capital in order to implement her business of selling carbonated drinks that she takes to sell through the villages downstream.  Her husband makes a living through agriculture.

With this new loan of 3,000 soles she will buy 15 packs of small sodas of a variety of flavors and brands, 6 packs of mineral water, 5 packs of Guaraná (a carbonated drink made in Brazil), 2 packs of Sporade (a sports drink), and 3 packs of Maltin Power (also a sports drink).  Manuela Ramos supports the entrepreneurial women who have the desire to get ahead in life in order to support their family and be able to live comfortably.

Jovita is very happy to return to the group and hopes to work for a much longer time.

loans.use: to buy sodas and water.

loans.name: Edith Adriana

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith es una mujer apasionada por su trabajo, es casada y tiene una hija pequeña que esta actualmente estudia en la primaria, Edith es estilista profesional y reconocida por hacer un trabajo de muy buena calidad.
Entre sus actividades de trabajo también realiza depilaciones, cortes de cabello, tintes.
Dentro de su negocio ella vende productos tales como accesorios, cosméticos, perfumes, zapatos y playeras de marcas reconocidas. Edith solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía y surtir mas su negocio en el ultimo año ella ha incrementado el numero de clientes que acuden a su negocio a realizarse un cuidado personal y esto le ha permitido  incrementar sus ventas y sobre todo su numero de clientes, para ella lo mas importante en su vida es su hija y es por eso que ella lucha todos los días para sostener a su hija y aportar ingresos a la familia.
texts.en:
Edith is a woman who is passionate about her work. She is married and has a small daughter who is currently in primary school. Edith is a professional stylist and is known for doing very good quality work.

Among her work activities she also does hair removal, haircuts, and hair coloring.

In her business she sells products such as accessories, cosmetics, perfumes, shoes and name-brand T-shirts. Edith is applying for a loan to buy merchandise and to further stock her business. In the last year, she has increased the number of customers that visit her business to have personal care done. This has allowed her to increase her sales and especially her number of customers. 

For her, the most important thing in her life is her daughter and that is why she strives every day to support her daughter and contribute income to the family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: May Amor

texts.en:
May Amor is a 24-year-old resident of Panduma, Tukuran. 

She provides her two children’s needs from the little amount of PHP 8,000 she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She has had the business for two years as an aid to the income gained from her live-in partner. 

She is a new member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan from GDMPC Microfinance for PHP 10,000 to buy feeding supplies. 

May Amor wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is married, 38 years old, and has three children. The family lives in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Nora used her last loan to purchase additional fish to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. Now she is taking a new loan, still to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora flor de María, es socia del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Productivas, del Distrito de Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali, está casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, todos con familia.
Lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos que le brinda Manuela Ramos para implementar su negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, cuenta con dos habitaciones fabricadas en madera, ubicadas en la parte trasera de su casa.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 nuevos soles  planea comprar: 5 planchas de triplay, 1 kilo de clavos, ½ ciento de madera amachimbrada, 2 baldes  de pintura.
Su esposo se desempeña como obrero de un aserradero, con su negocio tiene un ingreso mensual fijo no es mucho pero es seguro porque así tendrá la cuota para pagar a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Flor de María is a member of the commuanl bank "Mujeres Productivas" (Productive Women) in Manantay District, Ucayali Department.  She is married and has 3 grown children, each with families of their own.
She has been working with loans offered by Manuela Ramos for two years so she can set up her business renting rooms.  She has two bedrooms made from wood in the back of her house.
With this new loan of 1,000.00 nuevos soles (USD $375), she plans to purchase: 5 sheets of plywood, 1 kilo of nails, 50 pieces of tongue and groove wood and 2 buckets of paint.
Señora Flor de María's husband works in a sawmill.  He receives a fixed monthly incomes.  It's not much, but it's stable and they know they will be able to pay back the loan to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails etc.

loans.name: Asaf Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Asaf” está conformado por solo un grupo de mujeres  que son muy trabajadoras y responsables, viven en un lugar muy tranquilo y pequeño donde la gente se dedica al cultivo de maíz las integrantes del grupo cuentan que el nombre lo eligieron porque lo sacaron de la biblia, no saben con seguridad qué significa, pero les gusta. Se trata de un nombre evangélico y las integrantes creen que era el nombre de una persona que organizaba músicos.

Nos cuentan que el lugar donde viven, San Agustín Mextepec, celebra el día en que el evangelio llega al lugar.
Doña Agustina, quien es una de las representantes del grupo, cuenta que tiene 54 años de edad; está casada desde hace 40 años con el señor Juan quien trabaja en el campo aunque también es comerciante. Doña Agustina se dedica a la venta de jarciería (productos de limpieza) y menciona que empezó vendiendo ranchando (ofreciendo los productos de comunidad en comunidad) cargando los productos en sus brazos, pero ahora la situación ha cambiado ya que tiene puestos muy bien establecidos. Doña Agustina ha solicitado el crédito para comprar más mercancía como vasos de licuadora, cuchillos, tijeras, lasos para tendedero, guantes, cubetas cepillos, etc.

Agustina comenta que la dificultad que presenta es cuando lo delegados o líderes de la plaza no la dejan vender a gusto ya que si no trabajan por dos días o tres días les pueden quitar sus puestos.

A Doña Agustina le gustaría que sus dos hijas, que aun están estudian, ejerzan la carrera que más les guste. Por ejemplo, a su hija Diana le gustaría ser enfermera o doctora y a su otra hija, Esmeralda, le gustaría ser maestra para enseñarles a los niños. Agustina dice que hasta donde ella pueda ayudarlas lo hará, también le guitaría que terminaran pronto la cocina que mandó a hacer para estrenarla.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son: Raquel, quien invertirá en vasos de licuadora; María Angélica quien invertirá en controles y vasos de licuadoras; Felisa, quien comprará lonas de diferentes tamaños y colores; Emma invertirá su crédito en mercería y Norma, en vasos de licuadoras y mercería. Todas ellas están muy agradecidas y contentas por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The “Asaf” group is made up only of women who are very hardworking and responsible. They live in a small and very peaceful area where the people earn their living growing corn. The group's members tell the story that they chose the name because they got it from the Bible. They are not entirely sure what it means, but they like it. It has to do with an evangelical name and the members believe it was a person who organized musicians. They tell us that the place where they live, San Agustín Mextepec, celebrates the day the evangelist came to the place. 

Doña Agustina, who is one of the group's representatives, says that she is 54 years old and has been married for forty years to Juan who works in the countryside although he is also a merchant. Doña Agustina earns a living selling household products and mentions that she began by selling from neighborhood to neighborhood, carrying the products in her arms, but now her situation has changed since she has some very well-established stands. Doña Agustina has requested the loan in order to purchase more merchandise such as blender jars, knives, scissors, clotheslines, gloves, buckets, brushes, etc. 

Agustina comments that the difficulty that presents itself is when the delegates, or leaders of the plaza, don't allow her to sell as she wishes since if one doesn't sell for two or three days they may take one's spot away. 

Doña Agustina would like her two daughters, although they are still in school, to practice the profession they like the most. For example, her daughter Diana would like to be a nurse or doctor, and her other daughter, Esmeralda, would like to be a teacher in order to instruct children. Agustina says that she will help them as much as she can. She also would like for the kitchen she hired someone to build to be finished soon so she may try it out for the first time. 

The group's other members are: Raquel who will invest in blender jars, Maria Angelica who will invest in blender jars and bases, Felisa who will purchase canvas of various sizes and colors, Emma who will invest in sewing supplies and Norma in blender jars and sewing supplies. 

They are all very grateful and happy to have received the loan.

loans.use: to purchase blender jars, cutlery, clotheslines, cleaning clothes, etc.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Raul Gerardo

texts.es: El Sr. Raul de 39 años de edad esposo y padre, vive en casa propia y se esfuerza día a día para mantener a su pequeña y unida familia, mantener su hogar y mas que nada mantener la felicidad al lado de su familia, se dedica a la venta  de artículos varios de segunda mano tales como son televisores hornos de microondas, lámparas, electrodomésticos en general entre otros. La forma de pago de los aparatos que el vende en su negocio varia por  mes o por semana. De los ingresos obtenidos de sus ventas el cubre las necesidades básicas de su hogar como lo son: alimentación, calzado, vestido, educación de sus hijos y pago de servicios al mismo tiempo surte su negocio para poder ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes. El señor raul compra mercancía para su negocio en Estados Unidos, la preocupación de el es que su visa esta próxima a vencer  y solicita crédito para la renovación de ella porque al no poder entrar a los estados unidos le seria imposible continuar con su negocio por no tener donde comprar mercancía que es la única fuente de ingresos en su familia; el  su familia agradecen el apoyo que les puedan brindar.
texts.en: Raul is 39 years old and is a husband and father.  He lives in a home of his own and each day he makes great effort to support his small, united, family and more than anything to keep them happy.  He sells various second hand items, such as televisions, microwave ovens, lamps, small appliances in general, among other things.  Payment for the items he sells varies from weekly to monthly.  He uses the income from his sales to cover the basic household expenses, such as food, shoes, clothing, his children’s education, and basic services.  He also stocks his business to be able to offer new products to his customers.  He buys his merchandise in the United States, but he is concerned because his visa will expire soon and he is asking for a loan so that he can renew it.  He will not be able to continue his business if he can’t travel to the United States to buy items and this is the only source of income for his family.  He and his family are grateful for any support you can provide.

loans.use: renew his visa.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba Luz, continua con su venta de comida, y ahora la venta de cosmeticos, con el fin de poder obtener mejores ingresos para lograr las mejora de vivienda, que junto con su esposo se esfuerzan para este bien, dando a su familia un techo mejor.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara zinc y perlines, para su techo, asi como terminar repellado de paredes, haciendose posible a corto plazo, gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado.
texts.en:
Alba Luz continues selling food, and now also cosmetics, with the hope of earning a better income to be able to make improvements to her home.  She and her husband are working together toward giving their family a better roof.
With this new loan, Alba Luz will purchase corrugated metal and beams for her roof and also finish plastering the walls.  She will be able to get this done sooner rather than later, thanks to the financing that Afodenic has granted.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials: corrugated metal and beams for her roof.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco trabaja en una papelería conocida en la ciudad, es auxiliar y realiza entregas de mercancía en varios lugares de la cuidad junto con su esposa. El  patrimonio de francisco es una de las cosas más importantes ya que será para el futuro de sus dos hijos y para la misma vejez de el y su esposa, su casa necesita algunas mejoras; una de ellas es colocar losa de concreto en la parte trasera de su vivienda, por ello es que solicita el crédito y comenta que estará mas que agradecido por el apoyo que puedan brindar ya que no solo es por una mejora de la vivienda si no un proyecto de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en: Francisco works in a well-known stationery store in the city.  He is an assistant, and he delivers merchandise to various places in the city along with his wife.  Francisco's property is one of the most important things to him, because it will be there for the future of his two children and for himself and his wife in their old age.  His house needs some improvements.  One of them is to put a concrete slab in the back of the home.  He is requesting a loan to do this.  He comments that he will be more than grateful for the support that you can provide, because this is not only a home improvement project, but a project to improve his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo mujeres virtuosas 2 es de ciudad del este, tiene 18 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un marco de unión y de respeto. Ellas se han unido con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias y de esa forma poder salir adelante. El grupo esto en el segundo ciclo, y su deseo es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Digna es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que trata de motivar a sus compañeras del grupo,  a que siempre luchen por sus metas y objetivos. Digna se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo de comidas, las cuales ella misma realiza. Empieza desde muy temprano todos los días y es gracias a ese trabajo que puede ayudar a su familia para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, carnes, jamón, queso, hortalizas y demás insumos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir haciendo sus comidas.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Virtuosas 2" group in Ciudad del Este has 18 members, and all of them work within a framework of solidarity and respect. They have joined together with the aim of helping their families, and in that way being able to move forward in life. The group is in the second loan cycle, and their wish is to reach the program's highest level.

Digna is the group's chairperson, and tells us that she tries to motivate her fellow group members so that they always strive for their goals and objectives.  Digna sells all types of food, which she herself prepares. She begins from an early hour, and it is thanks to that work that she is able to help her family with day-to-day expenses.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy greens, meats, ham, cheese, and other ingredients, so that she can continue making her meals.

loans.use: To buy greens, meats, ham, cheese, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está  soltero,  vive con la abuela    actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos como abonos y herbicidas  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar todos estos insumos y además una máquina para limpiar el monte del café y una bomba de fumigar para mantener en excelentes condiciones la plantación de café y así  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Leonardo, 22, is single and currently lives with his grandmother. With the loan he hopes to purchase supplies such as fertilizers and herbicides and get help from hired hands. He is planning to buy all these supplies and furthermore a machine which will clear the land of coffee plants and a fumigation pump for keeping the coffee plantation in excellent shape, so as to generate more earnings, improve his quality of life and achieve financial stability. This is his first loan from Fudecosur. He has not had any previous loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has provided him the loan with greater ease and at much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing coffee.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana, tiene la edad 31 de  años, está casada y vive con sus tres hijos y el esposo actualmente. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de varios pollos de engorde y además el concentrado para el engorde de los mismos y ayudarse para mejorar la instalación. Ella cuenta con varios pollos a su poder y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio y  darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. Ella  quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y de la familia  y crecer con el proyecto de pollos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Adriana is 31 years old, married and currently lives with her husband and three children.  She plans to use the loan to purchase a number of broiler chickens, animal feed to fatten them up and to help improve her facilities.  Adriana has a number of chickens she is taking care of and her plan is to strengthen her business and give the chickens concentrated animal feed so they fatten up more quickly.  She wants to have her animals at an ideal weight to sell them at the local market and in neighboring areas.  She wants to generate a better profit for her own well-being and that of her family.  And she wants to grow her broiler chicken project.  This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She has never before taken a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chickens.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Josue Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Josué de 26 años de edad es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, responsable con su esposa y sus dos hijos, se encuentra trabajando desde hace 5años en una gasolinera de la localidad como despachador y en su tiempo libre le ayuda a su padre quien cuenta con un negocio de marmolería para poder obtener un ingreso adicional para su hogar. El señor Josue vive en una casa la cual le compro a una tía de el y aun la esta pagando le faltan solamente tres meses para terminar de pagarla y poder escriturarla a su nombre. Para el Sr. Josue su mayor aspiración en la vida es la felicidad de su familia y el patrimonio familiar por eso poco a poco ha ido realizando las mejoras que necesita su casa; solicita el apoyo para acabados interiores y exteriores de un cuarto.
texts.en: Josué is 26 years old and is a hardworking, enterprising, responsible man with a wife and two children.  He has been working as a dispatcher at a local gas station for five years.  In his spare time he helps his father who has a marble business, so that he can earn some extra income for his household.  Josué lives in a home he bought from one of his aunts.  He will finish paying it off in the next three months and he will be able to transfer the deed into his name.  Josué’s main aspiration is for his family’s happiness and heritage.  For this reason he has been making the necessary improvements to the home little by little.  He is requesting this loan so that he can put the finishing touches on the interior and exterior to one of the rooms.

loans.use: to put the finishing touches on a room.

loans.name: Señor De La Agonia De Taray Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Taray en la provincia  de Calca departamento de Cusco.

La socia Felicia tiene 41 años, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía ella vende diferentes tipos de mercadería como chompas, polos, gorros, guantes, entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia, a la vez la socia cuenta con una chacra donde cultiva maíz para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como polos.

Las socias que salen adjuntas en la foto son socias que pidieron permiso para llegar un poco tarde.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de maiz, compra y venta de ganado, tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales, crianza de cuyes.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY communal bank, located in the Taray district, within the Calca province and Cusco department.
 
Felicia is 41 years old, married, and has two children.  She has an arts and crafts business and sells different types of merchandise, such as sweaters, polo shirts, hats, and gloves among other things.  She has been doing this for some time and things are going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts in daily.  She also has a plot of land where she raises corn that she later sells to her customers who request it.  She wants to keep working.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise, such as polo shirts, for her business.

The members added to the photograph had asked for permission to arrive a bit later. 
 
The other members have other businesses, such as selling corn, buying and selling livestock, grocery stores, raising animals and Guinea pigs.

She is grateful for this medium that allows her to get a loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business.

loans.name: La Hacienda Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La Hacienda esta conformado por diez mujeres trabajadoras e indígenas originarias de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. El traje artesanal de dicha ciudad es la blusa blanca con un bordado especial de chaquira, falda larga de colores vistosos y mascada del color de la falda.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Beatris de 27 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de accesorios para dama y regalos desde hace medio año, afortunadamente durante este tiempo siempre ha tenido excelentes ventas. Beatris comenta que no le gusta de su local es la ubicación ya que no esta en un lugar céntrico de la comunidad. Ella comenta que poco a poco fue introduciendo diferentes artículos a sus ventas, primero compró ropa y después accesorios para dama. Una de las primeras experiencias que le ocurrió en su negocio es darse cuenta de que es una mujer capaz de lo lograr lo que se propone. Una de las cosas buenas que le ha ocurrido es contar con la ayuda de Kiva y Vision Fund ya que con su apoyo ha podido seguir con su negocio, y con su ayuda va poder comprar mas accesorios para dama para la venta por menudeo.

Le da las gracias a las instituciones por ayudar a todas las mujeres trabajadoras que tienen sueños por realizar, pero que no cuentan con suficientes recursos para hacerlos realidad.

Las otras integrantes de este grupo son:

Luciana- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Jovita- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Heladia Yolanda - se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Miguelina- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Alicia Elena- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Tomás- se dedica a la venta de productos naturistas.
Víctor- se dedica a la venta de masa y nixtamal.
Floripa- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Ana Margarita - se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Hacienda" and is made up of ten hardworking women who are indigenous to Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. The traditional garb of said city is the white blouse with special chaquira (beaded) embroidery, a long skirt with showy colors and matching scarf. 

One of the members of this group is Ms. Beatris, 27, who earns a living selling ladies accessories and gifts which she has done for half a year. Fortunately during this time period she has always had excellent sales. Beatris comments that what she doesn't like about her sales spot is the location since she is not in a centralized area in her community. She comments that she gradually introduced various items to her lineup. First she purchased clothing and later ladies accessories. One of her first experiences in business was to realize that she is a woman capable of achieving what she sets out to do. One of the good things that has happened is to receive help from Kiva and Vision Fund since, with their support, she has been able to keep going in her business, and with their help she will be able to purchase more ladies accessories for selling retail. 

She thanks the institutions for helping all the hardworking women who have dreams to realize, but who do not have sufficient resources to bring them into being. 

The other members of this group are: 

Luciana- she earns a living selling perfumes. 
Jovita- she earns a living selling traditional Mexican snack foods. 
Heladia Yolanda - she earns a living selling perfumes. 
Miguelina- she earns a living selling prepared foods. 
Alicia Elena- she earns a living selling grocery products. 
Tomás- he earns a living selling natural products. 
Víctor- he earns a living selling masa flour and cooked maize used for making tortillas. 
Floripa- she earns a living selling footwear. 
Ana Margarita - she earns a living selling perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase ladies accessories for sale.

loans.name: Jardines De La Luz Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JARDINES DE LA LUZ”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Antonieta ella es soltera y tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de cafetería, ella prepara desayunos, sándwich, empanadas y gaseosas, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de cafetería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como panes, carne, pollo y verduras.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de ganado, negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de cuyes y negocio de florería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These men and women are members of the JARDINES DE LA LUZ communal bank, located in the city, province, and department of Cusco.

Maria Antonieta is 44 years old, single, and has three children.  She works with her cafeteria business, preparing breakfast, sandwiches, empanadas, and soft drinks.  She sells from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and helps her children get ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand and improve her cafeteria business.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients such as bread, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

The other members have other businesses, such as selling livestock, farming, selling Guinea pigs, and floristry.

[Maria Antonieta] appreciates those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Nuevo Horizonte esta ubicado en la comunidad de Zona Urbana Ejidal y esta 

integrado por 10 personas Hilda venta de comida, Lourdes venta de pollo, Hosanna 

venta de carne, Virginia venta de antojitos mexicanos, Gregorio taller de carpinteria, 

Jesica venta de calzado, Fidel venta de paletas heladas, Adriana venta de antojitos, 

Hermelinda venta de cosmeticos y carmen venta de calzado, las personas que 

integran este grupo se caracterizan por ser muy emprendedoras y unidas.
 
Don Gregorio es uno de los integrantes de este grupo tiene la edad de 34 años, solo 

estudio la primaria, esta casado y  tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela, el platica que 

como no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar su padre le aconsejo que aprendiera un 

oficio, por lo que se convirtio en carpintero, hace un poco mas de 7 años abrio su 

propio taller de carpinteria en su hogar ya que el piensa que se gana mas siendo el su 

propio patron, el esta muy contento ya que con el paso de los años y con su trabajo a 

ganado clientela, Don Gregorio realiza todos tipo de trabajos a base de madera(camas, 

sillas, roperos, puertas, cajoneras, mesas, ventanas, sillones) y algunas personas 

paltican que realiza muy bonitos trabajos, el invertira este credito en la compra de 

maderas, esmaltes, barnis, clavos, pijas, martillo, resistol y pinturas para continuar 

realizando sus trabajos. El desea que con esta inversion su negocio continue 

progresando ya que quiere darles a sus hijos una mejor educacio y calidad vida.
texts.en:
The group "Nuevo Horizonte" (New Horizon) is located in the community of Zona Urbana Ejidal and consists of 10 members: • Hilda sells food. • Lourdes sells chickens. • Hosanna sells meat. • Virginia sells Mexican street food. • Gregorio operates a carpentry shop. • Jesica sells shoes. • Fidel sells frozen popsicles. • Adriana sells snacks. • Hermelinda sells cosmetics. • Carmen sells shoes. The members of this group are known for being enterprising and unified.

Don Gregorio is one of the members of this group. He is 34 years old and only has an elementary school education. Gregorio is married and has two children who are in school. He says that he never had the opportunity to study, so his father advised him to learn a trade. Therefore, he became a carpenter and opened a woodworking shop in his home a little more than seven years ago. He believes that he earns more as a result of being his own boss. Gregorio is pleased with what has transpired over the years and that his work attracts customers. He produces all types of products made of wood (beds, chairs, wardrobes, doors, drawers, tables, windows, and armchairs). Some people rave about his beautiful work. Gregorio will invest his loan in the purchase of wood, enamel, varnish, nails, sandpaper, hammers, glue, and paints so that he can continue his work. With this investment, he wants to continue progressing so that he can provide his children with a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, enamel, varnish, nails, sandpaper, hammers, glue, and paints.

location.town: Zona Urbana Ejidal, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oax

loans.name: El Lindero Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Corrales hay un grupo integrado por 6 personas al cual han llamado El Lindero, ellos han decidido llamarlo así porque las reuniones se realizan en un pequeño rancho que lleva este nombre, el cual se ubica a orilla de la carretera a solo 5 minutos de la comunidad.

Gregoria es uno de los integrantes de este grupo ella tiene la edad de 23 años, estudió hasta el sexto grado de primaria y es soltera. Ella platica que como ya no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar con sus estudios inició a ayudar a su mamá a realizar las actividades del hogar, pero ella siempre tenía la inquietud de ganar su propio dinero y con el apoyo de sus papás comenzó a vender refrescos en su casa la cual está a orillas de la carretera. Gregoria ya tiene 6 años con su pequeño negocio y dice que sus ventas han aumentado y le ayuda mucho la ubicación que tiene ya que los viajeros se detienen a hacerle el gasto, actualmente no solo vende refrescos sino también dulces y galletas. Gregoria está muy contenta con su refresquería y dice que invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de refrescos, jugos, galletas y dulces para continuar con sus ventas. Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continúe creciendo ya que invertirá sus ganancias en la compra de más productos para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Florencia venta de pollo 
Liliana venta de ropa 
Cecilia venta de artículos para el hogar 
Jorge venta de mojarra
María de los Ángeles venta de calzado
texts.en:
In the community of Corrales, there is a group made up of six persons, and they have named it "El Lindero". The members have decided to call it this, because the meetings are held on a small farm that bears this name. It is located beside the highway only five minutes from the community.

Gregoria is one of the members of this group. She is 23, single, and went as far as sixth grade of primary school. She tells us that as she no longer had the opportunity to continue with her education, she started helping her mother to carry out the household chores. But she always felt restless from wanting to earn her own money, and with her parents' support, she began to sell soft drinks in her home, which is beside the highway.

Gregoria has had her small business for six years now, and says that her sales have increased. The location she has helps her a great deal, since travellers stop and buy from her. Now she not only sells soft drinks, but also candy and cookies.

Gregoria is very happy with her snack stand and says that she will invest this loan in the purchase of a variety of soft drinks, juices, cookies and candy, in order to continue her sales. She hopes that with this investment her business will continue growing, as she will invest her earnings in the purchase of more products, in order to help her parents with the household expenses. 

The other members of the group are:

Florencia sells chicken. 
Liliana sells clothing. 
Cecilia sells items for the home.
Jorge sells mojarra (type of sea bream).
María de los Ángeles sells footwear.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks in a variety of flavors.

loans.name: Esmeraldo

texts.en: Esmeraldo lives in Pandahan, SND, Lanao del Norte. He has earned a living through fishing for 10 years, thus supporting the needs of his 5 children. He gets an income of 4,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 53-year-old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his children be successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Esmeraldo borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to repair his fishing boat and provide his children a better education. He is new to GDMPC. His plan for the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Cesar Daniel

texts.es:
El señor cesar es comerciante y padre de un niño de 3 años de edad y en espera de un hijo mas, esta casado con la Sra. Elizabeth formando una hermosa familia.
Su esposa trabaja en una maquiladora de la ciudad y actualmente esta incapacitada por embarazo, cesar se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado, juguetes y muebles de segunda mano. Cuenta con permiso municipal para trabajar en la vía publica trabajando en diferentes puntos de la cuidad. Solicita crédito para compra de productos para su reventa y así poder obtener  los ingresos que necesita ya que esta próximo a recibir a otro miembro de la familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is a merchant and the father of a 3-year-old boy and is expecting another child; he’s married to Elizabeth and they form a beautiful family.  His wife works in an assembly plant in the city and is currently on maternity leave.  

Cesar sells clothes, shoes, toys and second-hand furniture.  He has a municipal permit allowing him to work in the public thoroughfares in various parts of the city.  He’s asking for the loan to buy products to resell to obtain the income he needs since he’s about to welcome another member to his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is married, 41 years of age, and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran together with her 5 kids. Leonila operates a retail "sari-sari" store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and she earns 4,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional goods for her store. She joined GDMPC in 2008. In the future, Leonila will use her income to support her children in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her store.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
El señor José Manuel es originario de la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.

Don José como mejor lo conocen  tiene treinta y tres años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tacos blanditos desde hace once años.
Dice que obtuvo su negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposa Claudia quien lo apoya en lo que necesita, cuando el no puede ir al puesto de tacos que se encuentra en el mercado de la comunidad su esposa va desde la  mañana para no atrasarse en preparar la carne.
Una de las cosas que más le gustan de su negocio es preparar sus tacos con higiene y calidad.
Uno de sus sueños es engrandecer su taqueria  para dejarle un a sus hijos Kevin, Jonatan e Yoset.
Dice que esta muy feliz por contar con el apoyo de apoyo de fundacion  ya que con su ayuda va comprar lo que necesita para engrandecer su taqueria como es mas mesas,sillas,tanques de gas , carnes frías y verduras.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todos los hombres trabajadores y emprendedores.
texts.en:
José Manuel is from the city of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.

Mr. José, as he is better known, is 33 years old and has been selling soft tacos for 11 years.  He says that he got his business thanks to his wife Claudia’s encouragement.  She supports him whenever he can’t personally man his taco stall, located in the community marketplace.  She gets there in the morning so as not to fall behind in preparing the meat.

One of the things he likes about his business is preparing the tacos with quality and cleanliness.

One of his dreams is to expand his taco business so that he can leave it to his children, Kevin, Jonatan, and Yoset.

He says that he is very grateful to be able to count on support from the foundation and this help will allow him to buy what he needs, such as tables, chairs, tanks of gas, cold meats, and vegetables to expand his taco business.

He is thankful to the foundation for helping all hardworking and enterprising men.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en: Lennie is a married woman who has a child. She is 27 years old and resides at Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Lennie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps etc. In 2011, Lennie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Lennie wants to build a house and to finish the study of her child.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela, of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, has been in the business of selling fish for more than 7 years and earns 3,570 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She’s 31 years old now, yet continues to hang on in her fish-selling business to provide adequately for her 4 children. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In order to enhance her business, she is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
Doña Vicenta es uno de los 14  integrantes del grupo Rubí el cual se encuentra ubicado en Acatlán, en el cual su gente se dedica al comercio ya que al ser municipio recibe la visita de muchas personas  de comunidades cercanas, también se realiza  la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar.

Los integrantes de este grupo son: 

Beatriz venta de abarrotes, 
Virginia venta de refrescos, 
Vicenta venta de zapatos y bolsas de mano, 
Francisca venta de ropa, 
Ysabel taller de carpintería, 
María del Carmen venta de cosméticos,
Minerva venta de cosméticos, 
José Manuel venta de cosméticos, 
Sonia venta de ropa, 
Yolanda venta de lencería, 
Emiliano repostería, 
Elizabeth venta de lencería, 
Dulce María venta de comida y 
Elvira venta de cosméticos

Doña Vicenta tiene la edad de 44 años, solo estudio la secundaria y se encuentra casada con Don Pedro que trabaja como Mecánico, ella tiene cuatro hijos pero la mayor ya se casó y actualmente solo dependen de ella tres de sus hijos. Doña Vicenta nos platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y desde que se casó ha vendido diferente tipo de mercancía para no dejar toda la carga a su esposo y ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar.  Actualmente  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bolsas de mano, actividad que lleva realizando desde hace nueve años. Doña Vicenta visita casa por casa en diferentes comunidades. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que realiza sus ventas en su tiempo libre y no descuida a su familia. Doña Vicenta invertirá su crédito en la compra de variedad de bolsas de mano y zapatos para continuar realizando sus ventas. Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continúe creciendo ya que desea que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Vicenta is one of the 14 members of the "Rubí" group, located in Acatlán. Its inhabitants work in commerce, since being the municipality, it is visited by many people from nearby communities. As well, sugar cane is planted and cultivated.

The members of this group are: 

Beatriz: sale of groceries, 
Virginia: sale of soft drinks, 
Vicenta: sale of shoes and handbags, 
Francisca: sale of clothing, 
Ysabel: carpentry workshop, 
María del Carmen: sale of cosmetics,
Minerva sale of cosmetics, 
José Manuel sale of cosmetics, 
Sonia: sale of clothing, 
Yolanda:sale of lingerie, 
Emiliano: pastry sales, 
Elizabeth: sale of lingerie, 
Dulce María: sale of food and 
Elvira: sale of cosmetics.

Doña Vicenta is 44. She only went as far as high school, and is married to Pedro, who works as a mechanic. She has four children, but the eldest has already married, and now only three of her children are dependent on her. Vicenta tells us that she has always liked to work, and from the time she got married, she has sold various kinds of merchandise in order not to leave the entire burden to her husband and to help him with the household expenses.

Currently, she sells shoes and handbags, an activity she has been doing for nine years. Vicenta goes house-to-house in various communities. What she likes best about her business is that she does her selling in her free time and doesn't neglect her family. Vicenta will invest her loan in the purchase of a variety of handbags and shoes, in order to continue carrying out her sales. 

She hopes that with this investment her business will continue to grow, as she wants her children to continue their education and to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 57 years old and married with 9 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation.

Eva is borrowing 21,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 33 years old and married with 1 kid. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more items such as biscuits, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell.

Irene has previously borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from cell-phone repair. She aspires to save enough money to have a mini grocery at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more items such as biscuits, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 69 years old, married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Alberto con 9 años de antigüedad en su negocio es un hombre que le gustan los negocios y tiene una miscelánea, en el negocio le ayuda su esposa la Sra. Rosa.
Jorge tiene 3 hijos menores de edad los cuales están estudiando.
Tiene un segundo ingreso ya que la situación del país no es la mejor el trabaja como repartidor de tortillas de maíz en una conocida tortillería de la comunidad. Para el y su esposa el anhelo y deseo mas grande es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios el nivel mas alto que sea posible por eso y por su familia es que se esfuerza tanto para sacarlos adelante. El crédito solicitado es para compra de material para su negocio. Jorge y su familia agradecen la ayuda que sea posible brindarles
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge Alberto, with 9 years in business, is a man who likes business. He has a small general store and his wife, Sra. Rosa, assists him in the business. Jorge has three young children who are all in school. He also has a second income since the situation in his country is not the best. He works as a delivery man, delivering corn tortillas for a well known tortilla factory in the community. 

For both himself and his wife, their greatest desire is that their children finish their studies at the highest level possible. It is for this reason and for his family that Jorge works so hard to succeed. The loan he has requested is to purchase material for his business. Jorge and his family appreciate the help  provided to them.

loans.use: to buy products for his store.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 47 years old and married with 1 child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Mercy is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy medicines and feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns additional income from a general store.

Sarah is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more materials to repair her fishing boat for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 41-year-old woman living in San Carlos, Tukuran. She has provided for the needs of her child from the small sum of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) she has been earning monthly from her fish-vending business for the past 7 years. Her business is an aid to the income her husband earns from fishing and farming.

In 2011, Mary Jane joined GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: La Ceiba (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se  llama La Ceiba y se integra de  seis señoras quien cada una se dedica su respectiva actividad y vive en una colonia llamada Luis espinosa que esta  una hora de Tecpatan.
Quien se le  tomo la entrevista se llama  Elsy  quien es casada con el señor   Saúl con quien   procreo una hija  quien a un  está a su responsabilidad   y  tiene seis años de edad.
Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra   y venta de pollos y pavos de rancho en donde lleva trabajando  treinta y un  años  y cinco  meses  en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  a estado  saliendo  adelante con su pequeña familia.
Inicio con esta actividad  para apoyar a su  esposo con los ingresos de la casa y así también comprar las cosas necesarias en su hogar  y juntos aportar dinero.
Lo  que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando  para así seguirá poyando a su hija que está por iniciar por salir de preescolar   y entran de primero en la primaria.

Quienes integran en el grupo  son: Leila Yolanda quien invertirá en la compra y venta de cosméticos de la marca Jafra, la señora Normaida invertirá en la compra  y venta de pollos de rancho, la señora Candelaria invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de quesos, la señora Leticia invertirá en la compra de pollos de granja para venderlo  destazado y la señora Margarita invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Ceiba” and it’s composed of six women each with her own activity.  They live in a neighborhood called Luis Espinosa that’s an hour away from Tecpatan.

Elsy’s the name of the one who was interviewed.  She’s married to Saul and they have a daughter who is still their responsibility; she’s six-years-old.

She requested the loan to buy ranch-bred chickens and turkeys.  She’s been working for thirty-one years and five months and comments that she does well in that with it she and her small family has been getting ahead.

She started this activity in order to help her husband with household income and also to buy things needed in the home and to contribute money together.  What she wants with her small activity is to be able to continue working to continue supporting her daughter who is about to finish pre-school and start first grade.

The members of the group are: Leila Yolanda who will invest in her business buying and selling Jafra brand cosmetics, Normaida who will buy and sell ranch-bred chickens, Candelaria who will buy ingredients needed to make cheese, Leticia who will buy ranch-bred chickens to sell by the piece and Margarita who will buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married and a mother of 3 dependents. She is 33 years old and lives in Upper Bayao, Tukuran. She owns and operates a pedicab-transport business, which she established as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 2 years.

Juvy requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase pedicab spare parts and accessories. She has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, she wants to purchase more pedicabs for her business.

loans.use: to purchase pedicab spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal SEMBRANDO; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Evarista  tiene 45 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en un salón de belleza, la socia es cosmetologa, ella trabaja todos los días desde las 10:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente, la socia lleva años en este trabajo siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante su familia, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su hogar como arroz y azúcar.

Los otros socios se dedican a brindar el servicio urbano, dictando clases a domicilio, imprenta, transportista, tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ‘Sowing’ Communal Bank; they are located in the Wanchaq district in the Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

The member, Evarista, is 45 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children. She works daily in a beauty salon, as a cosmetologist and works from 10:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. She has worked in this field for several years and it is the way that she helps her family. Evarista is a very happy and responsible person.

The member needs the loan to buy some items for her home like rice and sugar.

The other members of the communal bank provide services like home schooling, printing, transportation and a grocery store.

Evarista is thankful for this medium which allows her to receive a loan and is committed to meeting all of her payments.

loans.use: buy some items for her home like rice and sugar.

loans.name: Josefinas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Josefinas está integrado por 11 mujeres y se encuentra ubicado en una zona que además de ser cañera su gente se dedica a la recolección de resinas de los arboles de hule, los integrantes de este grupo son: Norma Elena venta de bisutería, Socorro venta de artículos para el hogar, María Basilisa venta de antojitos mexicanos, Maricruz venta de bisutería, Sandra venta de ropa, Margarita venta de dulces, Magdalena venta de abarrotes, Yaracet venta de calzado, Adoradila Venta de abarrotes, Yesenia venta de pollo, Victoria dulces y frituras.

La señora Adoradila es una de las mujeres del grupo tiene la edad de 42 años, estudio solo la primaria y está soltera. Ella platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar pero que hace poco más de dos años abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa, primero inicio vendiendo refrescos y dulces pero poco a poco la ha hecho crecer y actualmente también vender abarrotes. Ella  dice que decidió poner su propia tienda de abarrotes para ganar un poco de dinero extra y así ayudar a sus padres además de que ella se ha dado cuenta que es un buen negocio ya que siempre se vende aunque sea un poquito. Ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, arroz, jabón en polvo, jabón de barra, cloro, shampoo y pasta dental para resurtir su negocio, sus clientes estén satisfechos ya que siempre  encuentren lo que buscan. Ella se encuentra muy contenta y nos dice que espera que su negocio prospere más día con día.
texts.en:
The “Josefinas” group has 11 women and is located in a zone that besides being sugarcane producing area the residents also work collecting resin from rubber trees.  The group members are: Norma Elena who sells costume jewelry, Socorro who sells items for the home, María Basilia who sells Mexican fast-food snacks, Maricruz who sells costume jewelry, Sandra who sells clothes, Margarita who sells candy, Magdalena who sells groceries, Yaracet who sells shoes, Adoradila who sells groceries, Yesenia who sells chicken and Victoria who sells sweets and fried snacks.

Adoradila is one of the women in the group; she’s 42-years-old and only went to elementary school and is single.  She relates that she’s always liked to work but that a little over two years ago opened a small grocery store at home.  First she started selling soft-drinks and candy and gradually has made it grow and today she also sells groceries.

She says that she decided to open her own grocery store to earn a little extra money to help her parents.  Besides, she’s noticed that it’s a good business because she always sells even if it’s just a little bit.

She needs this loan to buy soft-drinks, rice, powdered detergent, chlorine bleach, shampoo and toothpaste to restock her store.  Her customers are satisfied because they always find what they are looking for.  She is very happy and tells us that she hopes her business will progress more each day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom is 42 years old and a married mother of eight, six of whom live with the family and are still in school. Rom and her family live in a village of the Dambae District, where a common business is growing cassava. She and her husband have been growing cassava and farming rice for over twenty years. On average, they make about 24 U.S. dollars per day from their business. The business usually struggles when flooding depletes their crops and/or there is no rain.

Rom has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, and her first loan was in 2011. The previous two loans helped her to feed her family sufficiently and have enough money to buy farming equipment. Rom is now applying for another loan from VisionFund, having successfully repaid her second loan. She is planning to use the new loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline for her water pump and to pay for land preparation and labor fees. She strongly hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and hence sell it for a higher price. This would allow her to set aside some money in savings for her family's future needs.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation, labor fees, fertilizers, and gasoline for a water pump

loans.name: Maria Lorenza

texts.es: María de 72 años es una mujer casada que tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 31  a 45 años. Ella vive al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla  y se dedica a la preparación y venta de bollos, un amasijo de maíz, envuelto en los capachos de la mazorca y que  ella prepara  con queso, o anís  y ofrece a clientes que tienen pequeños negocios como venta de perros calientes, refrigerios, tiendas y otros establecimientos de comidas rápidas. Su idea emprendedora ocurrió hace muchos años, cuando identificó en su barrio, oportunidades de emprender su propia aventura de negocios, debido a que estaba rodeada de una gran cantidad de establecimientos comerciales, dedicados a la venta de alimentos. Con ellos inició poco a poco y en la actualidad produce diariamente 120 bollos. Su meta  mas adelante es mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y también comprar un molino eléctrico que haga más eficiente su trabajo.  Su mayor desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para invertirlo y conseguir el crecimiento de su negocio esperado. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, para aumentar su producción y tambien comprará una estufa industrial,  con la cual hacer más efectivo su trabajo, pues con ella mejora sustancialmente las condiciones productivas.
texts.en:
María is 72, married, and has six children, ages 31 to 45. She lives south of the city of Barranquilla, and prepares and sells bollos, a snack made of ground corn wrapped in corn husks, that she prepares with cheese or aniseed and offers to her customers, who have stores and small businesses selling hot dogs and refreshments, as well as other fast-food stands.

Her entrepreneurial idea came to her many years ago, when she identified opportunities in her neighborhood for launching her own business venture, due to the fact that she was surrounded by a large number of commercial establishments selling food. With them, she began little by little, and currently produces 120 bollos daily. Her goal for the future is to improve her housing conditions and also to buy an electric mill that will make her work more efficient.

Her greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to invest and to obtain the hoped-for growth of her business. This, simply, is the reason why she is applying for her credikiva loan, the first she is taking out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Through the loan she will buy raw materials for increasing her production, and also an industrial stove. The stove will make her work more effective, as with it, she improves her productivity substantially.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to increase her production, and also to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Campanitas De Oro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Campanitas de Oro esta integrado por nueve personas trabajadoras, originarias de la ciudad de Santiago Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca cuyo baile mas representantito es la chilena.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Emiliana de treinta y cinco años de edad, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panques, pasteles y roscas de reyes. Inicialmente Emiliana vendía cenas y pollos en su casa y con la ayuda de Vision Fund (FRAC) y sus ganancias comenzó a vender panqués. Tiempo después sus clientas le pedían pasteles y al notar que realmente eran deliciosos le pidieron que hiciera más pasteles y los vendiera por rebanadas ya que ellas le iban a comprar todos los días. Con el crédito, Emiliana va a comprar más ingredientes para la elaboración de pasteles y panqués como harina, huevo, leche, mantequilla, frutas y merengue.

Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudarla para que pueda seguir con su pequeño negocio.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

Andrés Ángel- se dedica a la venta de joyas.
Maricela- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Elizabeth- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Feliciano- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Carmen- se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Nancy Fabiola- se dedica a la venta de chiles y semillas.
Miriam del Carmen- se dedica a la venta de comida.
María del Carmen- se dedica a la venta de calzado.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion Realidad por apoyarlas para que puedan alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called the ‘Golden Bells,’ it is made up of nine hardworking people. They are originally from the city of Santiago Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca whose most representative dance is the chilena.

One of the members of this group is Mrs. Emiliana, she is 35 years old and works making and selling pies, cakes and king cakes. At first Emiliana sold dinners and chickens in her home with the help of Vision Fund (FRAC) and with her earnings she started selling pies. Some time later, her customers asked for cakes and Mrs. Emiliana noticed that they were delicious and her customers demanded more cakes and to sell them by the slice since they would buy from her each day. With the loan, Emiliana will buy more ingredients to make pies and cakes like flour, egg, milk, butter, fruits and meringue.

She is grateful to the foundation for helping her keep her small business growing.

The other members of the group are: Andrés Ángel- sells jewelry. Maricela- sells clothing. Elizabeth- sells clothing. Feliciano- sells food. Carmen- sells fish. Nancy Fabiola- sells chilies and seeds. Miriam del Carmen- sells food. María del Carmen- sells shoes.

They are all grateful to the Realidad foundation for helping them reach their dreams.

loans.use: buy more ingredients to make pies and cakes like flour, egg, milk, butter, fruits and meringue.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian de 21 años de edad es un joven productor musical y comerciante a la vez, él estudió la carrera de producción musical, como pocos lo hacen,  en una Corporación y para generar ingresos trabaja en ella, pues desde que inicó lo ha consierado como una buena oportunidad de negocio; también buscando opciones de financiar su tarea musical, empezó a ofrecer productos mediante guías especializadas, porque su sueño es tener un estudio especializado de música, para ser feliz y poder apoyar el bienestar de sus padres. Su meta es mejorar su estructura musical y responder a pedidos de mercancías, que llegaron en sus catálogos con descuentos, pero su capital de trabajo ante el cumplimiento de sus metas se traduce en un gran desafío. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual lograr ensanchar su producción musical, mediante la configuración audiovisual, desde allì empezará objetivamente su camino hacia al ascenso de su gran meta como productor de musica.Microfonos, parlantes,para la acustica, equipo el nilcer control del volumen del CD que le manda a edictar ael cliente, hace fotoshop, caratula con fotos y publicidad
texts.en:
Cristian, age 21, is a young music producer and salesman as well.  He majors in musical production in school, though very few do so, at a Corporation and to bring in income, he works in the field. Ever since he started, he has considered it a good business opportunity; also looking for ways to finance his music work, he started to offer sales by catalog.  His dream is to have a specialized music studio to make himself happy and to help him support his family's well-being.

His goal is to improve his musical set-up and to respond to the demands of the market, which came at a discount through his catalogs, but his working capital stands as a large impediment to achieving his goals.  Currently, he is applying for a micro-loan, with which he will expand his musical production capabilities by means of an audiovisual configuration.  From there, he will really begin his road to achieving his greatest goal of becoming a music producer.  Microphones, speakers for the acoustics, software to control the volume of the CD that he sends for editing to the customer, which does Photoshop and cover art with photos and publicity.

loans.use: to buy microphones, speakers, and equipment and to invest in publicity.

loans.name: Costa Brava Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Costa Brava esta conformado y esta conformado por siete personas trabajadoras, originarias de la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca  donde la mayoría de las personas gente indígena que habla en idioma mixteco.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Clemencia de cincuenta y ocho años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora trabajadora y humilde, que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos en las noches, venta de refrescos y pescados frescos y asados. Dice que lleva con su negocio veinte años y lo que mas le gusta es hacer sus tortillas a mano. Cuenta que inició vendiendo atoles, tamales y aguas frescas en su casa y posteriormente decidió vender antojitos mexicanos con refrescos. Dice que con el paso del tiempo y con sus ganancias también compró productos naturistas para venderlos con sus vecinas, familiares y amigos. Doña Clemencia dice que con la ayuda de Vision Fund va a comprar más productos naturistas para la venta. Clemencia le da las gracias a Kiva y Vison Fund por ayudar a la  gente mixteca.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son
Maideli Sofia- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Martina- se  dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Evarista Flora- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Josefa Rufa- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ricardo Sixto- se dedica a la venta de carpintería.
Luis Javier- se dedica a la venta de pescado.

Todos ellos también agraceden a la institución por ayudar a la gente indígena.
texts.en:
This group is called the ‘Rough Shore’ it is made up of seven hardworking people originally from the city of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca where the majority of the indigenous people speak the Mixteco language.

One of the members of this group is Mrs. Clemencia, she is 58 years old and is characterized for being a hardworking and humble woman. She sells Mexican treats during the night as well as refreshments, fresh and roasted fish. She has had her business for some twenty years and what she enjoys most is making her tortillas by hand. Mrs. Clemencia says that she began her business selling atoles (a corn starch drink), tamales and fresh juice in her home and later decided to sell Mexican treats with refreshments. She says that as time passed and her earnings increased she bought natural medicines to sell to her neighbors, family and friends. Mrs. Clemencia says that with the help from Vision Fund she will be able to buy more natural medicines to sell. She is grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund for helping the Mixteca people.

The other members of the group are: Maideli Sofia- sells clothing. Martina- sells refreshments. Evarista Flora- sells refreshments. Josefa Rufa- sells clothing. Ricardo Sixto- is a carpenter. Luis Javier- sells fish.

All the members of the group are grateful to the institution for helping indigenous people.

loans.use: buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to make earrings, bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Katia Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Katia Victoria de treinta y cuatro años de edad, es originaria de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca donde una de las actividades económicas es la cría de ganado bovino, caprino, caballar y en menor porcentaje la cría de aves de corral.

Doña Katia, como mejor la conocen, se dedica a la matanza de res desde hace siete años y está muy feliz ya que este negocio lo inició su esposo Carlos. Dice que obtuvo este negocio gracias a su esposo Carlos, quien desde hace diez años ya se dedicaba a la matanza, pero por desgracia falleció y ella se quedó a cargo de la carnicería que se encuentra ubicada en el mercado de su comunidad.

Doña Katia menciona que una de las características que debe tener una persona para realizar su trabajo es ser carismática con las personas, tener una buena amabilidad para que las personas vuelvan a comprarle y sobre todo ser una mujer fuerte que le guste el trabajo pesado. Dice que con la ayuda de Kiva y Vision Fund (FRAC) va a comprar más res para la matanza. Le da las gracias a las instituciones por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras con deseos y fuerzas de superación.
texts.en:
Katia Victoria, 34, is from Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca where one of the economic activities is raising cattle, goats, horses and to a lesser degree barnyard fowl.

Doña Katia, as she’s better known, has worked butchering beef for seven years.  She’s very happy because her husband, Carlos, had started the business.  She says that she got this business thanks to her husband, Carlos, who had been a butcher for ten years but unfortunately he died and she was left in charge of the butcher shop that’s located in her community’s market.

Doña Katia mentions that one of the characteristics a person must have to do her work is to be charismatic with people, to be kind so that people will return to buy and above all to be a strong woman who likes heavy work.  

She says that with help from Kiva and Vision Fund (FRAC) she will buy more cattle to butcher.  She thanks the institutions for helping working women with the desire and the strength to improve.

loans.use: to buy cattle to butcher.

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en: Rodella, 38-year old, is a local manicurist and pedicurist in the town of Panduma, Tukuran. She has 4 children and a husband who does fishing for a living. She has been doing this for 7 years and she makes 7,000 monthly. Due to frequent use, she needs to purchase new sets of nail polish. Thanks to GDMPC microfinance for the new loan of 10,000, she is able to acquire all those materials. Being positive for the future, she longs to be well-known so she can expand in some neighboring areas.

loans.use: to purchase new sets of nail polish.

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Martha Verónica es una señora, trabajadora y creativa, originaria de Santiago Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca donde una de sus artesanías son la elaboración de juguetes y diversos artículos de madera, machetes y hamacas.
Doña Martha, como mejor la conocen, dice que se dedica a la venta de cadenas, aretes, collares y esclavas de plata desde hace  siete años.
Cuenta que antes que tuviera ese negocio se dedicaba a la venta de calzado por catalogo, pero siempre había querido comprar plata para la venta ya que observaba que sus  clientas compraban muchas pulseras  para combinar con su calzado y decidió vender artes, collares y anillos ya que le parecía un buen negocio.
Con el paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que su negocio le deja buenas ganancias y puede administrar su tiempo para no descuidar su negocio ni su familia.
Dice que esta muy agradecida con fundacion por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras, ya que con su ayuda va poder comprar mas plata en aretes, anillos, collares y pulseras para la venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Verónica is a hardworking and creative person originally from Santiago Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca where she sells artisanal goods like toys and several items made from wood as well as machetes and hammocks.

Mrs. Martha as she is most well known, says that she has sold chains, earrings, necklaces and silver bangle bracelets bangle for about seven years.

She says that before she had this business she sold shoes by catalogue but she always wanted to buy silver to sell since she says that her customers bought a lot of bracelets to match their shoes and decided to sell art, necklaces and rings that would be good for business.

As time passed, Mrs. Martha noticed that her business gave her a good income and she could manage her time better to care for her business and family.

She says that she is very grateful to the foundation for helping hardworking women since thanks to your help she will be able to sell more silver earrings, rings, necklaces and bracelets to sell.

loans.use: buy more silver to sell.

loans.name: Fe Y Eperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe y Esperanza está integrado por 5 mujeres muy unidas y responsables y está ubicado en la comunidad  de Palma Cuata en  la cual a pesar de ser una comunidad grande no hay transporte y la única maneras de llegar es pidiendo ray  o pagando viajes especiales. 

Los integrantes del grupo son: Isabel venta de plantas, Fidelina venta de refrescos, Margarita venta de ropa,  Coral venta de ropa  y  Angélica venta de calzado.
